review.des: Hands down the best BBQ in the world, I travel all over and have never found a place that even comes close to this place and I'm talking better then St Louis, KC and definitely Memphis. This is a must go to place when in Chicago. Everything is good so try it all.
Love their food and that they are in Old Irving Park. If you don't know that you can order just a taste of many of the meats then you should try it.

pics.caption: Obvi Takeout: Chopped Brisket platter with chili, fries and corn bread subbed for coleslaw

review.des: Really good BBQ pulled pork. It's a hidden gem in the heart of Logan square and it's usually packed. Their food is awesome like their cole slaw and baked beans.
Food was pretty good. Not my favorite spot in town but good! Parking is off of the street, and seating is limited, but my LO loved the Mac n cheese and the corn bread and honestly it was quite yummy!

I just thought it was OK.  The atmosphere was that of a backyard patio and that's ok for BBQ but I wasn't impressed enough with the food to want to steep myself into that realm.  I would say the place is "just a'ite."

Two things to preface: 1) I love BBQ and, as a result, have a pretty low threshold for a 5-star review; 2) My favorite BBQ in Chicago (and that of many other Yelpers) is Green Street Smoked Meats, so I'm going to (potentially unfairly) write this review in this context. Overall, Green Street has better sides and a better non-food experience; Smoque has better meat and better price points. But both are *amazing* and you cannot go wrong with either.

ATMOSPHERE/SERVICE: Whereas Green Street presents itself as the trendier location-- barn/warehouse decor, West Loop locale, etc., Smoque is more of a neighborhood joint. It's in a more residential area, with plenty of parking on side streets (there's even a small parking lot, suburban style!). The interior is pretty bare-bones, like countless BBQ joints in the South. It's more authentic, but, at the same time, I'm a bit of a sucker for the warehouse vibe, and it's a little more unique. Both places can have long lines for food, but Smoque has more limited seating and kind of botched our order at first. Edge: Green Street.

SIDES: Green Street's beans are the best. Smoque's are smokier, but less complex and tangy, and maybe a little watery. Still good. Smoque's cornbread is tasty but small. Their coleslaw is vinegary (a plus) and full of raw onion (which I found to be not great). Their mac n cheese is tasty, but I'm not a mac n cheese guy with BBQ. Green Street's sides are more varied and bigger. But neither place has collards! WHERE ARE THE COLLARD GREENS, GUYS?! Edge: Green Street.

MEAT: I have really only had sliced brisket at both places. Green Street's, while very tasty, is not as good as Smoque's. Why? The fat. Smoque's brisket (at least the slices I got) was laced with amazing, melt-in-your-mouth smoked fat. If I could, I'd order their fat trimmings and spread it on a cracker or eat it with a spoon. Don't go to Smoque if you think that saturated fat is really bad for you.

$$: Smoque is cheaper. Also, it's BYOB (but only indoors).

I'd say: go to Green Street if you're not so much into BBQ as you are into the sides and/or your main purpose is for the social aspect of eating out. Go to Smoque if you are serious about your smoked meat product.

Extremely excellent food. The smoked sausage, and the beef brisket was absolutely amazing. The brisket just fell apart before you went to put it into your mouth. No wonder they have absolutely amazing reviews. Highly recommend this place
Favorite brisket and Mac are fire  everything is excellent and definitely deserves all the critical claim it's Chicago's best BBQ overall
Overrated. Portions are very small. Don't get me wrong, the food is really good but I've had better ribs elsewhere. If you could get bbq ribs at a French restaurant, this would be it.

The BBQ here tastes great, I would definitely come back for their food. The joint is very casual and you order before grabbing a number and a table. Great environment to have a relaxed and delicious meal with your friends and/or family.

Sliced Brisket: The highlight of my meal! Tender, melt-in-your-mouth meat that goes great with the BBQ sauce. Highly recommend.

Peach Cobbler: I love me a good peach cobbler and Smoque has got a well balanced dessert here.

Sliced Brisket
Cornbread and Peach Cobbler

review.des:
As a meat lover, I was really looking forward to this place with over 3K reviews and 4.5 stars.. unfortunately I might have been too excited and it just didn't wow me enough.

The layout is simple enough. Order at the cashier, sit down, wait to hear your number, get up and get your food. I've always preferred restaurants this way rather than being waited on.

I was feeling undecided between brisket and ribs so I got the 1/2 slab of baby back ribs and added brisket for just $5.00 more. I also got 2 sides of brisket chili and bbq beans.

My boyfriend ordered a brisket sandwich and got mac and cheese. He really liked both.

~I asked the cashier what the difference was between St. Louis style vs. baby back ribs and was told that the St. Louis style was the leaner meat while the baby back would be more fatty. That sold me on choosing the baby back ribs.

I had a $10 off coupon which brought the price down to ~26 for the both of us, which is not bad for BBQ at all.

What I found lacking was just the wow factor..like..it tasted like meat, which was nice and all I'm really looking for I guess. Would I come back? Only if I was going with other people who really wanted to.

review.des:
Ahhh..   ugh...  My heart...  I think I might die while writing this review.  So good....  Too good...  The best bbq in Chicago, bar none.  Everything is great.  The brisket, the ribs, the mac and cheese, the pulled pork, the pecan cake, and of course the corn bread, everything is good enough to endorse.

The line was fast and efficient, the staff was incredibly friendly.  Free refills and food to literally stop your heart.  I feel like I can't come back for at least a month, but now every time I'm in the city on I-90 I'm going to think about stopping here.

TL;DR: I beg you to try them.  Just eat here.

Smoque has become a fairly frequent stop for me on Chicago trips - it's easy to do since it's right off the blue line, but more importantly it's damn tasty.

Everybody has already waxed poetic about this joint, so I don't have a whole to do other than to add to the chorus about Smoque having some great brisket, pulled pork and some pretty good baby backs as well. Sides, for the most part, hit the spot too. Sadly, they don't serve any beer to wash down your BBQ, but it is BYOB (inside only).

I have yet to stop by at a time where there hasn't been at least a 30 minute wait, but the staff have things down to a science and are friendly. If you're not planning to dine in call your order in ahead of time and skip the line - seeing people walk in then back out with boxes of BBQ in minutes always makes me jealous while I stand in line like a sucker.

This restaurant has been on my list for quite a while! I also heard about it on the tv show and told a friend about it. They really recommended this place and I went along with my sister. Something I would suggest from the beginning would be to order ahead of time and then just eat outside. The wait was quite a bit to order and then go get out food. It's a decent sized place. But there is alwayyysss a line. From the moment we got there to the time we left there was still a line out the door. I ended up getting the St. Louis half rack with corn bread and Mac and cheese as sides, which were anazinngggggg. You could really taste the smokiness of the ribs. I also had the peach cobbler which is a MUST try! My sister ended up getting the sliced brisket which was incredibly tender and juicy. If I were to do it again I'd get the brisket!

pics.caption: St. Louis Ribs
Brisket

review.des: I don't understand the hype about the place. This is basic barbecue, nothing special.

Visiting Chicago, had to find a bbq place. Good reviews and highly recommended. Well was not disappointed. I got the brisket plate, fiancé got the 50/50 sandwich. Everything was great. Really nice staff.

A great place for BBQ. Traditional BBQ place with chalk boards for the menu, order at the counter and come pick it up. The food was awesome, some of the better BBQ I've had (and I love BBQ) so I was happy I found it.
Everything is great here except the line lol . I'm a big coleslaw fan and there's is so sweet and interesting that it's one of my recommendations to people to definitely try.
The ribs are great!!!  So is the chicken. The sausage is to die for. Many choices for sides. The mac & cheese, cornbread and slaw were really good!  I will be back the next time I'm in town.
Their food is fall off the bone, bite your finger good! It's a little pricey but well worth it! Delicious!

We live about 4 1/2 hours away and made the drive to Chicago on Mothers Day just go give this place a shot.  Our son and his fiance live in Chicago so it was a win win for mom.

We visit Kelleys Island in Lake Erie a lot.  Last year we saw an ad for Smoque on a place mat at one of the island restaurants and knew we just had to try it!

This place didn't disappoint at all.  Having lived in Texas for 15 years, we know good BBQ and this place has it...hands down.  The meats were all amazing with the perfect amount of smoke.  The Texas sausage was dee-lish and the brisket was out of this world.  SO good.

The only thing we didn't care for was the mac and cheese.  While we wanted to, we just couldn't love it as it was a bit dry and seemed to have been in the warmer for a while.  Will surely try it next time as it was probably a fluke.  However, those darn french fries looked amazing so we'll try those on the next trip.

Overall, we LOVED this place and can't wait to go back again.

Sliced beef brisket sandwich (Best in the Chicago area):
Bun - Outstanding
Meat - Juicy, Taste so good it doesn't need sauce
House sauce - Excellent
Coleslaw - Excellent
Baked Beans - Wow

*Unless you get there right when they open*

Over rated BBQ

Sauce is fine

Meat tastes old/ very dry

Price is fine

This place is amazing.
Best BBQ around, I'm upset I hadn't tried it sooner.
We got the pulled pork and chopped brisket both with mac n cheese on the side. It was sooo good. I have tried tons of fatty brisket, but this was cooked to perfection.
The baked mac and cheese also blew my mind.
We will be back here very soon!

I heard ton of friends raving about Smoque. I had to try it for myself. I knew this could be special once I seen the meat served with no BBQ sauce. St.Luis ribs where awesome, so was the chopped Brisket. The baked beans and coleslaw where nothing to write home about. I was however satisfied, as I went there for the meat and the meat was 5 .

"AS IF"... smoqued really needs another review??

Dude,  just go.  This is THE BEST BBQ in all of Chicagoland,  period.  The best brisket,  amazing mac n cheese,  cornbread is like porn for the taste buds,  pulled pork is perfection.  

I seriously tell everyone about this place.  It is soooo worth it!!  GO.

This place was awesome. I love bbq and trying new places, Smoque BBQ did not disappoint. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with Cole slaw and Mac and cheese. They serve the sandwich with two different sides of bbq sauce (both delicious). The Mac and cheese was hands down the best I've ever had at any restaurant. Staff was attentive and friendly. And to top it off, the place is BYOB

I wanted to. I had high hopes. Nope, no wafting smokiness in the air. Should have gotten back on 94 and driven back north.
The standard is high. Lem's, or a corner joint on 47th street...you can't grow up on the Southside and not have had true que.
Smoque gave me ....Reheated, dry, old tasting ribs. This slab of St.Louis did not come out of a smoker anytime today. They were reheated in an oven and kinda smothered in that process. There was not a snap to back membrane. There was not a good bark on the meat. Really no smoke ring.
The rub is nasty and leaves a sour taste in your mouth.
Sad, if folks think this joint is REAL barbeque.
Nope, not.
Great BBQ brisket and pulled pork.  Line can be a bit extensive so get there earlier to devote some time to waiting.
Food. Is so good my job ordered for a pot luck brisket was tender pulled pork was delicious and the sauce was good.

THIS IS THE BEST BBQ I HAVE EVER HAD! ....and I've had a lot of BBQ. I wouldn't think Chicago would have the best BBQ, but man was I proven wrong! Everything is delicious about this place from the meats, to the sides, to the BBQ sauce....delicious! I would HIGHLY recommend!
chicago needs more restaurants like smoque. I haven't been to a restaurant that is more sensitive about people allergies than smoque...and the bbq is wild.

It's true! The best bricket lives here! I fell in love with the brisket, the cornbread, and the St. Louis ribs. Seating is a bit tricky, since you can't be seated until you place your order. There were a couple of parties that were smart (maybe not ethical though) and grabbed seats while one person from their party ordered.

We arrived at 4pm and had no problem parking on the street, maybe because the Cubs fans were busy (GoCubs Go!).

pics.caption: Brisket, fries and sausage.

review.des: If you haven't tried Smoque BBQ you are definitely missing out! I honestly believe there's no one better doing BBQ in the Chi! My usual go to is the full slab (meat falls right off the bone with one bite) with Mac and cheese and fries! ($23?) I've also tried their pulled pork in the past and it's juicy and tender. Their cole slaw is not your traditional slaw, it's more of a vinegary slaw which gives the bbq sauce a nice contrast! I love it! Portions are pretty large and filling. Expect to A. wait in a long line and B pay your traditional BBQ joint prices: Example: meal for two will cost you $40ish? But totally worth it! My mouth watered writing this review and I can't wait to go back! Also this is probably not the best place to go for a first date unless you can care less about stuffing your face and getting messy or maybe it's totally the best place to go on a first date and if they call you after, they're worth keeping around!

pics.caption: My absolute favorite BBQ! Half a slab, Mac and cheese, fries and their vinegary Cole Slaw for $15, totally worth it.

review.des:
I've been to Nashville and I can honestly say that I have never sampled food that was just as good as one of the areas that made it popular. I wish Smoque offered more food combination meals, while also offering additional flavors of sauce. On the other hand, I was able to put my own variety together and still walk away paying a reasonable price.

For my late lunch and early dinner, I got the sliced brisket sandwich with mac n cheese and coleslaw. I also had a craving for ribs, so I got the St. Louis half rack. Thinking these portions wouldn't fill me up, I was only able to finish the sandwich and mac. With your sandwich, you get to sample both of their sauces, a Carolina sauce, and the Memphis. For both the sandwich and ribs, I used the Memphis. I found that the vinegar-based Carolina concoction was a little too overpowering for both meats.  

I have yet to visit a restaurant that serves a decent mac n cheese. The noodles are always too soft and too girthy for my taste. Smoque rates the same, and like other restaurants, nails the crusty top and an actual perfect pairing of cheeses, boosting that cheesy punch we all look for in this classic American pasta dish. I ended up scooping most of it on top of the brisket, so my sandwich had cheese. It must be a faux pas to ask for cheese on top of your barbecued meat. I certainly did not see it as an option to add cheese to your sandwich on the menu. It really made the sandwich.

I had the St. Louis half rack for breakfast. It reheated nicely (under a low heat) in my toaster oven. I was surprised that the ends of the ribs were dry, and the center of the rib meat was where you got the best moist and fatty bites of meat. I don't think that my toaster oven is responsible for that. On my next visit, I am going for the leaner baby-back ribs. I'm hoping that the leaner meat will call for a slower heating process, making an evenly moist rack, sides to center.

I had such high hopes.  It wasn't for me.  I had the chopped brisket sandwich.  I found it dry....and tasty.  But not as tasty as I've had elsewhere.  Maybe I'm not the connoisseur that everyone else is. My tummy was not right afterwards either.  Oh...also parking is a bitch, over there.

The BRISKET!! Go for the brisket. I like the St. Louis ribs and pulled pork also.., but man o man the brisket is the best I've ever had.
Cramped seating. The counter is in an " in the way " place. But I'd eat here any day of the week.

pics.caption: The counter at Smoque

review.des:
I'd never made it up here since it's all the way in Irving Park (which really isn't far. But seems that way), so finally came here when my mom suggested it when passing through.

We managed to beat the rush and ordering was smooth. First off-LOVE the idea of doing tastes. Why don't all places do this? This is genius. Keep doing you smoque.

I did the brisket with a taste of pulled pork, mac, and fries. The brisket was just a teeeensy but dry but definitely one of the bests I've had in Chicago. It was so tender I didn't even need a knife to cut it. Sides were good-really liked the fries but mac was just ok. Pulled pork was AMAZING. Bless the pigs who sacrifice themselves for this deliciousness.

Once again I'm just obsessed with the idea of doing tastes. I really can't get over it. Also-kitchen guy who gave us our food was super friendly, which was a nice thing. Definitely a great spot.

All I can say is ...holy smoques!  Everything I had here was not only great, it was the best.  Sauces were savory and tangy, buttery cornbread melted in your mouth, mac n' cheese was crumbly breaded cheesy perfection, meats cooked expertly.  Don't expect frills ambiance wise, but you can expect a happy and helpful staff, colorful local clientele, and a simply dynamite meal.
The BBQ pork sandwich and fries were good! The meal comes with slaw which it didn't say! It gets busy at lunch quickly.

The brisket was absolutely amazing, have been to many places and nobody can compete. Extremely tender and flavorful. I'll definitely be coming back for more.

However, their sides were not good at all, I had the bbq beans, Mac and cheese and corn bread. Not sure if I went at a bad time but the sides were not good at all just unappealingly bland.

Out of all of the restaurants I researched before coming to Chicago, Smoque's stood at the top of the list for nearly every website I came across. Needless to say, I don't think it was the BEST BBQ I've ever had in my life, but it was definitely good. The line for this place can go out of the door during peak times so I would suggest getting there a little earlier. The cool thing about this place (and other places in Chicago) is that it's BYOB. Had I known that, I would've gone to the liquor store to grab some drinks beforehand.

I got a rib combo because I couldn't decide if I wanted the St. Louis style ribs or baby back ribs. If you like more meat on your ribs, then you'll opt for the baby back ribs. If you like more fat and something more tender, you'll like the St. Louis style ribs. Personally, I liked the St. Louis styled ribs better. They had much more flavor and were just tastier in general. The baby back ribs were a little on the dry side because it had more meat on the bone but you can just dip the pork in the Memphis style sauce that they provide. For sides, I got an order of the mac n cheese and cornbread. Both came in small portions but I thought it was just the right amount of food. The mac n cheese was average in my opinion. I also love gumbo so I had to try the gumbo special that they had going on. It was pretty good!

Coming from SoCal, I've had the privilege to try Phil's BBQ. This is what I kept thinking of as I was eating my ribs and I don't think Smoque's surpasses Phil's. However, that doesn't mean that this place isn't worth trying because I do think they serve up some quality ribs here! Not to mention, it's BYOB!

pics.caption: Rub combo with Mac n cheese, corn bread and gumbo

review.des:
Best BBQ in Chicago I think!   I bring my Southern friends here and they are blown away.

You can order takeout over the phone to save some time.  This place is so good there is usually a line on the weekends.

Parking on Pulaski is available - just down the street from the Irving Park Blue line stop (go out the Pulaski exit).

BEST. BBQ. Almost EVER.
Excellent Serivce, Great BBQ and Sauce Sides are a +. Will travel from the West side of Chicago for this BBQ.

Sincerely,
Your FAVORITE Customer
Finally! A fine bbq place. Searched all over Chicago and could not find any decent bbq - then we found this. I will return.
OMG, this place is .  It will not disappoint. Great ribs, corn bread, Mac and cheese. I recently discovered they have taco Tuesday!! And i am hooked! Love, love this place. This place is a must!

came last night with my wife.  went with a FULL slab of ribs, with 2 sides, a Brisket samich alone and 2 drinks.  the food was very good, sauce had a bit of a kick to it.  fries were great.  my wife wasn't a fan of the mac and cheese.  but everything else was great.  
was a big pricey for us.......$45 for us 2.  eeek!  i recommend to try it......i love BBQ!

Awesome bbq. I usually go with the sliced  brisket sandwich. I also like the chili gumbo. Great flavor and very filling. Typically we carryout. Although they are always busy, the service is usually friendly and fast.

Have been eating Smoque for over ten years but have never actually visited the location! It has always been picked up as takeout by a family member and brought home so I can't comment on ambience unfortunately. I can however, comment on taste! It is simply put, delicious.

Smoque was possibly my first exposure into 'fine' barbecue. (That is to say, fast casual BBQ done right!)The price point is not bad at all. I have tried ribs, brisket sandwiches chopped and sliced, Mac n Cheese (it is FIYA) and all sorts of sauces!

I will say that if you are not getting the peach cobbler to top off your 'que, then you are not living! If you don't know, now you know. It's pretty great that there's a little spot in the Revival Food Hall now as well for those that work in that hood.

SO much food and so inexpensive!

I'm by no means anyone who has eaten many types of BBQ in my life but I can definitely say this place is tasty. I came on a Friday evening at around 6:30 with a large group and luckily were able to find seats; it can get kind of packed so do come earlier! However, I think a lot of people do get it to go. Four of us split a full rack of the St. Louis ribs with slaw, fries, beans, and the chili along with the BBQ brisket. Everything was so delicious and we demolished the entire thing. Other people in our party got the mac and cheese and that was also well received. I love that there are so many different types of BBQ sauces, and I like that the slaw isn't really heavy. I've been craving this place ever since and this place gives me another reason to visit Chicago again!

Hmmm..I'm disappointed by Midwest 'Que! When there aren't paper towels on the table, you already know that it's just going to be ok.

When we arrived, there was a huge line out the door & around the block. We decided to wait anyway. Food came pretty quickly.

Per my usual BBQ order, I went with the ribs. Smoque touts their ribs as a memphis-style dry rub with their St. Louis ribs being "meatier and smokier than the baby backs." It was really just okay. At this point, I had only had fall-off-the-bone, delicious ribs in Austin and I felt that even though Smoque's was decent, it wasn't worth the wait.

Meh.

I'm from KC. We easily have the best BBQ. But, Smoque was so good! No regrets! I had the 1/2 chicken and it was cooked to perfection. My fiancé had the St. Louis ribs, which he gobbled up. He told me they had the best taste. My soon to be mother-in-law had the brisket and it was so perfectly cooked, it was falling apart when she picked it up.

Well done, Chicago. Well done.

pics.caption: St. Louis ribs!
Beef brisket!

review.des:
Hungry for barbecue, I came here based on what, 3800 or so Yelp reviews(?)  Four plus stars on average?  Yup, bypassing my other barbecue bookmarks for Smoque.  

Came by close to 8 pm on a Friday night, long line, most tables full, I'm feeling purty good about my choice.  Then I saw it.  There's a guy cutting his ribs with a knife.  Really.  Uh oh, bad sign.  But all these people?  They can't be wrong.  C'mon, it must just be that guy.  

Maybe it is that guy, but it was also the ribs.  I found the knife was actually necessary, not a good trait for a BBQ joint.

Baby backs:  Just fine.  Mostly lean, juicy, a little smoky.  
St. Louis style ribs;  tough and dry.  You do need a knife, and most of the fat and juice has rendered, leaving a dry, chalky rib.  Sauce can't save the dry ribs.
Corn bread:  flavorful, with some corn nuggets in there.
Mac n cheese:  Good flavor, but grainy sauce.  Bummer.
Cole slaw:  Plain, but bright with vinegar and a touch sweet.

Kitchen is a production environment with 6 or 7 people plating orders as they come in.  Feels like fast food.  My sense is that this was a really good BBQ place that got discovered and now has to work real hard to keep up with demand.  

And Smoque, is that French or something?  I guess it's a mashup of smoke and 'que, which works better than Smocue, which would just be silly.  I actually like the name.

Wish I had tried some beef brisket or burnt ends.  If there is a next time, that will be my order.

pics.caption: Baby backs were pretty good, still juicy, with just a faint smoke ring and smoke flavor.
Mac n cheese has a nice crunchy bread crumb and cheese topping, but the sauce was a little grainy.
1/2 rack baby back and added 1/4 rack St. Louis style.

review.des: BEST FOOD OF MY LIFE!!! I can't eat bbq anywhere else.  Great staff, simple menu, superb food.   The chopped brisket is what's up!!!!!!

Super tasty ribs! Their Mac & cheese is very good So DON'T go w/a small lol It does get pretty packed in the evenings so you might want to make reservations or just come in earlier to avoid the wait times.

They also have take out option :)

My 4 star rating is based on Chicago BBQ and not BBQ in other states. For Chicago this is definitely one of the best BBQ options in regards to the flavor of the meat.
If you are expecting it to be as good or comparing it to amazing BBQ places in Texas, Tennessee or Missouri then this place would only be three stars in comparison. So set your expectations appropriately.
The seasoning of the meat is on point and cooked well. I have been a few times and tried the pulled pork, brisket and ribs. I was happy with all the options. The sauces are a three star they compliment the meat but are not amazing it is really the meat that is the show stopper as the sides are tasty but average. I wasn't a fan of the BBQ beans - so I would suggest getting a different side.
My friend used them to cater their party and it went over really well. Fair price by the pound. I thought it was a good idea and different from just ordering pizza or pasta. Enjoy !!

pics.caption: Menu and pricing. The meat by the pound is a good option for parties and you don't feel like cooking.

review.des:
First this place really needs to move into bigger digs. We came at 2 on a saturday, and the place was packed. You have to squeeze by people to sit down, go to the bathroom, pick up the food, pick up the utensils you forgot, get water, really anything.  There was a sign that said max occupancy was 45 people, and there were definitely more people than that.

Now, onto the food!  We got the baby back ribs, and they were generally soft and tasty.  However there were some tougher parts that poked the roof of my mouth.  The portion sizes left something to be desired - you get more meat on the ribs than at Carson's but not much more.  

We got the chili, French fry, mac and cheese, peach cobbler, and pecan bread pudding on the sides.  They were all OK, but the peach cobbler crust was off the hook!  Give that a try, and the pecan pudding was really good too. Ask them if they can leave the sauce off though that was too sweet for me.

Service was the best part.  Even though it is a fast casual place, everyone was very friendly, polite, and happy to help out.  The owner even stepped in when we wanted to do a second order and put it in for us (so we didn't have to wait in crazy line again).  

Overall, a solid place.  If they had a bigger space and put more meat on the bones at same price/quality, I would give a higher rating for sure.

pics.caption: Full rack of ribs, fries, slaw, peach cobbler, chili

review.des:
The famous Smoque BBQ did not let me down. From the moment I walked in the restaurant, I could take in the rich smell of BBQ goodness from the smokers.

A plentiful menu at Smoque, i decided to go small first and get myself a 1/2 brisket sandwich which i thought was delicious. The meat was so tender and paired very well with the Carolina BBQ sauce that was provided.

This place gets crowded fast. Best to go before dinner time if you get the chance. There's indoor as well as outdoor seating and the service is as quick as any other establishment.

An essential spot for great BBQ food in Chicago. Anyone from the city will know of this place and after eating here, it's clear to see why.
Do yourself a favor & eat here. Yum. Can get really busy- but it's worth the wait. We are visiting from California & this location is definitely now on our top 5 places for BBQ. Enjoy

So, we're standing in this obnoxious line and I say to my wife, "this better be the best BBQ I've ever had"....since I hate standing in lines and almost never do.  It was.  I had the brisket platter chopped with burndt ends with corn bread, cole slaw, and mac and cheese.  My wife had a half slab of ribs with corn bread, baked beans, and cole slaw.  We had the pecan bread pudding for desert.  The highlight was really the brisket.  It was so tender and tasty.  Really, really outstanding.  The corn bread was very good too.  We thought her ribs were good but not great.  The desert....wow.  IT WAS SO GOOD.  I was glad that we only got one to share....cuz I would have eaten 2 or 3 of those.

Now, the food is outstanding but the setup really sucks.  You wait in line to place your order, with the line out the door for us last night.  Likely about 30 minutes.  Then they assign you a table to wait for your name to be called to get your food.  It was very chaotic.  The seating area is very small.  The time between when we ordered and when we got our food wasn't too bad but I have no idea why the line to place orders was so long.  It was just super in-efficient.  So, the food is the best but if were rating based on total experience, this place would get a 3 at best since I would rate everything but the food a 1.

The meat is so freakin' tender that when you try to pick it up with your fork, it falls apart! So good. Portion size is reasonable for the amount that you pay and every meal automatically comes with coleslaw. Fast service, clean, and you can sample food! Great first meal in Chicago!!!!

Hands down the best BBQ I've had.  The brisket was moist and tender and broke apart with a soft touch.  Nothing fancy about the place but you will not be disappointed.  If you want a brew, grab a 6 pack on the way over.

pics.caption: Brisket, ribs, cornbread, slaw, baked beans and i forgot the deserts.

review.des: We got a gift card to smoque and my husband and I were not disappointed! Our food came out right away and the BBQ flavor was great! I think it's a kind of expensive place when you start to add up the sides but Smoque is worth checking out for the quality of the meat you get! The vibe is country/western to be expected and they have TV's to watch a game too if you'd like! I would recommend this place and try as many of the sauces at your table as you can.

Taste: 9/10
Time from getting into the restaurant until we left: 1hr
Time spent on line: 15 minutes
Time waiting for table: 0
Quantity of food: 8/10 (meat there was a lot but we only got a little ramekin of Mac and cheese. Fries we got a hefty order).
Price all in of order: $40
Dirtiness factor: 10 (my hands were slimy AF after gnawing on ribs for a half hour)
Hype: 10/10
Cons: baby back ribs carries the smoke flavor a little too much. Regular St. Louis ribs were way tastier and held their pork flavor better
Carolina vs Memphis bbq sauce: I liked the Memphis sweet sauce better. My fiancé couldn't stopped eating the vinegar Caroline sauce. Won/win situation
Most recommended food order: sliced brisket... It was softer than a baby's bottom... Couldn't even pick it up with a dang fork!
Would I go back: probably not because of the location but if anyone asks for a good bbq place I'd def send them over!

Today I found out I cannot eat a whole rack of ribs. But it's mostly bone right? Wrong.

I was in the Albany park area and happened to yelp this place in the middle of nowhere with 3200+ reviews and still maintained an almost perfect record! Here's another one because this place is awesome.

We went at noon on a Sunday. Not a bad wait on line and food came out in an instant. Everything was delicious! Highly recommend if you're in the area. Def go either half rack of St. Louis ribs or sliced brisket! Both are fantastic!

pics.caption: Rib combo (half baby back half St. Louis) with Mac and cheese, fries and an a la cart order of their famous brisket!!

review.des: I went today for the first time and I had ribs with cornbread, coleslaw and the beans. The food was very very delicious and I will definitely come back and I'll try the brisket next time. It's worth it, guys!
Line is too long. I found some of the meat to be greasy/fatty but overall good flavor.
Have been dining here for a few years now and they never let me down. I'm a brisket kind of girl and definitely a sucker for those sides. You can't go wrong with anything you order.
I expected so much more from this place but it was a let down. The bbq and mac n cheese-I thought lacked flavor. Food looked good dont get me wrong but it was definitely missing something.

Everytime is as delicious as the time before, if not better!   This place has every aspect of a good restaurant down pat.  

The food is perfectly prepared tender and the smoke taste does not overwhelm the meat.  Fries are fresh cut, not over salted and very delicious. The coleslaw is vinegar based and very fresh.   The brisket chili  side will make cap off your main dish.  For dessert, the pecan bread pudding will have you kicking yourself for not ordering two.  Don't plan on splitting this delight, its portion is perfect for one and it is so good that you will not utter "only a bite for me".  

Granted, the place is  not huge but the roaming host staff is  "ON THEIR TOES" and are very friendly, so you will not be left with a tray of food and no where to go.  

It gets crowded quickly at the predictable early evening time so timing is crucial for a shorter wait on the front end of your experience but throw caution to the wind and experience this place.  It is worth it.

Other than cold weather, there is one other thing I hate about the Midwest (minus KC)...the lack of good BBQ. The places in Bucktown/Wicker Park are mediocre at best. Then, one day, I was watching the Food Network and boom! Smoque was featured as 1 of the 25 best BBQ joints in the country. Now this review is probably a year overdue, but I feel like now that I have been to Smoque several times, I can provide a more accurate review.

Overall, the meat is DELICIOUS. The ribs have always been delicious, although I will say the tenderness depending on the day can lack consistency. My other favorite meat is the sliced brisket. It's almost impossible to eat with a fork because of how tender it is. I also love that Smoque offers a variety of BBQ sauces that cater to individual preferences for BBQ styles. You can get Carolina, Memphis, or my favorite Spicy sauce.

The loss of a star is for the sides. While Smoque excels in their meat, the sides are average at best. The macaroni and cheese may be cheesy but lacks flavor. The cornbread and chili are nothing to write home about. Beans are just beans.

Now dessert, however, is something that cannot be missed. As someone who is not a fan of bread pudding, this is one of the best I have had. The salted bourbon caramel sauce...O M G. Best way to eat it: heated up! The peach cobbler is also delicious.

Until another amazing BBQ place opens up, this is my joint in Chicago!!
Great bbq! The Mac and cheese is delicious too! I would highly recommend if looking for bbq in Chicago!

I am not a huge fan of BBQ so I was not expecting much from to Smoque. Oh boy, I was wrong. The food was delicious hearty American BBQ.

Here is what we ordered (shared between 2 people)

 - Full slab of St. Louis Ribs*
 - Mac&Cheese*
 - BBQ Gumbo*
 - Brisket
 - Slaw
 - Corn Bread *
 - Baked Beans

The ribs are dry-rub and served with their house made BBQ sauce. The Memphis thick BBQ sauce was definitely our favorite. Now let's talk about the fantastic BBQ gumbo! OH-M-GEE! It was smokey, meaty and just amazing. The mac&cheese had the right amount of cheese and a nice crispy bread coating. We opted for the sliced brisket which was good but a little dry. The slaw, corn bread and baked beans were standard.

A full slack of ribs, brisket and all those sides are plenty to share between two people. I wanted to get the bread pudding too since that sounded really good but I had to refrain myself.

pics.caption: Full rack of dried rubbed ST Louis ribs
BBQ gumbo! So good!

review.des: Definitely the best all around BBQ in Chicago. All BBQ items are nicely smoked and served with sauce on the side as I like it. The brisket and pulled pork are both very good. The real stars are the St. Louis ribs which are excellent. Additionally the sides are great and I think they have the best vinegar slaw around. The only drawback is that they can get pretty crowded.

Chicago. Day 1. BBQ.

Brisket + Burnt ends - 5/5 - It's no Franklin's but for not Texas BBQ it's definitely one of the best.
St. Louis Ribs - 4/5
Mac and cheese - 4/5
BBQ Beans - 3/5
Pecan Bread Pudding - 5/5

Overall, "as good as it gets."

This is a very nice restaurant with a great staff! Great atmosphere and service.
Texas BBQ? No. But the potential is there.

pics.caption: SMOQUE
Smoque BBQ

review.des: Amazing BBQ!! My fiancé is obsessed with BBQ and this is the best we've had in the city so far. The prices are definitely affordable compared to other meat places. Taste is authentic and the restaurant is very clean. You are even allowed to bring you're own alcohol in!! I would recommend, as I'll be going back myself!
I love this place!!! BBQ ribs always juice and super delicious!!! Never had a complaint. This is the place if you want to get the best bbq ribs or sandwich, also the peach cobbler

I live about ten minutes from Smoque BBQ, but for some odd reason, I've never been there in the ten plus years that they have been in business. I finally went there with a friend a few nights ago, and all I can say is that I have missed out on great food all these years!

The restaurant is very basic, not a white tablecloth venue by any means. We spoke to the owner, and he was very nice. He told us the story of how the restaurant came about. Interesting story. The employees were all very friendly and accommodating, especially Henry. He said that he was the host. I told him that in a fancy restaurant he would be the maitre d'.

We ordered the chicken, ribs, and brisket. The chicken and ribs were wonderful, and the brisket was absolutely amazing. It was even better than mine! The sauces truly complemented each dish. The sides we ordered were all terrific, the mac 'n cheese, brisket chili, corn bread, and fries. Cole slaw comes with every entrée. The desserts are to die for, especially the bread pudding. It was worth every calorie!

I know that I will be going back often. I can honestly say that this is the best BBQ I have ever eaten. I can't wait until the next time.

Attended my Nieces Daughter's Birthday Party in Park Ridge.  The Event was catered by Smoque BBQ, Heard of it and was happy that I was going to get a chance to enjoy their faire. We had Pork, Ribs, Sides, Brisket, Chicken to choose from, not to mention all the extra side dishes (Beans, Mac & Cheese, Potato Salad, Coleslaw...) they ordered.  I & my Family are Fan's!  Delicious is an understatement for someone that truly enjoys good, moist & favorable BBQ.  Looks like they are going to be around for a long time. When in Chicago, near Pulaski Road & south of Irving Park Road, or cater your next event! You must stop on by.  You may have a wait, but definitely worth it.  Cheers!

Loved this place so much that when I moved very far south I still used their catering service. Celebrating a graduation from law school for my boyfriend, the food stayed delicious and warm for the 45 min drive. There was a mishap with the order and while it inconvenienced me, they addressed it and made sure to remedy the problem quickly. For the food, the service, and especially the follow up with amazing customer service- 5 stars is an easy rating. Highly recommended.
Hands down the best BBQ north of equator! Line can be a big long after 4pm, but definitely worth it.

Overview - Quality BBQ food served by nice people in a cramped, energetic space. Food 4/5  Customer Service 4.5/5

Everything I had was really yummy. 1/2 sandwich with Brisket & Pulled Pork (4/5). I enjoyed the pork better, but am glad that I asked for a side of both of their sauces because the meat was much better with it. The MacNCheese was incredible (5/5). Toasted with breadcrumbs completed it. Slaw was a nice addition to the sandwiches.

The employees are friendly and try to be accommodating with how busy it is.

If you're eating in, your food isn't started until your table is ready. It was super busy when we arrived and took maybe 10-15 minutes after ordering to get our seats. It's a small place with a lot of people. Food was ready about 2 minutes later. It's an energetic scene with a diverse group of people.

Eat here and you can THROW DOWN!

pics.caption: Menu!
Hard workers making magic with a friendly attitude.
1/2 sandwich (pulled pork & brisket) was a 4/5. Needed the additional sauce, and stick with the pulled pork.

review.des:
Smoque BBQ is a delicious Northside barbecue.
Pulled pork sandwich is out of this world.
I've had better cornbread, been to a spot on North Ave that puts jalapeños in which would be great.
Mac and cheese is 5 star. I'll come again and again.

I would argue one of the best BBQ places in the city. Unfortunately that doesn't say a lot as there aren't too many in Chicago, but this one is top 3 for me. Low key, go up to the counter and order. I almost always get the brisket as it's tender and never dry. I also enjoy the sauces at smoque. Their Mac and Cheese is awesome along with the cornbread and French fries. I usually dodge their other sides only because they are standard. Def try all of the meats if you go, but I recommend the brisket followed by the pulled pork.

When I crave BBQ, all I want is Smoque. The sliced brisket is the best I've ever had, and you can't go wrong with the mac & cheese, cornbread, cole slaw and fries. It's a casual place where the line goes pretty fast-- we waited about 25 minutes on a Saturday night for 4 people. Your whole party has to be there before getting seated.
I've eating here plenty of times kind of busy in the evenings to dine in but worth the wait. No alcohol which is a bummer.

Good quality bbq, the meat was juicy and tender, just small servings for the price.  For me personally, one of the barbeque sauces were too sweet and the other was more on the hickory side. For my friends, they thought it was just right. The potato salad was just ok.

Best. Low and slow bbq ever. EVER. Brisket is soft and flavoured just right, beans are smokey and full of bits of brisket, fries are excellent and seasoned well. Apparently they're also the ONLY thing that's fried in there so it's also really gluten friendly. Beans are also not made with flour as a thickener so that's gluten free too! Platters are served on half bake sheets and lined with wax paper and come with a slaw side and two styles of sauces. Carolina and Memphis. I am more partial to the vinegary Carolina. It's a very limited menu and the place is better for it. It was crowded on a Friday night but the staff is friendly and the service is quick. They even clear your trays for you when you're done. Must return the next time I'm in town to try the ribs and other meats.

pics.caption: Sign painted on the front side of the building
Brisket (chopped) beans, slaw and a corn bread with two styles of sauce
Brisket (sliced) beans, slaw and fries with two styles of sauce

review.des:
Service 5
Cleanliness 5
Location 4
Taste 4
Value 4
Meat quality 5

Meat was great, as well as service and value.  Only downside, we didnt find the right sauces for our tastes and we tried 4 different types.  Bit too vinegary and sour for our tastes.
The biscuit in this place it's like file mignon So then they're so juicy the fries one of the best really for sure I'm going to get another lunch over there
Famous brisket, good sides, insane line, priced about right, good ribs... maybe the best BBQ in Chicago. Deserves its fans.
Amazing ribs, Food is always great and customer service is very good. Honestly some of the best ribs ive ever had

The Carolina-style sauce certainly tastes great on anything--including the corn bread--but meat portion sizes are small and it's a little expensive for what you get. I've been here twice over the past few years and I don't recall feeling full. I wish I could recall the day of week and time of day that wasn't busy, because when it was busy, the wait was very long. I'll go back this summer and try to figure out what they put in the cole slaw because it's remarkably good. The outdoor seating was not very comfortable and there were a lot of little flying pests.
Ordered catering for a company holiday party and the BBQ was amazing -- meats were tender and full of flavor. Highly recommend!

The best barbecue joint in all of Chicago. The meats are so juicy and tender, and will melt in your mouth the moment you eat it. Sandwiches are served on large brioche buns, good for soaking up extra sauce. Carolina and Kansas City style sauces are both excellent choices, but my person favorite is the sweeter Kansas City. Almost as important as the meat, the sides are top tier as well. The mac and cheese is gooey and topped with bread crumbs while the fries not run of the mill and above average for a barbecue restaurant. The line may be a turn off, but it's well worth the wait and moves fast. Also, BYOB, useful to know ahead.

pics.caption: Brisket sandwich with fries and Mac and cheese

review.des: It's good but I kinda had higher hopes from all the hype this place got. Beans and coleslaw were below average.. I've had better else where, but obviously this place is known for its bbq which was mediocre for my taste. Maybe I'll give them another try.. not anytime soon.

Used them for a catering event for a very large group and they were incredibly helpful through the whole process. Gave portion recommendations, had everything totally prepared for pickup and even helped me carry to the car. I've yet to dine in, but when I went the place was packed! All of the food was delicious, some of the best BBQ In the city.

Best bbq in chicago. Everything is amazing. If you like meat then you need to come here and enjoy the meat. Great Mac and cheese also. Ribs are the best in chicago. Brisket is mouth watering. What else is there to say?

Definitely overrated to say the least. I've had some decent BBQ from fast food chains. And this place doesn't even live up to those. The menu has very little to choose from, and when you're told they don't have what you came for that completely throws off the experience. No BBQ place should ever run out of Chicken, Chicken is always a fall back plan for people to eat when they don't want Pork or Beef Brisket. They should really add more cuts of meat to their menu. Maybe add a Beef Rib, that would greatly increase this barren menu. The restroom is mediocre, seating arrangement is terrible. This restaurant is not good for groups over 6. Overall this place isn't that bad nor is it that good, just not a place that my wife and I will go out of the way for.

Awesome brisket, if you go early and it's slow ask for the burnt ends, incredible! Get chopped brisket if taking to go and sliced if eating in. Pulled pork is very good, as are all the sides I've tried.(Mac, fries, beans, cornbread)
I have a couple of favorite BBQ spots in Chicago, but the Texas-style here just can't be beat! And the peach cobbler is a must!
Simply great BBQ. You don't need to look for BBQ in the city, because this is the place.
The meat is quality meat! The barbeque briskit was my favorite and I would recommend it to everyone who goes here. I enjoyed the chopped one

My wife and I are visiting and heard Smoque had the best ribs around. We showed up around 7pm and by the time we made it to order (7:30) a person or two before us ordered the last rack of St. Louis Ribs. Although very disappointed we understood that can happen especially being as busy they are. We were able to try a 1/4 rack as well as the baby back ribs. I would say it was good. I don't have the most refined palate in the world but I have had ribs from many BBQ restaurants and these were just good in my humble opinion.

Wow!!!

Best BBQ in Chicago.

Had lunch here last month on the outdoor patio.

I'm such a fan. Brisket, ribs, the sauces, corn bread, mac and cheese.

If you're in the area stop in for lunch.
This place always does a great job when we cater our events with them. The food is always on point
Best BBQ!!! Best macaroni and cheese,  best ribs, best coleslaw,  best service. Family friendly & helpful staff. The bust boys we're very polite and attentive

pics.caption: Isabella loves the fresh cut fries!!
1/2 &1/2 sandwich, Mac and cheese,  cornbread, coleslaw. Best bang for you buck!!!
Miabella loved her ribs, fries, coleslaw & Mac and cheese

review.des: After some extensive research prior to our trip to Chicago from LA , I found Smoque listed as one of the best bbq places in the area . And boyyyy were they right . This place was awesome, my boyfriend and I really enjoyed our meals and we were stuffed after eating about half . The brisket is super tender and literally falls apart when you pick it up, I even took a video to send to my bbq obsessed dad back home . The Memphis bbq sauce was my absolute favorite and I would buy it by the bottle if I could . Awesome food, thanks Smoque !!!

pics.caption: Yummy yummy . Brisket platter with fries and Mac & cheese and a pulled pork sandwich with a large side of baked beans.

review.des: Best brisket and sauces that I've had in Chicago. Great attention to making everything the best it can be. Huge plus is that it is byob so you can your favorite beer with this bbq so a great bargain for a gourmet meal

I wanted to love this place. I wanted it to be a 5 star out of this world experience and based on the hype I really thought it would deliver. It did not blow my mind. It was good but not great in many ways.
The service was friendly, the decorations were cute, and sitting outside on a warm summer day was a nice touch.
I expected to eat the best barbecue in the city though. The ribs were good and I would recommend them. Came off the bone fairly easily. Had a good rub on them. I wasn't crazy about the provided sauces though and the smoky flavor didn't come through the meat as much as I would have liked.
The biggest let down for me was the corn bread. It was tiny, dry and not very flavorful.
Would I go back? Yes. Is is the best Q place in the city- No. I would recommend southern cut, q, or lillies q over smoque. Maybe it's just because the hype was so high but I didn't feel the love other people have for this place.

Smoque BBQ held a high rating on the Yelp machine when I was searching for some good grub.  Fortunately for me, I went to Smoque.  When I go there, I noticed a line.  A long line.  I decided to wait in that long line until I got to the front.  I was traveling through on business, but I made friends with some Smoque regulars in line.  They shared with me that I would regret it if I didn't order brisket for my meal.  They were right.  I went right for it.  I ordered the brisket and I didn't regret it.  As an added bonus, the fries were good, the macaroni was good, the cole slaw was good.  It was all good.  The sauce was very good as well.  

If I had to wait in that long line again, I would.  I would be happy to wait around for this place to serve me that scrumptious BBQ.  Well done Smoque.  You make me proud....and full.
Love the chopped brisket, bread pudding, and salad (?!). Actually my favorite salad in the city. Get it with the chicken.

Sept 6, 2018 We made a huge discovery of the top 50 places to eat in Chicago list... at the Revival Food Hall on Clark St 4 places are in there!   They didn't have the recommended Ribs at this location but I would recommend the Beef Brisket. It was perfect and not fatty like other places I've been. Smoque we had the Beef Brisket Sandwich with the recommended Carolina and Memphis Sauces, Coleslaw and a Coke about $14
Came on a buzy Sat nite waited over an hour. Well worthAaa with the wait!!Mac and cheese and peach cobbler the best. Brisket really good and sauce sweet to offset smoke. Referred by Artie. Thanks.
Smoque never disappoints, but now I'm a vegetarian so I can't eat it...okay, maybe I'll get some ribs, just this once...
My favorite BBQ restaurant in Chicago. Takeout can be better sometimes as they do get busy, especially on weekends.

The brisket here ROCKS MY WORLD! It is seriously OMG good. This is my third time having it and paired it with the Carolina Sauce. It was even better this time than the last. So tender... it fell apart and melts in your mouth. Sooooooooo, amazing! The homestyle fries make me happy, too cause I'm gluten free. Good GF fries and BBQ are hard to find.

I will never come close to cooking a brisket this good and have retired that task to this BBQ place.  Brisket in 10 minutes or 10 hours? Hmmmm...it's a no brainer here. Hands down the best brisket I've ever had...ever!

This place is starting to lose its spark. We just bought some food and it's bland. The Mac and Cheese taste over cooked and not cheesy like usual. My brisket has way too much fat on it and it's just gross. Please don't lose your quality.
Great ribs,slaw,sausages,everything including the vibe.my husband and kids loved it here

Great Texas style bbq right here in the city. I called in an order for take out to serve houseguests over the weekend, and the staff was very helpful in guiding me through the menu options. The order was ready promptly, and everything was very flavorful and hot. We will be back.

If I could eat at one place for the rest of my life, it would be here. Everything I have tried here is amazing. The sliced brisket plate with Mac and cheese and fries is a must. But the star of the show is the sweet jalapeño. I always ask for 3 cups of these because they are so dang good. The crunch of the jalapeños with the brisket is heaven. I highly highly recommend them. Thank me later.

The only downside of this place is the size. It gets super busy around dinner time and you sometimes have to wait in line for awhile, but it's so worth it. I wouldn't recommend coming here with a big group because of the limited tables. If I could give this place 10 stars, I definitely would.

pics.caption: Sliced brisket platter with Mac n cheese!

review.des: I'm not sure if this place needs any more reviews to prove they are the best bbq place in Chicago. The sliced brisket is the best I've ever had. The meat is so tender and flavorful that no bbq sauce is needed. The Mac and cheese and bread budding are a great combo to this heavenly tasting brisket dish. Enjoy!

My favorite BBQ in the city. I love the brisket sandwiches. I also enjoy you don't have to wait for your food too much.
Seating is a bit like a cattle run, but it's not too bad.
I try to sneak away for lunch as much as I can.
Overhyped OK BBQ that never fails to give me heartburn. Never been greeted with anything above indifference and not feeling welcome is not where I want to be.

I love this place. Every time we go, the food is top notch. The people who work there are friendly and helpful. The restaurant and bathrooms are clean which is always important when you consider how clean the kitchen is. I've never had anything on the menu that I didn't enjoy. If I had one very minor complaint, it would be that sometimes the crowds make you feel pressured to get up the second you finish your meal. I personally enjoy letting my food digest for a minute as I engage in some after dinner conversation. That, however, is a personal feeling. Go here for great bbq.
Good barbecue..small portions..big prices..go early..they run out of meat..parking Is hit or miss..if in the neighborhood will stop..

Being as I live in Texas, I regretfully admit this bbq is better than any I've had before. Came here last October to run Chicago Marathon and this was my pre race meal. Wasn't too pleased about standing in line for 30 min but it was worth it. Had the pork ribs, mac n cheese, and brisket chili. It was literally one of the most delicious meals I've had in my life. Will definitely be back.

Smokey's is a solid place to check out or order from they have good ribs fries, I've really just enjoyed them since I've moved to the area. I order maybe once every month to make sure I get my smokeys.

I eat BBQ everywhere I go and this is one of the top-5 best BBQ joints I've ever eaten at. Lately, only Kansas City Joe's in KC had better and they are about as good as it gets in the world. Try the brisket (sliced) and beans at Smoque, you won't be disappointed. If you don't like a vinegary slaw, you might skip that, but it isn't bad. The only downside is that the restaurant is kind of off the beaten path and both times that we've been there, we ended up driving for a while and parking quite a bit away. It is very close to the "Irving Park" metro stop and I'd recommend that instead of driving.

Every time I drive by Smoque the line is out of this world. Yesterday driving to another restaurant my husband pointed out there was no line, and just like that we finally made it happen! The food is as delicious as other reviewer have said, and the best part was the price! They have very reasonable prices and large portions. I had the half rack or ribs with fries and mac and cheese, and my husband had the brisket. Everything was delicious. I wouldn't wait in line though, because I've been to other places in the city that I find equally good or better (tone honest). If you're in the neighborhood and you're lucky enough to get in without a wait...go for it!

This is Chicago. We're not exactly a BBQ town, but when a place has over 3K reviews and a 4 and half star average you're doing yourself a disservice by not checking it out. The other day I did and I gotta say, Smoque lived up to the hype.

Go to Texas, and you'll wait in a 2-hour long line for ribs that are really close to as tasty as these. The fact that you can get them in under 10 minutes on a Sunday is just unreal. Not to mention it's actually pretty darn cheap too. Full slab with 2 sides was about $24 which was way less than I was expecting.

The place is a machine. Line moves quick, your food comes out in the blink of an eye, and there's always a staffer there to answer your questions. The only other advice I'll offer than hasn't really been said is to order more than you can eat. Cold BBQ the next day is actually really underrated.

COST:
$10.45 (Sliced Brisket w/ 1 side)
$9.45 (Chopped Brisket w/ 1 side)
$11.95 (1/2 Slab Baby Back Ribs)
$11.95 (1/2 Slab St Louis Style Ribs)
$0.95 x 2 (Cornbread)
$2.45 (Peach Cobbler with Salted Caramel and Bourbon - YUM!)

And breathe! Yes, between a friend and I we really ordered AND ate all that food. It was BBQ heaven. We would've ordered chicken and pulled pork too, but they were out of it! I guess this just gives me an excuse to go back in.

My favorites off the platters we ordered were the baby back ribs and sliced brisket with the Memphis BBQ sauce. The peach cobbler was to die for as well!

BYOB which is awesome and we came on a Friday night. The line was about through the door, but the wait was not terrible at all! It took about 30 minutes from the door to order to sitting down and having your food called out.

I'll be back for sure!

pics.caption: One of everything please!

review.des: After being spoiled in St. Louis, I was concerned that Chicago couldn't satisfy. Smoque has proven that I was mistaken. It is consistently my favorite BBQ in Chicago. The STL style ribs have a flavorful rub and the meat falls of the bone. Fries and slaw are idyllic. When I save room (a difficult feat) the bread pudding is a joy. Their service is great and they seem to give job opportunities to local kids. Also, Smoque is reasonably priced for a BBQ joint.

My BF is originally from Texas, and one of the drawbacks for him is that there is no good BBQ in Chicago, or Illinois for that matter.  The flip side for me is there is no good pizza or italian in Texas.  A coworker recommended Smoque, claiming it was the best BBQ they've had in the midwest.  I checked it out on Yelp, and it seems the consesus is this is the best in Chicago.

While I will concur it is the best in Chicago, I still think it is just good, not great.  The brisket is amazlingly tender, melt in your mouth, goodness.  It's a sin in my mind to even consider ordering it chopped because of the tenderness.  The memphis BBQ sauce is my favorite.  Carolina BBQ is too vinegary for me, and I'm glad Smoque gives you one of each to decide.  The baby back ribs had great BBQ flavor from the rub, however they were dry, which was disappointing for me considering I had a taste for ribs.

The sides were ok - cornbread was dry, macaroni and cheese was nothing more than what I do that home, coleslaw was vinegary not creamy.  I did enjoy the flavor of the baked beans though!

If you're ordering dessert, go for the bread pudding with caramelized pecans, it was awesome.

They also have carry out, which was what a lot of people had been doing, however the dining room was packed for a Wednesday night, with even people sitting outside.  Service is great as well!

All in all, I now have a BBQ spot in Chicago, can't wait to go back.
Great BBQ! Three thumbs up, lol... in my Arnold Schwarzenegger voice I will be back, lol....

pics.caption: Hmmmmm hnmmm good

review.des: Terrific BBQ and really affordable compared to most other BBQ joints. If we were in the area longer, we'd definitely be going back here again.  Check it out if you find yourself near here. The staff was great too, super friendly.

Im from Texas and crave bbq from home a lot. i've tried many Bbq eateries in this city and they are horrendous. I've had this place marked for a few years, but after trying multiple bbq here I gave up and started checking in brisket and meats in luggage returning from visits home.

Best BBQ in this city. Hands down. Now, I don't feel the need to check in luggage filled with brisket ! Also, the customer service is another probably best in the city. EVERYONE in there, came to see how we enjoyed our first time  and just super nice. This made the full experience

We got the half and half platter with a taste of ribs. I had pulled pork, sliced brisket. One of the managers so graciously gave us samples of the other meats as well that included the chopped brisket, and texas sausage.

Any of the meats, literally cannot go wrong. My favorite, and this is hard is the Texas Sausage. Not many out of staters understand the taste to get the taste just right - and boy did they!

The St. Louis ribs: Meaty and fall off the bone COMPLETLY. Used the spicy st louis sauce..superb.

Sliced brisket: delicious as well, charred enough on the outside and little fat as should be. Very tender.

Chopped brisket: a little crunch and little tender and more juicy than the sliced. Added spicy st louis sauce.

Pulled pork: equally delicious, and pulled enough to just add sauce and eat. Tender as well.

Beans: very sweet! Im not a fan of sweet beans, but they were good. :)

Mac and Cheese: very good, bread crumbs on top and very creamy on the inside !

Soo good cannot wait to go back. Ill be here anytime Im craving home.

pics.caption: Top left, pulled pork, bottom left: sliced brisket. Bottom right: st louis ribs

review.des:
We ordered brisket and a half slab of St. Louis dry rub ribs, along with two sides each (plus slaw). We left with another meal in leftovers!

We thought the meat was the star of the show, though we were pleasantly surprised with the non-mayo-y slaw.  Meat fell off the bone and nothing required a knife. Highly recommended - Go hungry!

These guys have just lost touch with reality, food is fine but an increase in their chopped brisket from $16.99 to $19.99 is evidence that their intent on gouging the "foodie" klans that roam Chicago. This place used to be nice departure from conventional cuisine but they're clearly intent on exploiting their "niche" in their culinary space. It's an easy decision for me, just say no, there is no justification for such drastic price increases that grossly outpace the rate of inflation, and I can assure none their employees saw a cent of this additional increase. Nice try, maybe the folks that come in from the suburbs will pay this ridiculous price but for those of us who live in the neighborhood understand what's going over there. Simple just don't go there any longer until they start to become reasonable.

Wouldn't have noticed this place if it wasn't featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.  It definitely lives up to the hype though - the meat is tender and the sauce is delicious.  The ribs and the brisket are the specialties and they are both pretty amazing.  

Expect to large portions and not much in the way of vegetables.  At the end of the meal I was very full but I kind of did want a bit more of the cole slaw and mac and cheese.  If you have space at the end, definitely try the bread pudding.

Not really what I expected. It's good BBQ but it's not the best I've ever had. The brisket was better than the ribs but they all had way too much sauce and it leaves you with an upset stomach. Mac & cheese is my favorite but I was very disappointed in theirs. It tasted like leftovers that were warmed up. The corn bread is very good - not dry at all. The prices are a bit high but they usually are for BBQ places. Would go again sometime.
Such great food! It's always packed here but that's never stopped me from enjoying my meal. I love how efficient the service and seating arrangements are. Did I also mention the food?! YUM!

Make sure you call and order ahead of time so you only need to pickup when you are there. Waiting for your food to get ready when you're hungry is no fun! At home we found out that they left out one whole slab of bbq that should've been included in the bag. Good thing they have great customer service so they had it delivered to our house free of charge. It was just the waiting part that's frustrating. Still, mouth watering food as always.

We pulled in here on our way out of Chicago.  Arrived at 11:30 a.m. and went right to the counter to order.  Got very busy soon after.  Very friendly staff.  Quite the assembly line pumping out the orders.  Nice ambience.  Lots of outdoor seating.  Got the sliced brisket platter with two sides, mac n cheese and fries.  They throw in coleslaw as well.  Added a quarter slab of St. Louis ribs for an extra $5.  The brisket was incredible.  Great smoke, great bark, super tender.  The ribs were very good but a little chewy, not as tender.  The mac n cheese was excellent, cheesy with a nice crust.  The fries were delicious and a generous portion.  The coleslaw was different, like just cabbage dressed lightly with vinegar.  Refreshing but not my favorite.

I may be biased being from Kansas City. That said, the brisket was pretty good but I really didn't care for the sauce.  They didn't really seem to have an identity either. The brisket felt like a Texas style but the sauces were Memphis style and Carolina style. It did enough to fill my BBQ cravings for another few weeks but I'm going to have to look around some more for a favorite BBQ place in Chicago. Might retry this place and bring some of my own KC BBQ sauce. Overall, 4 stars for the brisket, 1 star for the sauce
My daughter love this place they go after school and get fries with bbq sauce. Lol BBQ is delicious and the sausage is spice but good.

Stopped by here after landing in Chicago and beginning the drive to Detroit. Got the chopped brisket and my lady got the sliced. By 2 am she had the worst case of food poisoning I've ever seen. It was completely disgusting.

Parking is non-existent and the neighborhood had signs posted that you weren't allowed to park on their street to go to smoques.

I thought the meat was dry. Maybe it was just an off night based off the 3400 reviews giving it a 4.5 star total. But i personally wouldn't return here. Ever.

Very good BBQ.  I had the Texas sausage and my beau had the pulled pork.  Comes with two BBQ Sauce options and two sides (when ordering the plate).

Easy to order and the kind gentlemen is watching out for the open table to direct you to.  Do not plan on having any in depth conversations as the tables are pretty tight together and the noise can get quite loud.  There is a patio area that i'm sure will be packed in the summer time.

Can't wait to come back.

Decided to visit this place cause of the reviews and I must say the food was good....ribs are very tasty and tender. Service was prompt and staff were nice. Place is kinda small but who cares I'll go again
This was my first time eating at Smoque and it was a good experience. I got the pulled pork sandwich. The meat was absolutely melt-in-your-mouth tender. Will definitely come back!

Everything here is amazingly delicious.   The fries are so good I couldn't stop eating them and I'm not a big fan of fries.  The ribs are cooked perfectly and the rub they use is excellent.  But what makes the place also great is their customer service.  The guys that seat you are vey helpful and very polite.  They make sure that you have everything you need and they even open the doors for you.  The place always had a line that seemed to be endless, but you don't have a very long wait.  You won't be disappointed!

pics.caption: Cole slaw was refreshing! Brisket chili beans super delicious.

review.des:
Chicago isn't a place particularly known for BBQ but with a record like the one it has on Yelp it was a must try. I have high expectations for BBQ joints. No, I'm not from the South and won't harp on authentic this or non authentic that. I just love meat and BBQ so much that I would go broke going out to eat it all the time. So instead I make the time to make it myself hours at a time in my own smoker. I know how much care and time it takes to do this. It can't be rushed, and mistakes covered with sauce will be wet messy mistakes indeed.

So yeah, Smoque fits the bill. I ordered the brisket with two sides (Mac and Cheese, and fries) and it came with coleslaw. What's nice is that they allow you to add "tastes" of the other meats. Perfect for someone like me who just has to try everything. Texas Sausage? Yes. Some of the ribs? Thank you very much.

I can confirm that the meat is done right. They provide sauce on the side and serve the meat dry. It allows me to add sauce to my own taste and judge the meat by its own merit. Which, was very good. Right consistency, which is to say fragile and about to break down from its time in the smoker. Perhaps a tad dry but I understand they have to do it ahead for the volume expected of a restaurant. The sauces also were not overly sugary brown concoctions either. Had some variety and some kick if you wanted as well.

Sides were good, but with a special note on coleslaw that isn't just green mayo mash. Eat up fellow carnivores!

pics.caption: Brisket
St. Louis Style Ribs
Texas Sausage

review.des: Yummy bbq, I crave it all the time. All the meat options are great and make sure you try a bunch of the sides. The Mac and cheese and apple pie are my faves. Writing this is making me want to drive there right now...

Seriously!?!?!
How did this place get 3000+ reviews with 4.5 stars!?

First sign that this place wasn't going to be awesome. It didn't have a good smoky smell nor did I see smoke wafting up in the back of the building.

Second sign. Lunch time and there was only 3 people in line. And empty tables. ON A FRIDAY.

Baby back ribs - I'm not sure if they were serving ribs or charcoal biscuits. The meat was horrendously charred and it was so dry it was like eating firewood. Disgusting. No clue how this made it onto the menu.

St. Louis ribs - finally. A decent item. No smoke ring on the food, no beautiful pink luscious layer of smoky goodness. Just an average rib.

Brisket - Definitely not Prime grade brisket ( oh how I miss you Franklin's!). No luscious fat webbing. No pink smoke layer. No excitement.

Sausage - Nothing to write home about. I still have dream's about Franklin's sausage. This was similar to something found in a dog treat.

Only awesome items here were the BBQ beans and the mac and cheese. Everything else was a total miss.

Sad part was that I was washing my hands and saw that they were using some industrial sized oven back there "barbequeing" Hm...

Avoid. Totally wasted a meal of stomach space here in Chicago.

#sodisappointed

pics.caption: BBQ medley... So disappointing. Did not live up to the hype and the smoke ring - nonexistent.

review.des: Excellent bbq!!!!! Very busy but it explains why! They have amazing ribs and pulled pork sandwich from which I have tried! I'll definitely come back soon!
This is probably the best BBQ joint in Chicago. Although I will have to say that the sauces are bit lacking, the meats are definitely good quality and never disappoint.

I ate out of hunger and although it wasn't bad, Smoque just isn't on the same playing field as southern BBQ that we have in Atlanta.  Would give this place a 3.8

It's located outside of downtown, so I was expecting more to compensate our drive out here.  It is more organized than most of the BBQ joints in Atlanta where they actually seat you.  Kudos for that!  

For a party of 4, we ordered a pound of sliced brisket, full rack of the St. Louis rib, cole slaw, mac n' cheese, bbq beans, fries, corn bread, and peach cobblers.  On the exterior the meat looks a bit over-charred but it wasn't burnt at all, which was good.  Ribs were decent but the brisket was just too dry.  Fries were cold and stale, cole slaw had no flavor, but mac n' cheese was pretty decent, as well as the corn bread.  The crusts of the peach cobbler was delicious, but once you pass the crust, it's like eating canned peaches heated up.  All time favorite was the bbq beans!!! It's flavorful, sweet, bbq-y, tangy, and everything you can ask for.  

So, yes, I engulfed the meal out of hunger, but it was a disappointment.

pics.caption: Feasting
Full St. Louis rack + mac n' cheese + fries
Pound of brisket + slaw + BBQ beans

review.des: This restaurant catered our block party.  The food was delicious a d plentiful.

I've heard this this place can be a pretty long wait, but I came here on a Thursday night and the line was perfectly fine. There is also plenty of parking in the area, which is handy if you're coming from the north side.

I came here with my infamous deadly allergy friend, and they were able to accommodate it easily. The manager listed off the menu items that fit the allergies and would be safe to eat.

I got the brisket platter with chili and fries, which also included slaw. The brisket was smoky and tender, and the sauces that came with it were delicious! I couldn't stop dipping things into them. The fries were crispy and the chili had a nice amount of spice to it.

Smoque also has an assortment of funky sodas, so I got Leninade to satisfy my Communist cravings.

I will definitely return to try out the ribs, which I shied away from this time because of price. But now, I'm confident they will be worth it.

pics.caption: Leninade!

review.des:
St. Louis and Babyback Rib combo was dank! There is no doubt in my mind this is the best BBQ in the city. I love my St. Louis ribs at Salt + Smoke in STL, but man, these guys just do it right here. Definitely deserves the 5 star rating!
Mac n' cheese was pretty good and definitely worth getting, but maybe not going out of your way for just it.
Beans were super good too and really hearty with meat (I imagine like most places they use drippings and leftovers from the uneaten meat the day before, so they're bound to be good).
Hard to choose between the sauces, which for me makes so much of BBQ, but the rub is what they have right here, on both sets of ribs, even if the BBQ is good. I'd probably go with the spicy (not too much of a kick).
Business is crackin and the service is pretty quick, especially for a Friday night. The dudes watching over the floor are super efficient and flip tables super quick. It also attracts a lot of cool and friendly people. Really good experience!
Very happy we finally made it! If you don't have time, make sure you get an order to go.
Parking on the street or in the back.

pics.caption: Facade

review.des:
Was not familiar with this style of bbq but Husband and I LOVED IT !! Everytime we'd drive by here It had a Long ass Line of people Outside waiting to order  and one day there were only a few people inside and that's when we took our chance and I loved Everything! the Fries, the Mac n Cheese, pretty much everything!
Will definitely come back for more !
As good as the other reviews suggest. Baby back ribs are the best. Brisket also excellent but not sure why others are sweating it so hard. Get the ribs. Just go there.

Wasn't able to try Smoque last time I was in Chicago, so I had to make sure I came this time around. Went during lunch with 3 friends. Ordered the rib combo platter (6 St. Louis and 6 baby backs), the sliced brisket platter, 2 extra sausages, a side of pulled pork, 2 orders of fries, 2 corn breads, 2 mac n cheese, brisket chili and an extra coleslaw. Regretted ordering the extra coleslaw because each platter actually comes with a side already, so we ended up with 3 coleslaws. Also tried both the Memphis and Carolina BBQ sauce. Both different in their own way.

- I liked the St. Louis ribs a bit more. It had more meat than the baby backs and a lot less dry. There was just enough smokiness.
- The sausages were juicy and not too salty, I basically ate majority of it.
- The pulled pork was okay, a little on the dry side and lacking flavor.
