- Sliced brisket was BOMB. I tend to find brisket too dry but this place was tender, juicy, with just enough fat to balance the meat.
- Corn bread was good when warm, but was a little dry once it cooled down.
- Fries were piping hot, fresh, and perfectly crisp on the outside. So good, we ended up buying seconds! Large, that is!
- Coleslaw has just enough vinegar to balance all the meat.
- Mac n cheese was worth getting another, creamy and oh, so cheesy.
- Brisket chili, I could've done without... It was left untouched by the group, watery and not a big fan of too many beans.

Overall, worth stuffing half my weight in food. It was more than enough food for all of us.. I was surprised we didn't have much left to take home for leftovers.

This place is just ok. The food is good and it presents well, but you are stuck in a little shack with no alcoholic options. If I lived closer, the place would probably have more starts. However, there are other better options near where I live, like Green Street Meats (BBQ + Booze + Seating + Bar atmosphere).

pics.caption: Sliced Brisket Combo with slaw, brisket chilly and bbq beans.

review.des: What can I say about this BBQ joint??? I have been to Memphis, Nashville, St. Louis, and North Carolina and none compares to my beloved Smoque.  I can't believe I have yet to review this amazing restaurant because It never fails or disappoints.  Even after a  decade of visits I never tire of the incredible food. From the ribs to the mac & cheese and of course the brisket the quality is superior.  My experience tells me that no other state in this country can compare it the barbecue served here in Chicago   I no longer seek barbecue in any other state other than my hometown Chicago.  Smoque you're the absolute best!.

Bbq in Chicago is generally disappointing, so this place stands out as one of the top spots for me. It's nothing compared to Texas or Kansas City, but in my eyes it's pretty damn good.

The brisket at Smoque is really something to write home about. So rich and smokey and unbelievably tasty. The chicken is good too, really recommended if you like smoked chicken. I had to give the ribs a few tries before I warmed up to them, but I think they're great. The meat definitely doesn't fall off the bone, you're going to be using your jaw a little (which isn't necessarily a bad thing, just depends on your preference) but the ribs are charred in that special way that brings out every ounce of flavor in the meat.

My recommendation: Chopped brisket sandwich with a side of fries and mac n cheese, cornbread instead of coleslaw, and a rib add-on, which is just a few bucks extra.  You'll get plenty of food and a great showcase of some of the best bbq in this terrible city.

The French fries were yummy, the pulled chicken was great. The bbq options were amazing, it gets crowded and people are bumping into each other because of the seating arrangements but besides that...yummy yummy yummy

BEST BBQ place in the USA !!!!! EVERYTHING in the menu is DELICIOUS !!!! You can't go wrong with this awesome place, you need to try it out !!!! Restaurant is not that big so sometimes you might need to wait for a table but it's worth it.

pics.caption: BEST BBQ PLACE IN THE USA

review.des: We tried this restaurant for the first time and while the St Louis ribs were meaty and delicious, the baby backs were dry and unappealing. We also had the chopped brisket and mac n cheese-dry with little favor. The brisket chili was very tasty. Not our favorite Triple D place at all.
Great traditional bbq.  Cafeteria style serving trays with BYOB.   Delicious meats (ribs, pulled pork & brisket.  Sides could of been a touch warmer.
Get the pulled pork!  Everything is really good, but pork is the BEST pulled pork I've ever had!!
Don't sleep on the pecan bread pudding! Brisket and sides are great. Definitely going again.

Great place to buy Bbq. This place puts south side Chicago on the map. It's hard to order only one thing on the menu here
There small order of tips &link- great portion and taste in mean,price is more than fair if you half a couple extra bucks
The Half slab has enough meant, there not the kind with big bones and very lil mean. Quite the contrary,there is more then enough meant for one Big person(like myself )
There wings also Good . Are they Special to me No but there good.
Let's bot forget about the Sauce,there hot one in particular. Nothing crazy hot just a tad bit spicy. Order it on the side to get the ribs full flavor for the first time
Hands down best BBQ brisket sandwich I've ever had. The meat was lean, the flavor was full, and the char was perfect. Drool-worthy!

Absolutely the best BBQ in all of Chicago and certainly ranks up in the top 10 in the country. Smoked to perfection meats esp the brisket. Fast and friendly service, lines can be long on busy days but worth the wait.
I live on the west coast and make it a point to stop by whenever I am in Chicago
Great Q!! Line gets long but moves pretty fast. Seating is tight, but during the summer when the patio is open, no prob. Service is always great. Meat quality is great and not overpriced!!
Always amazing you can never go wrong eating here it's good good food! We've been eating here since they open their doors and no one even knew they existed. So happy to see they are still around.
Best BBQ in the world. So sad we waited so long to go here! Everything is delicious!!!!

Y'know, everyone has different tastes and ideas as to what constitutes good BBQ.  For me, Smoque is on top of the heap with the best St. Louis ribs I've found in Chicagoland.  Not everyone who has accompanied me to Smoque would agree, though.

Here's my take: Their ribs are very meaty and tender, with a bit of char on the outside.  Slow-cooking melts away most of the fat.  The woody-smoky flavor is just right and does not overwhelm the flavor of the pork.  The meat does not quite fall off the bone, but you don't have to do much gnawing either.  Ribs are served dry, with the sauce on the side.  The "Memphis" BBQ sauce is better'n any I've had in Memphis.

Sides?  So far, I have had the fries, baked beans, corn bread, and cole slaw,  All are topnotch.   Staff keeps an eye on the dining area, making sure that needs are met.  If you prefer your ribs non-smoky and drowned in a sweet BBQ sauce, you might be disappointed.  But if you're a fan of truly authentic 'cue, Smoque is 4 U.
Out of this world BBQ. I know I am not the only one. Even when you pick up yo take home ! Good!

I love BBQ and I cook KCBS Competition BBQ I've been to a lot of the top places in this country. Franklin's in Austin, Memphis BBQ Co, Lockhart TX and eaten at the big three so when I say this I have the credentials to back it up. This is one of the top 5 places I've been to. I say this because most places do one or two things good but the other are not. Example the Brisket in TX is amazing but they do a bad job at pork ribs. Memphis does good pork but bad Brisket so on and so on. But here at Smoque they did everything well.

Brisket Excellent
Ribs Excellent
TX Sausage, is very similar to the Lockhart style sausage
Beans are just like OK Joes and they are some of the best in the world.
Pork, good
Corn Bread is a can't miss

So good! My husband and I split the Sliced Brisket Platter with fries and mac & cheese. We also love the gumbo!

The biggest drawback is the layout. They do a great job of moving the line and seating you but it's still annoying to be crammed so close to everyone and feel like people are on top of you when they're waiting in line. But we usually avoid this by just going during off hours. 5pm dinner!

Really great bbq join! Loved the food & the sides were awesome. Coleslaw was was different, more acidic with vinegar but added a good balance to the meats. The meats were not as good as I've had before though. Brisket and ribs were a bit dry but still very yummy. My fiancé likes when the meat falls off the bone & it didn't :( again, overall the food was killer.

I liked the pulled pork and bread pudding a lot, but the BBQ beans had some flavor I couldn't put my finger on, and didn't love. Also, the bun for the sandwich was super dry and distracted from the quality of the sandwich.

Don't get me wrong, this was still great BBQ, but I guess I had higher expectations because of all the accolades, and couldn't help but notice a few things to improve upon.

I recently used Smoque to cater a family party in Fathers Day.  I was absolutely impressed.  I have used various catering services often for both work and family and My experience with Smoque was one of the easiest and best.  I called to make the order and the head of catering was very friendly and efficient.  My pick up time was available and she included plates, napkins, and serving supplies. On pick up day, catering orders do not need to wait in the long regular line, you just go to the front and tell them you have catering, which I appreciated.  There was a two minute wait and I was offered a free drink!  Nice!!  Then, a lady brought out boxes , double checked everything was there (THANK YOU!!) and even loaded boxes into my car.  Everyone loved the brisket, pulled pork, beans, and Mac.  The salad was pretty bland and boring so I'd skip that next time.  Everything else was amazing and well priced.  We will def use again.

This is by far the best place for BBQ hands down. We drive over an hour one way just to eat here. Mid afternoon is the best time that we have experienced. Everything is fabulous. We had pulled pork, ribs, brisket and all of the sides. We were just saying that Smoque is better then most places in the country that we have been to.

We had the beef brisket and St Louis ribs. The brisket was ok, but the ribs were the best. They have amazing sauces that combines well with the ribs and the brisket. We will definitely visit this place again.
Best Bar be que and smoked meats.  Worth the wait.  Worth the drive.  The sides are delicious. We enjoy this place.

Wow.  2nd to Pappy's in St. Louis.  But definitely beats Nashville, which is crazy.

The St. Louis ribs were flavorful and fell off the bone.  Skip the cornbread, and get the fries and mac n' cheese.  Their cole slaw is surprisingly legit as well.  

Service is super friendly and helpful.  A well-oiled machine to get people moving through, but we never felt rushed.  Also, if you don't mind a short walk, you can take the blue line from the city.

Heard good things for years and didn't disappoint once I finally tried it! Tried the baby back ribs which was a decent, tender, portion with a side of pulled pork. The sauces were delicious, especially the spicy one which is how I like my BBQ. Fries and cornbread were good too, the usual fare.

The only reason for the star knocked off is because of the wait. I came during a torrential downpour and still waited 20 minutes to order plus maybe 30 to get the food and a table. Worth it but they need a bigger space!

Best BBQ in Chicago. Seriously. Don't bother with other places. Just get in your car and drive there.
Try everything on the menu. Only thing I don't recommend is the dessert. But this place is the best.

Be prepare to wait in a long line out the door, but I believe it's well worth it! I got the pulled pork sandwich and it was really flavorful. The Mac and cheese was a great side choice as well. Definitely worth going at least once.
I've tried bbq in almost every city including Kansas City and Dallas, but Smoque is the best. The closest was in Cleveland Ohio and still smoque blows them away.

Their chicken is really good! If you don't eat red meat, but are still looking for a filling lunch option, definitely stop by. I opted for their house salad with chicken added, house vinaigrette, and a side of cornbread. I was a little worried that I was going to get a weak salad since it's a spot known for bbq, not salads, but I was totally surprised. I got a huge salad with fresh romaine lettuce pieces, smoked chicken pieces, and 2 small containers of their vinaigrette (so glad they gave them on the side so I could add as much or as little as I wanted). Vinaigrette was delicious. Cornbread was a bit on the small side, but still filling. Also, get the fries. I tried some of my boyfriend's and they were bombbbbbbb. Perfectly crispy and seasoned. The atmosphere is really chill too. Some families, couples, people on their lunch break. A place where you know everyone is really welcome. Just know that they prefer to seat groups once everyone is present. We were waiting for one more person to join before we got a table but the host let us put in our order and pay first. I guess they get really busy. All in all, even if there is a wait - definitely go!
Limited menu, lack of parking, slow service. Food is very salty.

Long time resident of Old Irving Park and fan of Smoque!  This is my 'go to' place and in the neighborhood. At least twice monthly we go to Smoque for the St.Louis style ribs, brisket, and chicken- all good, as is the salad.

Brought my boyfriend In here for a quick ,no frills, no wait  Sweetest day dinner this past weekend and boy oh boy did I forget how how much  l love their brisket !! Some of the best I have ever had !You MUST try their baked mac and cheese and the baked beans are also a fav.

They had a pecan bread pudding dessert  special that was like nothing I have ever had !I almost made  my boyfriend buy his own but I couldn't afford all those extra calories especially since  we also split the peach cobbler .

If you love BBQ you have to check this place out !
THE Best BBQ in the city!  The food never disappoints - always satisfied!  Great options and communication for your catering needs - prepped and packaged ready for your party.
Still the best bbq in town. Great ribs, good sauce, decent sides, the best brisket... pretty informal, the line moves fast, and it is byob inside.

OMG I can't believe I never wrote a review for this place.  For me Smoque is SMOKIN!!!  Their ribs are the best I've ever had.  Both the baby back and the St Louis ribs are kick ass, cooked and seasoned to perfection.  Their brisket is also awesome super tender.  They have a good barbecue sauce, but I recommend trying it without the sauce first and add as needed because the meats are already cooked and seasoned to perfection and don't need a lot of extras.

As far as the sides they are ok, but I am a meat aficionado and I go there for the MEAT.  I go there for the kick ass ribs and brisket and don't need to fill up on the sides.

Yes there can be long lines especially at peak areas like lunchtime around 12-2P or dinner 5-8 but people cycle through pretty fast.  I found the best time if you want to avoid the crowds is in between 2-5.  You can get in get your Brisket or rib fix and get out without waiting

An interesting sidebar I took a trip to Memphis for a few days in December 2015.  On my bucket list of places to go eat were "Gus World famous fried Chicken" (absolutely fabulous) and barbecue ribs as Memphis is known for that.  Maybe I chose the wrong place, but I found the ribs to be sadly lacking.  There are at least 1/2 dozen places in Chicago that I have eaten at that have better ribs

If you haven't been to "Smoque" yet and you like ribs or brisket this is an absolute must.

Some of the best brisket in the city. If you're showing up on a clear day, be prepared for a long wait in the line but it's well worth it.

Great helpful staff and great service rounds out a great BBQ eating experience.

Recommendations

- Sliced brisket
- Texas Sausage
- Ribs [I'm a St. Louis ribs man but the Baby Back is good too]
- Mac n Cheese
- BBQ Beans
- For a limited time, the BBQ gumbo
- Handiwipes

Without a doubt, the best barbecue place in Chicago. Sure, you'll almost always have to wait in line, but the staff does its best to move things along, and you'll find plenty of seating.

I've probably tried everything on the menu and have been wowed by each. Just make sure you go hungry and if you want alcohol, bring your own.

And...despite being a 'trendy' spot, I've never found it to be a bro or hipster spot, which is a plus in my book. You'll be surrounded by some friendly folks who like good food.
Best BBQ i've ever had by a mile. their ribs and brisket are soo tender and delicious. their cobbler is also really good.

Fall off the bone ribs.  'Nuff said.

It's good BBQ... but I don't drive in from the suburbs for it anymore as I have found tastier places by me.  If you're in the area (or just in general, the city) drive over and grab a bite.  

I've never had an issue with parking.  They have a lot and street parking is plentiful.  

There can be lines as you wait to place your order at the counter and you may panic wondering where you'll be able to sit and eat, but spots miraculously open up by the time you pay.

Smoque does a great job with catering and large orders - which is a huge draw for me during bowl games and family gatherings.

Da food here is off the chain.....
Da mac and cheese, da cheesy potatoes r the bomb...
Da service here is friendly, very thoughtful n attending

4 words...The Best Brisket Ever.  I think all the 5 star cazillion reviews here are a testament to how popular, authentic & delicious Smoque BBQ is, so I will try to keep this simple.  I have been here twice.  This place is small, and with its growing fan base I imagine at some point they will relocate to a larger space.  They have limited parking behind the restaurant and luckily we found a spot!

The best brisket I have had anywhere period.  Sliced or chopped, it has the right amount of smokiness, fat, and is the most tender brisket I have ever had.  Yes, it does melt in your mouth and leave you wanting more.  First time here came with a group of 7 and we must have been very lucky arriving on a weekend around 5pm with a short line.  Line was pretty fast paced and yes you do have to scope out a table when walking in, however I was really impressed with the staff assisting us in landing a table & making sure we were taken care of.  This place gets busy, busy, busy...you come, you stuff your face and you leave.  If you think Q's has great brisket, try it here.

Everyone tried the brisket, pulled pork, baby backs, St. Louis ribs, chicken, mac & cheese and cornbread for sides.  We did not try the Texas sausage. You can also 'add a taste' for $4-$6.00 which is great for sampling.  Chicken was juicy and moist, DELISH - Brisket came in as the winner, runner up's:  pulled pork & St. Louis ribs.  Although these were not fall of the bone ribs, they were tasty & meaty, but I wanted them to be more tender.  The spice rub is not overpowering, the meat is not 'overly smoky'.  Love the rub and you could go without any sauce.  Pulled pork was tender & tasty.  Sides were great as well, but you come here for the BBQ.

Sauces?  not my favorite, too sweet for my taste, I prefer more vinegar.  We asked about the different sauces they had and someone in the kitchen mentioned they use Coca Cola.  I could actually taste it in the sauce.  May contribute to why the sauce is on the sweeter side.  Either way, the BBQ here is one of the best in Chicago, these guys know BBQ.  It's worth the trip.
Although a little pricey... I do love this place. It's worth it to stand in the long lines.... you kinda have to get a little bit of everything. Totally worth it.
The food was ok. It wasn't great, it wasn't horrible. It was just ok. The Texas sausage was bland and flavorless. The fries, slaw, and beans were pretty good.

Delicious, but be prepared to wait in a long line.  They are organized and seat you after you order, so you don't have to worry about people in back of you hogging the last table!  Dining room staff works extremely hard!

Only complaint was the worker didn't know if the cornbread was sweet (made with sugar), I should have ordered it to find out. Brisket was amazing. Sausage was a single link for $4.50, was ok flavor. Great thick sauce. Would definitely come back. BBQ beans are pretty tangy, not my preference but still good. This is a fast casual restaurant, but the service was really good.
Great BBQ, best place in town.  I love the brisket!  Must have, I moved and miss living close by!
Heaven!!! Meat just melts in your mouth.. Delicious bbq sauce.. Couldn't ask for more

I got 5 (stars) on it!!

This place is awesome.  It can get crowded, but they do a great job of keeping things orderly with the seating, the line, etc.  Great job on the execution of that.

The meat was delicious.  The brisket, the pulled pork and the ribs were all excellent.  The brisket was the best in my opinion.  I also suggest the fries as a side.  They are tasty and they give you a ton.  I do not recommend the beans.  I just didn't like them.  The mac and cheese was good, but it was small.  The cornbread was also good, but small.

They have byob, I repeat byob.  Just bring in whatever you have and go to town.

I thought the prices were reasonable on all fronts, but when you figure in that you can byob, the value goes up exponentially.

The girl working the cash register was nice and answered all the questions I had both times I went.  Yes, there were two visits to smoque during the trip to Chicago...

Yes that is a 750ml bottle. It went down!

pics.caption: I told you i made two visits
Bbq!

review.des:
The brisket and the turkey are wonderful. Portions are generous. Four sauces are all great. The rendition of Carolina style is more  tomato and thicker than typical, but imho preferred.

The only thing holding back a 5-star is the sides. Potato salad is just odd. Tasted like jicama! Blech. Beans are... meh. Cole slaw is passable but a bit soggy and vinegar - half way to kimchee without the spice.

Just left and had myself a taco Tuesday and was really happy with the quality of the food. It wasn't a huge amount but hey no one needs huge portions all the time. Economical delicious meal! Many thanks, I'll be back soon!
This gem is what makes living in the city of Chicago worth all the hassles!  Outstanding BBQ at reasonable prices, friendly staff, and right in our neighborhood.

im giving four stars just for the baby back ribs. those ribs were so tender and so flavorful.
my bf and i had high expectations of this place because of the reviews on yelp. but it wasnt as great as we thought would be. it just seemed average.
we went on saturday morning at 11 right when they opened up. by 1130 the place got full. you order at the counter and pick up the food when they call your number.

we got...
baby back ribs
st louis style ribs
pulled pork
brisket
cornbread, peach cobbler, coleslaw, mac&cheese

i personally loved the baby back ribs. so tender. st louis style ones are bit more meaty and chewy i would say .. compared to other ones
pulled pork was great too. im not a fan of brisket so i didnt enjoy but it was very tender. i loved the coleslaw and cornbread but i wouldnt get peach cobbler and mac&cheese again.
overall ribs and pulled pork were good. a lot of ppl seemed to get sandwiches. this place is good.

Friendly service!
Nice outdoor patio!

But.

I was super excited to try the highest rated bbq in Chicago.  I came here with a serious fan, so even better!  But sadly, imo the bbq is not what I would call good enough to rate as great, & if this is truly the best bbq in Chicago, I'm staying home in LA for my q from here on out.

Brisket - nice bark, but even when I requested fatty PLEASEplease fatty, what we got was very much on the lean side.  So, sadly not marbled fatty - or fat layer fatty, and so not flavorful enough for me.  This brisket is the reason I tried their sauces - which is not a positive thing to say.  Pass.

Baby back ribs - delish taste - but on the dry side and again, pretty lean (not a compliment coming from me).  Pass.

Mac & Cheese - thank god it's small, bc it's really gooooood - tender cheesy baked sauce parts, cheesy crusty top, yum!

Chili - great tasting, if you love lots of kidney beans

Sausage - juicy, flavorful, not overly salty - prob my fave out of all the meats, but I wouldn't come back just for this

The lean brisket made me sad honestly.  But I do think that if you like your cue leaner, you'll like it here much better than I did.  They are very friendly, & I love warm service, so I would come back to try the St. Louis ribs - which they did say are fattier.

If you're on the same page as me re: your preference in Q, message me when you come to LA, & we'll go to Bludso's, Barrel & Ashes, Horse Thief or Holy Cow ; ).

pics.caption: Brisket
Baby backs, sausage, brisket, coleslaw, chili, mac & cheese

review.des: Can't beat the barbecue best in Chicago I wish there was a just a little less smoke on the ribs but the brisket is the best by far

Best BBQ place in the city.

The space is small for how popular it is.  You usually wait in a line during peak hours and you'll have to stake out for a spot to sit at.  However it's all worth it when you bite down into your BBQ.

Their BBQ brisket and BBQ chicken are so delicious!  I don't have any idea about the science behind smoking but whatever it is they have it down.  Their chicken, ribs, and brisket are always nice and moist (literally falls off the bone).  All their food has a nice and delicious hickory, woody, smokey taste.

Their sauces and their sides are just as great.  While I normally think homemade BBQ sauce is vinegary I think Smoque's is not vinegary at all.  My favorite is their hot sauce, I can put that thing on everything.  

But their sides... wow!  Unfortunately for other BBQ places in the city, when I think of BBQ sides I always compare others' to Smoque's.  The cornbread, the mac and cheese, the cole slaw, the peach cobbler, the fries... it's all so good.  You won't go wrong anyway so try them all.  

They are BYOB so it makes for a nice evening if you're able to sit outside.  Be prepared to eat and leave though, this is not a sit and hang out type of place.

pics.caption: Smoked chicken breast, Cole slaw, peach cobbler, Mac and cheese, and hot sauce. Yum!

review.des: While they still hold the Chicago brisket championship belt in my mind, I can no longer call them my favorite barbeque in Chicago, although that's no fault of theirs. Still my go to when I get a barbeque craving and they're quick, convenient, and reasonably priced. Sides here are excellent which is an important part of any barbeque restaurant.

So hungry and excited to try one of the most popular restaurants in Chicago, my friends and I stopped here for lunch and drinks. It's BYOB so we brought a few bottles of Stella to accompany our ribs. Between 4 people, we shared 2 racks of ribs, a platter of beef brisket, and a platter of pulled pork + sides (mac & cheese, fries, and a salad. Total was $50ish. The food came out pretty fast and we digged in (after a few pictures for social medias).

The baby back ribs were dry rubbed and I did not enjoy it as much as Pappy's in St. Louis or Phil's in San Diego, CA. But my friend, who is an expert in ribs and he loves dry rubbed, loved the ribs here. The meat is good but the meat didn't fall off as easily and not as tender. You do get to dip into different sauces that are available and each one has a subtle difference.

The sides aren't unique and nothing stood out.

The beef briskets were super tender and just melts in your mouth. I think that was my favorite part of the meal. The pulled pork was seasoned pretty well, but it's nothing amazing.

I guess I failed to see what got all the other 3000 people to think that this place is amazing...

Street parking is fairly easy to find and it's free!

pics.caption: Beef brisket top left, pulled pork bottom left, 2 slabs of ribs

review.des:
I had high expectations for Smoque after seeing it featured on a number of shows and the great reputation through word of mouth. I certainly do not want to deter you from trying this place out but I was not impressed with the sliced brisket or pulled pork. The meat was on the drier side and sauces were not well balanced, too much smoke and spice and not enough sweet. But BBQ is a lot of personal preference. The sides were smaller than expected as well. The Mac and cheese was tasty but again, small portions. My favorite dish was the BBQ Gumbo, which I think is safe to say consists of the older meat. But it had good flavors especially when mixed with cole slaw and cornbread. The Coca-Cola was also on point. Overall, it's hard to head that way again especially considering how close I am to Green Street Smoked Meats. But again, I'd encourage you to try this place out yourself.

-Order up with a smile

Wow!!! Where do I start?

First of all, my first exposure to Smoque BBQ was when my employer hired them to cater our 'indoor' barbeque.   That was the first time I had that scrumptious and tender and juicy Brisket.    OMG!!!

Other co workers liked the barbeque chicken and pulled pork but I kept getting more brisket.  Anyone who knows me, knows I am a meat and meat and meat and potato girl.  So I kindof sampled their Mac N Cheese, Cole Slaw (which was more on the vinegar side) and Corn bread.   All sides were good.

But I want to mention, my employer paid extra for Smoque to come and cater / serve their meals.  I highly recommend paying the extra money.   They have that process down to a SCIENCE.  Very detailed, clean, organized and they even pack up any leftovers with labels.   How awesome is that?

But today, my husband and I finally W`E`N`T to Smoque.   Yes, I was warned that their place is small and to avoid busy meal times.   So, of course, we went around 12:30pm.  Oh well.   But while we were waiting in line to order, a gentleman asked how many in our party.  I'm so glad they did not place that burden on us.  This way, they had an employee looking for seating for any guests who were dining.   And before our number was even called, this gentleman had found a seat for us.

Keep in mind, you will get to sit closer to the people next to you.  But I do not think you will be bothered to carry a conversation because all of us were busy eating this awesome barbeque meal.

The staff at Smoque was so nice.  Even when I asked for a 'to go' container, the young lady asked me if I wanted a bag.  Very thoughtful.  I also appreciate that they cleaned the table each time before a new guest sat down.  

Well, I left there stuffed and I think I am still stuffed hours later.   But by next week, I hope my husband asks me, "Hey do you want to go to Smoque?"   And before he finishes his question, I will be in the car---waiting in the passenger seat.

pics.caption: The Chopped Brisket meal with Fries & Cornbread.  Coleslaw comes with it.   Wow!!!

review.des: Wow, I've never had such scrumptious and authentic BBQ as this place.  My mate, whom has eaten BBQ in many states, also raves about this place.  It is the real deal.  They are so busy that you are ensured fresh and hot ribs, brisket, pulled pork, chicken, BBQ beans, cornbread, slaw, etc..  We always head West on 94 to get our fix.  It is a treat to eat there.
Mediocre at best. Slow service, lack of variety, hard to find parking neraby.
Heavy hickory and Smokey flavor.  The ribs fall off the bone and are not consistent, sometimes good, sometimes stringy.
I needed an awesome "thank you" lunch for some awesome volunteers. Smoque BBQ was the answer. 100% awesomeness.

Lineup to get in the door built some anticipation, didn't really like the menu structure but the food was really good. As usual with a BBQ place, ordered too much and paid for it the next day. Had the brisket platter with the taste of pulled pork, ribs, and sausage - decided to have the 1/2 and 1/2 sliced & chopped brisket, would def recommend. It ended up being really, really tasty but it was too much food. Great service, the staff was really awesome and super helpful. Above all, would definitely recommend the bread pudding for dessert - so good. Had the menu ordering structure been more friendly, would have given a five star

pics.caption: Too much for 1 person to eat in 1 sitting

review.des: My cousins and I come to this place whenever we're in the mood for delicious BBQ food for more reasons than one. The first being that it has so many Yelp reviews with an overall outstanding rating. If the majority of the reviews are high-rating, the business is doing something right. Secondly, the service here is awesome too! The employees are very welcoming and conscientious about their actions. They are always attentive - offer to throw your trash away, offer more sauce, looking for spots to seat you, etc. Most importantly, their food is phenomenal!!!! They have so many BBQ meats and delicious side options to choose from. I usually order the brisket, ribs, or chicken as those are my favorite types of meat. The brisket and ribs fall right off the bone - it's seriously that soft! Memphis BBQ is my recommendation for sauces. As far as sides, they are all worth trying. Personal favorites are the cole slaw and mac and cheese. In addition to that, the prices are rather affordable as well. I highly highly recommend this place!

pics.caption: Chicken!
Brisket

review.des: This place is overrated, a bit pricey as well for the portions you recieve, especially the sides. The only side that is a decent size is the fries. The ribs and chicken were both really dry. The seasoning didn't really have a wow factor, it was so-so. The brisket chili taste like the smell of wet dog. Six bucks for the smallest piece of ribs for six more buck I could go to goodis and get me a chicken and ribs dinner that would put this place to shame, especially considering goodis isn't a bbq place.

I shouldn't have to write a review for this place. It's really fantastic. There are lines. It's unbelievably crowded. No, the BBQ won't beat that side-of-the-road place you stopped at while roadtripping from florida. BUT it's pretty darn good.

I won't go into too much detail about the food. There are hundreds of articles and reviews and blogs about this place. Smoque has a reputation similar to the late Hot Doug's. The employees take pride in the food and are happy to serve you. Prices aren't even that bad. Anywhere in the suburbs will charge you similarly.

This isn't a must visit of Chicago that I would suggest to my visiting friends, but it's darn close. I would put this above Girl and the Goat but below Lawrence Fish Market in my biased and arbitrary rankings of best restaurants. Afterall, it's a huge pain to get to.

Still, enough bitching. I love the food here, and I'd be happy to eat my last meal on earth at Smoque. Be ready for the meat sweats and food lethargy afterwards. This will satisfy your BBQ craving if you are a Chicago native.

pics.caption: The menu

review.des: This BBQ is one of the best BBQ places in Chicago, absolutely fantastic food!  Everything was cut right in front of you and made to order.  I definitely will be back, and next time I am bringing a bigger appetite!

What can I say? Smoque is the best BBQ I've ever had - ever. I can't think of another place that comes close, and it's ruined all other BBQ places for me! We heard about it on "Check, Please!" a few years ago and have made this our staple.

I always get the pulled pork sandwich and a side of mac 'n cheese, but I know that the brisket is delicious, too. If you can't decide between the two, I'd recommend getting the half and half sandwich.

Expect a line when you go, but relax! It's part of the experience! The staff are always so friendly, and keep things moving. They'll ask you while you wait if you plan to dine in or take out. I really like sitting outside during the warmer months.

I recommend this to everyone!
The best barbeque ever!!  We get food for parties and for everyday dining.  We love it, esp the brisket!!

This place has the best barbecue I have ever had. I love barbecue and I take the drive from Wisconsin at least once a month to come here. It's worth the horrendous traffic. They recently added a seating area outside to double their seating, and they will still be full all the time. I love the sliced brisket, the sausage, the bread pudding. My husband loves the brisket and the pork, the peach cobbler and the beans. You can not go wrong here. EVERYTHING IS AMAZING!

3.2/5

I found this place due to all the amazing yelp reviews, but I was not as impressed as I thought I would be. The St. Louis ribs & the brisket was tender, but the sauces were just "okay". The sauce really makes or breaks the meal. The sides were small, but the fries were plenty. The peach cobbler was also my favorite part of the meal. If only they include a scoop of vanilla ice cream, that would really hit the spot. The service was amazing though. The server was very attentive. We were very pleased. I also love when parking is free. Just park along the roads nearby.

pics.caption: Half rack of St. Louis ribs & taste of brisket with peach cobbler, Mac & cheese, fries, & coleslaw

review.des: Omg Charles is very pleasant and outstanding I met him at a event that was catered had great knowledge on the food and was super friendly!! I will def be in to try some more amazing BBQ and will recommend it to close friends n family for events!!!
AMAZING BBQ! I tried this restaurant because of the positive reviews; and I am now one of them. Brisket is some of the best I've ever tasted.

pics.caption: Brisket, Ribs, Mac & Cheese, Beans and Slaw!

review.des: Awesome, small BBQ joint. The food is absolutely delicious. On a purely food front: some of the best BBQ I've had outside of Tejas. I guess it's the ambience that doesn't do it for me (as opposed to a Green Street, for example). Ambience goes a long way when it comes to BBQ. And the fact that I can't have a cold beer with my brisket. A man has his needs.

Great food.  Great service. The brisket is the best.  The chicken was assume.  The bread pudding wss the best.

Also fast and friendly.

In the area visiting family and I decided to return to SmoQue (after a previous visit 5 years ago).  I was not disappointed...at all.

I went with the half rack baby backs, with brisket chili and beans.  The ribs were ridiculously good.  Smoky, deliciously seasoned, slight pull...absolutely perfect, just the way I remembered from several years ago.  Use the sauce just to enhance, if you must, but the dry rub is delicious on its own...the sign of a truly great BBQ.

Parking can be an issue...do some homework, but make the time.  Well worth it.  I'll be back

Best barbecue joint near Lakeview! I read many great reviews about this place and the bar was set real damn high, and of course it exceeded all expectations.

I don't know about you but I'm REAL picky when it comes to barbecue places. The sauce has to be amazing, the meat has to be a certain way, and the smells have to be delicious. Smoque to-go was my first visit to this restaurant and walking in to pick up our order quickly exceeded one expectation quickly; smells.

Smells: oh man did it exceed expectation. The restaurant is on the smaller side but that just made everything better. The smells of bbq ribs and bbq pork sandwiches filled the air around us. I was automatically interested after opening the door.

Other foods that aren't ribs: after bringing the food home (1 St. Louis full slab with coleslaw, Mac n cheese, and beans) we were dying to dig in. The Mac n cheese was pretty standard but the crunchy top killed it. Don't even get me started on the coleslaw, completely reminded me of my UIUC days at Joes Burgers. The slaw was delicious and not overbearing. The beans were extraordinarily tasty (I wish I had more!!!) and now for the main course review.

Ribs: holy moly these were delicious. When people write reviews saying this was the best bbq place in Chicago for ribs, couldn't agree more! The ribs were well cooked and the meat on them was delicious!!!! There wasn't any fat it was all big juicy meats on the ribs. Incredible, it really was. The sauce BLEW MY MIND!!! they gave us two cups of the sauce and we finished both, craving more. The sauce was so good I could honestly eat it plain which is totally nasty but feels totally right.

Overall, this place exceeded expectations! Keep on doing the great rib work!

pics.caption: Smoque!
Meal!
Ribs!

review.des:
A friend and I stopped by for some brisket. I ordered 1 pound of brisket with 1/2 in slices and 1/2 in smaller pieces.
The slices here perfectly smoked and incredibly moist. Absolutely no need for bbq sauce. The brisket pieces were expectedly a bit dry.
The service was very friendly and the restaurant very clean.
I will be certainly returning.

pics.caption: yummy smoked brisket

review.des:
Chicago lands best place for bbq by default. It just middle of the road bbq, nothing special. I've been here 5 times and it's consistently been "ok."

The brisket is cooked well and is juicy but lacks a depth of flavor. The st Louis ribs fall off the bone but have dry tough bits as well. I've had a couple bites where I'm like "woah that was a good bite," only to find myself searching for another illusive bite.

The sauces: 2 different kinds both of which will never win any awards. KFC bbq sauce is better. Don't get me wrong I've tried almost every niche small batch bbq sauce at whole foods and KFC bbq sauce trumps em all.

The sides at smoque are good though better than the meat. Mac and cheese, beans, and the fries. Very tasty. Cole slaw is a freebie and you can taste why.

TLDR: decent meat, bring your own favorite bbq sauce w/ you. Their sides are tasty.

20-25 min wait at 6pm on a Saturday night is not bad for this place. They have a good system of seating and ordering.

The food is pretty darn great.
-Rib Combo. I can't say if the baby back ribs are necessarily better than the St Louis. They are just 2 versions and both are good. (I prefer baby back)
-Pulled pork - no need for additional bbq sauce. it's just great on it's on.
-sliced brisket - this was falling apart in a good way :)
- I actually like their coleslaw! - cuz it has no mayo...vinegar based. almost inspired me to figure out their recipe.

I like that the bbq sauce containers tells you which sauce to use for which meat. That was useful

pics.caption: Meat madness

review.des:
BBQ is such a hard thing to rate. I LOVE BBQ. Like, I would eat ribs with Cheerios if my society didn't collectively frown at how disgusting that is. So when I heard talk (like over and over again) about Smoque, I knew that would not so reluctantly have to give it a try.

The place is right off the interstate and parking has always been easy. Especially when I'm trying to get my lazy self moving on a Saturday to try to beat the lunch crowds. Always a plus.

The place is pretty small, but it is a food manufacturing powerhouse. They keep the line moving, they have plenty of people in the kitchen moving around like a well-oiled machine, and orders come out fairly quickly (which once you smell the sweet, sweet smell of smoked meat, waiting is not really option.)

The ribs are off the chain, the brisket I had was a little dry but still delicious, and the sides were solid. The peach cobbler is always a favorite and you can't really go wrong with the mac and cheese. They are one of the few places where these types of sides are cooked individually in foil containers for that extra feel of a personalized meal.

They have a solid selection of not-so-run-of-the-mill sodas as well to top off your meal with delicious, unnecessary calories.

Overall, solid BBQ (not the best I've ever had in my life, but definitely solid) and fast turn-around times make Smoque a pretty great choice for BBQ in Chicago.

Woah! This place is on FIYAH!

In honor of July 4th, why not talk about some good ol' fashion Chicago BBQ?

Brisket. Ribs. Slaw. What more could you ask for in one of the city's best BBQ spots?

My friend and I decided to come here for our monthly get-together. This time, we were down to take the Blue Line all the way up to Irving Park to try this place. On a Thursday evening, it wasn't packed at all. You go in, order at the counter, and then take a seat.

Each of us opted for the St. Louis Ribs ($16) and the Sliced Brisket ($14), and shared the meat. Mmm, the brisket here was definitely on point! It fell apart so easily, so you know it was very much on the tender side. We ordered our ribs dry-rub with their Memphis and Carolina sauces on the side. It was delicious as well, but I think I prefer the brisket. As for dipping sauce, the Carolina was definitely my choice- sweet and tangy!

The platters each come with two individual sides, and hands down our favorites were the baked beans and the mac & cheese. I've never tasted beans like these before. They were smoky and downright delicious! As for the later, the baked layer of crust on top was perfect in trapping the cheesy goodness underneath.

Smoque BBQ definitely reigns high on my list of fantastic meats in Chicago. Plus, it's BYOB (on the casual mind you- don't try to get too hammered in here), so pick out a nice beer to enjoy with your smokin' meal.
I had the baby back ribs, an they were amazing. Comes with slaw and two sides. Highly recommend this place for Memphis style BBQ.

a bit pricey but delicious non the less the staff was helpful and nice and the patio makes it an ideal spot for summer eatin'

i will for sure be back!!!!!!

They put tasty marinate in their bbq. We had ribs, brisket and pulled pork. They are all good and juicy. It was just delicious. Something that you should try when you go chicago. Will surely comeback.

Interesting observation to change my review, yet again: we call to place an order for pick up, and we are told it will take over an hour... fine, we run errands to kill time. I arrive, the people ahead of me order a to go order, and their food is ready in less than TEN minutes. Meanwhile, an hour later, our order is ready?! How does that work? I kindly asked how an order is placed and ready in less than ten minutes and we called over an hour ago? Both women immediately got hostile and defensive... I repeatedly said I'm simply asking bc we live close by and can come and place an order in person bc it's clearly faster... great food, but GEESH, second time the people behind the register have MAJOR attitude... just discovered Green Street Smoked Meats and may just get by BBQ Fix there where they are ALWAYS kind and polite.

Changing this review to five to match the quality of the food! Barry, the owner, truly cares about his customers, including customer service. Looking forward to continue to dine in, and we will attempt a second attempt at carry out soon!

One star for carry out service. The woman packing carry out orders with short dark hair in a hair net and tattoos was rude the moment I arrived (Saturday evening on 10/8/16 at 6:08 PM until 6:35 PM). I noticed she was friendly with every other person ahead of me and after me (all being male), giving them extra sauce, assuring their order was ready, etc. After waiting 20 minutes (past the time our order was supposed to be ready as stated on the phone), she called my order, didn't say a word when I walked up, I asked about sauces, she only nodded her head without a word (didn't even move her hands). We will never carry out again until she leaves or the service for carry out changes. The gentleman taking payment for carry out was beyond kind, as well as every other person working there. Such a shame as we have been going here for years, but she simply ruined my evening.

Baby Back Ribs did not disappoint.  They were smoky and very tender.  The mac and cheese is yummy as well as the cornbread.  The BBQ beans were a bit too much for my taste but nonetheless, the BBQ spot is mouthwatering.  Fair Prices.

Many folks were eating the brisket sandwiches which looks delicious.  I will try those next.
Service was outstanding! Great Q, love it Carolina style. Recommend for fast casual BBQ cravings. Patio seating and indoor seating available.

Sliced brisket was good, pulled pork just as good. You get two bbq sauces to pick from. One is thicker than the other. Skip the mac and cheese, unless you like the home made cheese sauce to be a little grainy. But even then still didn't make me wish to have more. Fries are fresh cut and crispy and were good. Corn bread was pretty good. Seating is limited. Service was good. You order your food first and then get seated.

pics.caption: Pulled pork, fries, and corn bread.
Sliced brisket
Pulled pork

review.des: The macaroni was really good but the brisket I should've got it well done or crispy if I had an option to do that. I spent a lot of money there and didn't get to enjoy it. The macaroni was really good tho serving sizes were small.

Pretty good ribs and brisket.  Not the best if you compare it with St Louis places like pappy's.  I got half rack of st louis ribs and a serving of brisket.  The brisket had a nice smoke ring to it and was very tender, the ribs were tender as well but a bit on the small side for st louis ribs.  Still great for BBQ in the middle of Chicago.

Delicious, nutritious, perfectly cooked, and ready to roll. Smoque is the perfect blend of spicy with its sauces, and woody (if that's the perfect term for a sauce). The place is a brightly lit room, similar to a diner. No frills, just great food.

I've heard so much about this place but I was expecting more. The baby backs were really good, but they weren't the greatest we've had. I didn't care for the burnt ends either. They were just okay. I thought the sides were bland. My son loves Mac n cheese and he wouldn't touch his.

pics.caption: Burnt ends.
Ribs.

review.des:
Finally made it to Smoque last week & this place did not disappoint!  I was warned to get there early and by 5:45pm on a Friday, the line was already forming. I had to wait about 10 minutes to order and was quickly seated.  The staff does a nice job of finding a spot for you to sit, letting you know when you're number is called, and clearing trash away for the next guests.

The food was the real highlight though. I opted for the chopped brisket plate with a choice of 2 sides and slaw for ~$14. The portion of meat was substantial and I had plenty to take home. The meat is definitely the center piece at Smoque, with all meats served with two sauces on the side.  Meats are paired with specific sauces that complement the cuts and flavorings of the dish and I enjoyed the contrast of the two sauces that came with my meal - one was a thick and creamy mesquite sauce and the other was a brisket-specific, vinegar based sauce. Both were tasty! I hoped the brisket would compete with the likes of some of the Austin BBQ I've tried, but it didn't quite get there. A pretty solid Chicago alternative, but I've still gotta make the trek to ATX the best of brisket country.

Lots of sides to choose from but I went with the mac & cheese and the fries. The mac & cheese was decadent, with just the right amount of cheese flavor.  The small portion left me wanting more, and I later saw other customers choose mac & cheese for both of their sides to make up for it (what a great idea!).  The fries were served hot and fresh in a small brown paper bag and were plenty to share with a friend.  Portion-wise, the fries were the better deal.

The place is BYOB (except for the patio, which is a bummer) & totally surprised me! They would still have quite the crowd without the added bonus of bringing your own booze, but I happily spent all the extra dough I saved on treating myself to a hot peach cobbler.

Can't wait to go back and try more of the cuts of meat and sides!

pics.caption: Chopped Brisket
Mac & Cheese
Peach Cobbler $3

review.des: Great barbecue! At even better prices!! The only thing that bothered me was that the cashier didn't really explain the process. I wasn't sure if it was table service or if we had to get our food at the window. We figured it out but no one talked about the way they worked things there. That definitely would've been nice to get a heads up. It's a bit crowded inside but the outside patio is nice. I will definitely be coming back!
Ribs are my favorite food ever. This place doesn't disappoint. It's pretty small and can get very busy but worth the wait. Yummy sides. I would definitely recommend this rib place.

Smoque was good, but not great. I went in thinking I was going to experience the best bbq of my life. Maybe my expectations were too high.

Ordered at the counter, line was not bad. Server was fine.

Food was okay, Portion was large and served at the right temperature. Sauces were okay, not as flavorful as I would have wanted or expected. If you are in search of Chicago's best BBQ, check it out. Lots of folks liked Smoque more than I did.

We came in with a group of 9 and they quickly accommodated us. Very good service, the guys working the tables were so friendly. The food is so tasty and you definitely can taste the smoke. I love the mac and cheese you can tell it's homemade. We definitely will be back to try more items on the menu.

pics.caption: Baby back ribs platter. Delicious!

review.des: I have had this place several times and I'm very torn. The key to BBQ is the sauce and for me that's #1 most important thing. The sauce just isn't here for me here. However I will say all of the sides are banging. The Mac and cheese, cobbler, chili and fries are soooo good. I would highly recommend the chili. The chicken is fall off the bone juicy. But again it brings me back to my original point I don't totally love the sauce. Definitely worth a try

Best bbq In Chicago hands down
Everything is great
Winning combo is brisket and Mac n cheese
This place was very good.  It was as close to Texas style BBQ as I could get this far north, and it was pretty darn delicious. Really great BBQ

I've had this place bookmarked for awhile and finally got the chance to go. For the few that are uninitiated, you go in, wait for the host. You tell him/her how many people are in your party, they note it down and looks for a table for you. You order your food, said host shows you your table, you wait for your order number to be called out, and boom you're good to eat!

Since visiting Austin, I've been craving brisket like a vegetarian. Um, in  other words, me love brisket long time! Anyways, I ordered 0.5# of sliced brisket, and for an additional $6, a "sampler" rib stack.

The brisket was just as I expected it; fatty, juicy, tender, smoked meat of the gods, the brisket was as good as the ones I've had in Austin. The ribs were pretty great too. It had just the right amount of char and was super tender. Overall, excellent BBQ!!

BATHROOM REVIEW: located past the kitchen and in the back, the bathrooms were single stalled. Inside, the bathrooms were pretty clean and well-kept. The toilet was relatively clean and worked like a champ. Sit or squat? Sit... But line-up the toilet seat with toilet paper

I'm naturally pretty skeptical when it comes to BBQ places north of the Mason-Dixon line. More often than not you're paying a ton of money for mediocre food that merely serves as a reminder of what sort of thing you could be eating, if only you weren't in the midwest. So, when friends suggested we go to dinner at Smoque, managed expectations seemed to be appropriate.

...Then we got there, and there was a line out the door, on a day where there was a -10 wind chill. This leaves you with two possible conclusions: In this insane post-iPhone world where people just will wait in line for everything no matter how ridiculous that these were just professional line-waiters, or, the food is truly that legit.

Well, turns out the answer was the latter. We waited a good 30-40 minutes to even order, and the place was so jammed that they even had a guy acting as a bit of an air traffic controller to figure out seating for people eating in. It was mind-boggling, but it all made sense as soon as I sat down with my tray. I got a little bit of everything, and it was all incredible.

The brisket is something dreams are made of, the pulled pork was bananas, mac and cheese was life changing, the baked beans were insane, the coleslaw was heavenly, really the only thing that was just kinda sorta OK was the cornbread but it's possible that the rest of the stuff was just so great that even good cornbread would just seem alright in comparison.

Go to Smoque. Wait in line. It's amazing.

Just love this place... I travel the country always eating BBQ and this always hits the spot.
Try it.

Our neighborhood bbq spot! This place has some of the best bbq in Chicago. I usually order the chopped brisket platter with two sides and coleslaw which is a vinegar base. Highly recommend the macaroni and cheese because it has a baked crumb topping then the cornbread. They are large servings, so be sure you're ready to eat! It's family style eating and easy to come with large groups if you don't all want to be on the same check. Very friendly staff as well who frequently clean the tables and direct you to an open spot!

Smoque is one of those places that I would avoid during prime time and go during an off hour - the space is small and it gets packed!  I grabbed late lunch here a couple times and my order took about 20 minutes - very efficient and friendly service.  I tried the brisket and pulled pork sandwich combos with slaw and mac and cheese on the side.

Both were good, but brisket was slightly dry so I preferred the pulled pork a little more.  I liked that you had vinegar and hickory bbq sauces to choose from.  The sides really enhanced the experience for me.  The vingear based slaw was light and balanced out the meat.  However, favorite part of my meal was the mac and cheese - just the right amount of cheesiness, creaminess and baked with bread crumbs!

If I was on death row, I'd ask for sliced brisket, mac n cheese, and cornbread, from Smoque. Then, I would refuse to die until every last prison guard tasted and confirmed that Smoque is the best place on planet Earth. If someone says they don't like Smoque, give yourself a reason to get on death row. Is that insane? NO. NOT WHEN IT COMES TO SMOQUE. TRUST ME ON THIS. The no-frills environment is perfect because it honestly becomes a spiritual experience between just you and your brisket. If I don't recommend this place to you, chances are I hate you and wish you nothing but horrible BBQ.
The only downside of Smoque is the lines, but you can't blame people for wanting good brisket ;).

I've been here a couple of times and it's one of the best BBQ joynts that I have ever been to here in Chitown!  They are also shown on Food Network TV Show Diners, Driven, and Dives.  
It's a stand alone building at a corner street.  There's no parking lot so look for street parking.  
Keep in mind this is a popular little place so during the weekends and prime time dinner hours it's going to get pretty busy...so busy that you will end up waiting in the sunshine, rain, and snow to get in.  But the food is worth it!  My tip, come during the week or early evening like as soon as it opens so you can get what you want cause if there's a long line by the time you get to order they may run out, yeah really...
The decor is rustic, to get more seating you may we sitting very close to other people like a community table feel.  They play music in the back ground sounded like jazz music to get you into the BBQ mood.  Now keep in mind, BBQ meats do get pricey so it's a good idea to know what you want to order ahead of time.

While you wait in line, you can see what others are eating and you can see all the awards this place has posted on the walls.  For their ribs, they use a Memphis-style dry rub and apple and oak firewood to get that great flavor.  They give you sides of BBQ sauce not overly sweet.  

I usually order the following:
Just to let you know the ribs are not precut so be prepared with a knife to cut your meat or get down and dirty and tear that meat apart!  It can be messy...
-The baby back ribs are fall of the bone ribs with a nice crust so you can eat them dry or dip or pour their BBQ sauce all over it!
-The St Louis ribs is a meatier kind of ribs you can see the smoke ring around it.  Eat it as is with the dry rub or pour on that BBQ sauce.
-Their brisket is one of my favorites.  They cook their meeting for 14 hours in the smoker and man it's so moist and tender melts in your mouth, oh wait that's the fat yum!  I get these sliced or you can get them chopped to order.  They put on a light BBQ sauce just for the brisket.

They also sell pulled pork, chicken, Texas sausage which I've seen people eat and they said it's very good. I like the fact that you can also order smaller sizes of these meats to your main order or if you can add it to your salad for those who are cutting the carbs.

The sides we get are all pre-measured in their own little containers:
-Coleslaw (thinly shredded slaw that they use a vinegar not a creamy dressing) it comes with your meal.  I like it, not so much the hubby.
-BBQ Beans is very sweet but the beans are cooked well.  I liked it.
-Macaroni & Cheese it comes it's own cooked container size topped with bread crumbs.  Both of us like this side I would get it again, if you LOVE mac n cheese then order 2.
-Cornbread sweet bread reminds me of Boston Market sweet, it's ok.  
-Brisket Chili hubby ordered this, good flavor meaty chili hearty he says.

Overall, great BBQ place.  I'd come back again if I'm in the area.

pics.caption: Beef brisket platter with two sides mac & cheese and barbecue beans. Cole slaw comes with the meal.
Baby back ribs full slab with two sides mac & cheese and brisket chili, slaw already comes with.

review.des:
Yummm. All I have to say. You walk in and it's a bit small but packed and the turnover is perfect. People leave people sit. Now to the food...

The menu is small, but everything is tasty. I ordered a half slab of the baby back ribs and a half pound of brisket. They came with a side of cole slaw, Mac and cheese and brisket chilli.

The ribs were fantastic, juicy and smoked just perfect plus they fell right off the bone. The brisket...amazing. 5 stars alone! The sides on the other hand nothing to write home about for such a delicious menu.

The sauces are wonderful. I recommend the spicy Memphis.

pics.caption: Table full of ribs
Full slab

review.des: Omg delicious was the true meaning. The smell of the aroma as soon as you walk in the door is not watering already. I went ahead and ordered a rib combo so I got to St. Louis ribs in the baby back ribs my two sides, Mac & cheese BBQ beans and cornbread and cole slaw

This was on point! Havent had much BBQ to brag about in Chicago other than smoke daddy. Which was a little too hyped.

We had the brisket and pulled pork sandwich along with a few sides. Both entrees were great, meat was super tender. And they have plenty of sauces to satisfy anyone's taste. The cornbread and Mac n cheese were awesome too.

Do your favor and grab dinner bread pudding to go as well. It was definitely the best desert I've ever had from a BBQ spot.

pics.caption: BBQ on BBQ on BBQ goodness

review.des: I found Smoque at Revival Food Hall. As a native Texan, I am generally skeptic of barbecue spots outside of the south. In order to gauge authenticity, asked the food line workers if the owner or chef was from Tennessee, Texas, or Carolina, considering their three sauce options. They didn't know, but directed me to the owner, Barry, who was sitting at the end of the counter. He was very friendly and chatted with me a bit. He explained that he was from Chicago, but spent some time in central Texas, which inspired their smoked turkey. He gave me samples of that and the sliced brisket (unfortunately they were out of the sausage). The brisket was fantastic - so tender! I highly recommend it.

pics.caption: The owner, Barry, is very friendly!

review.des: The best BBQ I've had. The place is busy but even with lines outside the door they got a great system to get your order in and food to your table. Want to look like a regular? Here's some advice. Let them seat you. Stay in line to order and they'll get you a seat. I've been there before where someone would get a seat on their own and would cause issues. Don't be that guy. : )

Had the St Louis ribs ---excellent and full of meat and not at all dry. The mac and cheese seemed a little grainy and not creamy. That was a let down, but the rest was just excellent. Get the corn bread because it's just so good and crumbly. The fries actually were good ---thick and crispy like the ones at Five Guys, and they go well with the ribs. Turns out the cole slaw comes with the ribs already, so that didn't count as a side. But the slaw, while fresh, could have used a little more wetness --as in some creaminess (mayo). However, the crunch of the cabbage added to the nice texture experience of the meal. I liked the bbq sauce a lot, but would have also welcomed a spicier one. Finally, I couldn't leave without the peach cobbler, which I enjoyed later that night. I like how they prepare all of their sides in these little pie containers. So practical. Smoque rocks.

The restaurant was packed when we went for take out at around 6pm. Clearly it's a very popular restaurant. I would suggest calling in and order and picking it up during peak dinner hours. It took us about 45 minutes to get through the line, place an order, and take our food to go.

We got the half chicken, Mac n cheese, and cole slaw. The chicken was incredible. The sides were good, but didn't get close to the chicken. Both BBQ options were delicious.

Will be back during off hours!
They are always so fast and nice. Even when I order pickup, they are accurate, simple and great! Love this place.
Great BBQ! Good service too. Employees are always friendly and helpful. Don't forget to try the Mac n Cheese!

I'm a big fan of great BBQ, and this is one of the best in the area.  One reason I give them 5 stars is because of how good the sides are too!  So many places cut corners and serve mediocre sides. Not this place. The only drawback to this restaurant is parking can't be difficult to find in this residential area of town.

This is by far the best BBQ I have had since moving to Chicago 5 years go. I had the St. Louis style ribs with the Memphis sauce and they were out of this world good!  The tang and sweetness of the sauce. With the smoky taste of the ribs was a perfect blend. Even without sauce the ribs were amazing!  Fall of the bone tender and juicy, perfect flavor of the rub and the meat. I thought I had gone to rib heaven. I live in  West Town and have often eaten at Smoke Daddy. Their food is great but after eating the ribs at Smoque I will only eat here!!!!!!! AMAZING!!!!!!!!  The Mac and cheese was fabulous too!

Visited Smoque BBQ at 3800 N. Pulaski Av. Pleasant atmosphere and friendly staff. My meal consisted of the pulled pork platter w/coleslaw & 1 choice of side. I chose bbq baked beans. Food was average. Nothing spectacular about their signature sauces. Although, I really liked the flavor of the bbq baked beans. My husband had 1/2 slab of baby back ribs and 1/2 of st. louis style ribs. The ribs were smoked just right, very tender but the so-called "memphis rub" on the st. louis ribs didn't sit well with us. It was pastey and did not live up to what the restaurant offers which is tangy, semi-sweet and spicy on the ribs. Coleslaw was a bit vinegary but didn't taste bad. Lastly, they're slightly overpriced on the menu. May not go back.

My dad really enjoys barbecue. He had AA gift card to this place and it is on my way home from work so I ran by to pick up food. My daughter fell asleep in the car on the way, I called them to see if they would run the food out as my daughter needed to sleep. Not only did they run the food out they made it so that they didn't have to go back inside by using the iPad so that I could just swipe my card there. What great customer service! I haven't even gotten home to eat the food, but it's nails amazing. I have had their mac and cheese before and it was delicious!

In Chicago for the day seeking a lunch spot to fill and plump us up to fight the chill.  Hubs and I tend to hit DDD spots while traveling and he LOVES BBQ... So I cross checked the Flavortown recs against 2800 glowing Yelp reviews...and Smoque seemed like a clear choice for lunch.

Just a heads up for newbies like us -- you have to order *then* you get a seat.  They keep it moving in here and it was basically PACKED at 11:15 when we arrived.

Here is what we ordered:
Brisket platter (chopped, no bun) with fries and smoked baked beans
1/2 Chicken Platter with mac & cheese, brisket chili, slaw x2 (stolen from hubs)
Added a "taste" of St. Louis ribs for $6
Total for tons of food + 2 sodas = $37.67

The star of the show at Smoque had to be the baked beans.  They actually put these beans in the smoker, and you can totally taste it.  However, should I return to a BBQ joint for the baked beans alone?  Hmmmm...

The mac & cheese was good -- there was just not a whole lot of it.  (Spoken like a true carb addict and mac and cheese lover, I know.)  It is baked with a crumb top -- served in its own disposable foil ramekin.  Tasty.  Especially with a little hot BBQ sauce added.  Yum.  Chicken (white meat) was remarkably not dried out, but not super juicy either -- Hubs said the dark meat was better.  Ribs were not fall-off-the-bone tender, but had a good taste for a dry rub.  Didn't really even need sauce for these.

The down sides for me: first off -- the slaw.  It was simple -- just big long chunks of grated green cabbage and grated red onion...but that's it.  Luckily I could navigate around the chunks of onion (so my husband could bear to spend the rest of the day with me) and the dressing they used actually ended up saving the day...otherwise this would have been a total miss in my opinion.  
Secondly, I wanted the brisket chili to be so.much.more. than it was.  The hub's pulled brisket was tasty, so I hoped the chili would be too.  Sad Panda.

Let me say this -- if the hubs was writing this review, it would have been given 10+ stars.  He LOVED this place.  I *liked* it  and can see going back to try some other offerings.  Perhaps the hype and my expectations were too high... or I just regret not getting the Bread Pudding with Bourbon sauce.  Either way, we may give it another shot in the future -- but there are just SO many options in Chicago.

pics.caption: Our spread...
I can smell the smoke from here.
Menu of meaty goodness.

review.des: They are really busy but rather fast! I like they seat everyone after they order so the place stays organized and don't have random people just taking up spots. The customers are very self aware too and doesn't take up a spot for hours. The food is great too! Briskets are amazing! It's kind of funny how all rib places just have better brisket than ribs lol
This is my family's go- to bbq place . Do I feel lucky ?! Very high quality , well-smoked meats. Excellent sides. Always ready on time for pick up when you order take out. Best in the city !

Good 'que in what continues to be a restaurant desert. That leads to long lines but the food is worth it. Meats are great (don't look for brisket reviews from me) but the sides are freakin' incredible. Dining room is a hot mess but the food will address your frayed nerves.

Love this place. BBQ Chicago style!   The meat not the sauce is the star of the show.  Then you add the sauce your self. Amazing!  The potato salad to die for!  The beans were so different with loads of flavor! Yum!
About the best BBQ in chicago and I am from the south.  fall off the bone ribs and tender brisket, sides are delicious...always a great place to bring newbies and visitors!

6 stars! Definitely lived up to the hype!

I was really excited to make my first trip to Smoque after reading all the accolades it's received. I was concerned about how long the wait would be on a Friday so I got there around 6:15 with two of my friends. Fortunately, the restaurant was only 50% full! When you walk in you let the guy know how many people you have if you're eating in and he'll tell you which table is yours. Next, you order your food at the counter and you get a number which they'll call out when your food is done.

I ordered the sliced brisket platter with fries and mac n cheese. AMAZING. The brisket just absolutely melts in your mouth, easily the best brisket I've had in Chicago. They give you a Carolina style sauce and Memphis style sauce with the brisket. Both were really, really good. Their version of Carolina style isn't as vinegar-y as I've had in the past. Mac n cheese was like a little baked casserole...delicious. Fries were very tasty too and they give you a huge bag of them.

Meat, sauces and sides were all outstanding. Great portion sizes too for the price. I completely  understand why Smoque is considered by many to be the best bbq in the city. Can't wait to come back!

Although the food here is delicious, they received poor marks due to their inconsistent delivery. I called a large in order an hour before and showed up when they told me to over the phone. Apparently the order had not been put in and I was just told "sorry" with a shrug. They made zero effort to expedite my order and left me with a sour taste for the place. Too bad.

I had the pleasure to come to this place. This place is more welcoming which I love about restaurants.

I ordered a brisket sandwich with mac and cheese. What I didn't realize was that they don't dip the sauce with brisket. It was really something new to me. The sauce wasn't thick but definitely manageable. Would I ever come back to this place yeah I definitely would.

Was kinda disappointed when they ran out of ribs
but remind you that we showed up 30 minutes before closing that's the price you get when show up late but the kindness of the employees were excellent. Overall it ain't bad.

pics.caption: The brisket sandwich, Mac & cheese and fries. The sauce came on the side.

review.des:
This place has it down. It was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives...and it is really worth the visit. We came from the south side because we heard it was a thing...and it is.

Food...they know BBQ. Our party of four had (1) chopped brisket platter (5 stars), (2) sliced brisket platter (5 stars), (3) 1/2 baby back ribs (3 stars), (4) pulled pork (5 stars)...so we tried a lot of stuff and with only one exception it was exceptional BBQ. The brisket really stuck out...tender, moist, flavorful throughout the meat, and whether you get it chopped or sliced it was a very nice hefty serving. The flavor permeates all the way through the meat (hence the Smoque name I guess); the smoke flavor is not just painted on top once the meat is done but slow-cooked all the way through. I'd get brisket again. The only off point was the ribs...they had a wonderful bark on them and the same smokey flavor but the meat was a bit dry and tough. They were baby-back though so maybe that was to be expected...but my vote goes for the brisket anyway. The platters come with slaw and two sides...we tried cornbread (straight up with no herbs and 4 stars), fries (with the skin on and 4 stars), coleslaw (vinegary and 4 stars), mac and cheese (creamy and just like Kraft does it and 5 stars), and BBQ beans (with small pieces of BBQ meat in it and 5 stars), and one of us tried the pecan bread pudding (perfect foil for the BBQ flavors and 5 stars). The meals come with two 5 star BBQ sauces...Memphis (has a tang to it) and Carolina (thinner and vinegary).

Service...they know how to run a place. This place rests on its food and not its ambiance, it is simply a store front operation with a bunch of wooden tables and chairs...the walls are painted and there aren't any drapes or mood lighting (just good BBQ). Get in line when you arrive and work your way up to the counter (no taking a seat until you have some food). The check in check out is easy. Pay for your order at the cashier (the kitchen streams off behind her) and one of the staff directs you to a seat...this way people not eating don't hog the seats to early...this is well thought out. Service was always in the background...they don't hurry you at all, but when your done the table is cleaned in a second. They have enough staff to take care of the room size...probably more staff than they need. Friendly and efficient. They also have a big carryout clientele...you have a stream of people just picking up...so don't be afraid of the line...it is worth it also.

So the only thing that kept this to 4 stars is that I can't give 4 1/2...they missed 5 stars with the little bit dry baby backs...although the taste was there. Give this place a try. It had the best brisket I have ever had. The four of us ate for $60...nice reasonable deal. Parking outside is problematic since you are in a city neighborhood (South Old Irving Park) but work with it and you'll be glad you did.

We went to Smoque on a Saturday night for dinner with KT and BS.  The place was very busy is not really set up to handle their fame.  Their system works well in that a host gets your order number and when a table comes available he seats you and puts your order in.  This works, but in the meantime you really have no place to wait.  You end up standing in awkward places between tables and in what aisles there are.  We did have a fairly long wait, although it may have just seemed that way.  I think I would try another night of the week, but who knows, it may be the same.

To sample, I ordered a chopped brisket sandwich and for Ms T I ordered pulled pork.  I also got a half slab of back ribs and some slaw.  KT and BS had a rack of ribs with mac and cheese and slaw.

The ribs were probably 3-1/2 stars.  Pretty good flavor and a nice rub.  They were not intensely smoky although they are very dark.  This is how dark my ribs at home looked when I did not realize how hot my smoker was running.  I have since fixed that problem.  I suspect they are smoking all of their meat too hot because it is all really black but not exceptionally smoky.  The ribs on this occasion also were a little overdone.  You can see a lot of white bone in the photos that you should not see.  I'm sure there is day to day and rack to rack variability but this kept my appraisal short of four stars or better.  Certainly they are worth trying again.

I ordered chopped brisket in self-defense.  Lately when ordering brisket outside of Texas, it has been underdone and you can't eat it on a sandwich without pulling it all off with the first bite.  So chopped was my choice to pre-empt this experience.  I appreciate that they offer this choice.  I suspect they provide the chopped option as a way to use the ends and pieces that don't make nice slices.  That is not a bad thing, you get a lot of outside meat and consequently a lot of smoke and bark flavor.  This was a good sandwich, much larger than I wanted.  Because the bun is too large and bready, I just ate unsauced meat off the bun.

Ms T had pulled pork on her sandwich.  She prefers to eat her barbecue with sauce.  Simply put, you do not want to eat Smoque's sauce.  Neither the spicy nor the mild were worth bothering with.  So she did not enjoy eating the pork.  She felt it was not very smoky and without sauce, well..... live by the sauce, die by the sauce.
