KT and BS were given a free sample of both sliced and chopped brisket because the nice guy preparing their order thought they should have some with their rack.  He unfortunately put sauce on the sliced portion, so it was hard for me to really evaluate the sliced brisket for flavor.  It was moist, good bark, not as smoky as it looks.  I would say above average for the Midwest.  Just don't let them sauce anything for you, but that is my policy anyway, regardless of the place and the sauce.

The sausage was OK.  It was almost more like a Polish sausage than what I associate with barbecue.  It had more garlic, was denser in texture and was not smoked a lot.  I can't help but compare it to what I have had in Texas.

Sides were indifferent.  We did not touch the slaw due to the significant dose of red onion.  We would not have ordered it if we had known.  I am the only one who liked the baked, thick style mac and cheese.  I prefer this to the Kraft Velveeta kind.  This was made with actual cheese, so consequently it was a little grainy.  That happens.  I also liked the corn bread.  It was pretty sweet with some sweet corn kernals.

All in all I am having a difficult time rating Smoque.  It is definitely a "thing" and overrated by barbecue starved Chicagoans, but that does not make it bad.  Ms T would not return while I would, but hopefully on a night with no significant wait.  I would try ribs again and see if over cooking is systematic.  I would order chopped brisket as a platter.  I don't know what sides I would get.  It breaks my heart to not be able to get onion free slaw.  OK, I made up my mind, the slaw tipped the balance to three stars.  I really would go 3-1/2 if I could.

pics.caption: Full Rack of ribs, quite overdone.  That bone should not show like that.
Half rack of back ribs
Chopped brisket and pulled pork sandwiches

review.des:
I ordered the pulled pork platter with macaroni and cheese and beans which came with coleslaw. My husband ordered the brisket platter with fries and coleslaw and beans. He also ordered gumbo over rice which had chicken sausage and beef I believe.  We also took an order of ribs home to go.

Everything was delicious, portions were really good except for the mac & cheese which was kind of small but very tasty. Our only complaint was that the meals didn't come with any kind of bread. But we love the fact that you got two different types of barbecue sauce to try (we both agreed we liked the Memphis style). It's also a small dining area so it can get really crowded really quickly and you have to be comfortable sitting very close to other people. But all in all we would go back for sure.

Chopped brisket is to die for. I like it with their slaw.
Still prefer as take out. Gets crowded but of you call in your order they can have it ready for you.
Glad to have this place in the neighborhood.
This place is absolutly amazing. I love it! I highly recommend it. Best baby back ribs and corn bread ever!

I've been going here for years. Never had a bad meal. It's a little pricy but you won't leave still hungry. Parking isn't always the easiest and they're always busy so expect to wait a little bit but they get you in and out pretty quick.

Ok, here's a vegetarian review lol...the Mac-n-cheese is good, but order two servings if you want that to be your main course. It appeared that the fries were cooked separate from the meat, and they are really good. The cornbread is decent, and their peach cobbler is yummy. There ya go, veggie peeps!
Ordered catering for 16 people. Everyone loved everything!! My favorite was the brisket. Amazing. The service was great. Can't wait to get again.

This is good BBQ. The portions are big and the service was friendly. The sauces were ok, nothing special. I wish they had an Alabama white sauce. I got the chopped brisket which I'm a huge fan of chopped instead of sliced, so kudos to Smoque for offering that. I'm taking off a star because due to their popularity the line was long and the wait was at least 30 minutes just to put in my order and then it was another 10-15 minutes for my order to be ready. I think it would be best to put in an order ahead of time by phone and then pick it up.

Maybe we went on a bad day, but boy oh boy were we ever disappointed. Everything was dry... the cornbread, the bread on the sandwiches, the brisket, the pork. The tea (something I consider a staple to BBQ) was absolutely terrible. The BBQ sauce was really runny, straight liquid, basically vinegar. The meats both had a smoky flavor, which was the only plus of this place. Overall, a disgrace to the world of bbq!

This is great barbecue, I usually judge a bbq restaurant on their brisket and let me tell you, amazing! They cook it perfectly because there is very little fat on this Piece of meat. The Mac n cheese is outstanding and they have bread pudding that is delicious. A must try if you even remotely like bbq!

I haven eaten at Smoques on occasion and it is always consistent. The food and service is quick! I always get the pull pork and my boyfriend gets the slice brisket. He gotten the chopped briskey previous, but thought it was on the dryer side. I suggested the slice brisket and it made a big difference.

Food is consistent and delicous. The service is always on point. Try to avoid the dinner rush because it will get busy and the line maybe even end right when you open their door.
Parking is dicey but food is legit!  Pulled pork sandwich with slaw FTW!  Bbq gumbo kinda dope too!  Maybe best bbq in city.
Great food! Very tasty. Hard to get a table on a weekend during main meal hours but takeout has been great too
A must visit each time I'm in Chicago on business or pleasure. The brisket is amazing as are the ribs  and sides. Joint has good BBQ feel and service attentive. Check it out!
Amazing BBQ! Haven't had BBQ like this since I lived down south. Sooooo good. Must try! I will be coming here again

Expect to have your life change once you try this place. Brisket that falls off on your fork, bbq sauces made in-house that enhance the taste and yummy french fries!

The baby back ribs have a hint of coal smell and taste, the chicken is juicy, and their mac and cheese plus pecan pie is also something I recommend trying.

I only really have two problems with this place, the first is that the lines can be long but it's fast service. My other issue is that after you eat here you may feel a bit...gassy, hehe. But it's worth the struggle! I still keep coming!

This review is coming from someone who doesn't understand why people obsess over BBQ. So keep that in mind.

All the meat I've ever had from here is good. Is it the best thing I've ever had in the entire world? No. But that's how I feel people react to this place and I don't get it. Chicken and shredded not sliced brisket is good stuff. Beans and Mac and cheese is good. Corn bread is not even close to the best I've had and I prefer traditional tailgate coleslaw to their more basic approach.

Parking can suck but it's never a far walk. Just gave to use the side streets.

And that's all I have to say about that.
Jackée

This place is so overrated that it hurts. I've been there a few times and every time, the food is dry or cold and overpriced. Ever since they got food channel recognition, they went to hell. There are a lot of other bbq places that are better in Chicago, this one is just a tourist trap.

Of course like everyone else says, the bbq is to die for! I always get the sliced brisket, Mac and cheese, corn bread and of course the bread pudding I'm obsessed with! I atually worked there for a short amount of time and ended up quitting because to be honest some of the employees there are foul human beings. They do tip pool there and is split between the restaurant and the beginning of each month. They ended up taking mine away because I had the flu and still tried to work because I had no one to cover my shift and I didn't want to leave them short handed. They ended up sending me home after 4 hours of work because they said I looked too ill and out of it. Well come two days later I am approached by the manager and told that I do not deserve my tips for the month because I couldn't perform the proper customer service skill that day because I looked too sick...It's funny because La Ville Restaurant down the street even told me they are known for screwing people out of there tips. So needless to say I will always love the food but it's sad I have to go there and get food when I know when I'm dealing ignorant employees that are making the food..

Cole Slaw (5 Stars)
it was by far the best thing on the plate. Sent my palate straight to heaven. they need to jar it and sell it at grocery stores...

BBQ Sauce (2 stars)
very runny. not thick at all. quite a thin texture. have to soak components in sauce when dipping in order for sauce to stick on food before it makes the short trip from dipping sauce cup to lips. perhaps it would be best if they served the sauce on the food, instead of in small cups. that way, the experience with utilizing the sauce would be much more convenient.

Ribs (0 Stars)
tasted like carpet. point, blank, period. old carpet, not new fresh carpet. almost killed my apetite, and my palate.

BBQ Beans (2 Stars)
overwhelming taste of bbq. but i guess that's what i should expect considering that they are bbq beans, had bbq beans in the past from other places; didnt quite like them then either. so, im assuming it's just me and these were cooked perfectly. im just not a fan...

Texas Sausage (3 Stars)
satisfying, not memorable. nothing to write home about...

Brisket
(5 stars)
some of the best brisket i ever had. 2nd best thing on the plate, after cole slaw. would come back just for the brisket, it was quite tender, yet delightfully melted on the palate. simply amazing...

Because I live near Smoque I can walk there anytime. I've been there a few times, and it's good BBQ, but definitely not the best ever.

I'm a fan of the pulled pork, the ribs, the sausage links are good too. Can I get them in a trio sampler? No, Smoque won't make a trio sampler a standard menu item, like every other legit BBQ place on the planet. C'mon, Smoque,

Wait in line, put your order in at the counter, then tell the guy you're done and he'll seat you. Then wait for your food to be delivered straight to your table? No, Smoque won't do that, either. You'll have to get up and pick up your own order at the counter. C'mon, Smoque.

What happened recently when the counter girl forgot to add something I ordered to my order? Did they apologize, comp you the item, then kindly bring it to my table? No! They took my credit card to charge me for the missing item, then brought it to my table. C'mon, Smoque.

BBQ is good, people that work here are nice, but the "system" could be improved. And so I drop my 3-star review into the 3000+ Smoque review bucket, ha.

The best BBQ in Chicago!!!  Second best I've had anywhere( behind Joe's in KC).  I've literally been to over 100 BBQ restaurants all over the US and this is right near the top.

This is one of the great BBQ restaurants in America and we are lucky it's in Chicago.  Every meat and side are very good to excellent.  Even the chicken is highly recommended.  Usually go for the brisket chopped and a taste of another meat.  But it really doesn't matter as ALL the meats are top notch.

Sides of mac and cheese, fries, and beans are all excellent.  

The line can be long, but they have an efficient process( interestingly similar to Joe's in KC) that means you order and get a seat right after ordering.  

Can't recommend it enough!
Tried to place an order for pick uo. Called twice. Got instantly put on hold for 5 minutes both times. Lost my Buisness.
We love smoque! The food is SO good. We have never dined in because of how hectic it always is, we call our orders in and pick up. It's super convenient.

I love the St Louis ribs and brisket.  So tender that it falls off the bone. But I don't care forr the sides. They're too small except for ther French fries which come in a bag. The Mac and cheese is good but there isn't enough of it. The coleslaw needs to be chopped a little more. The baked beans are well seasoned but it's too small. Maybe a salad or spaghetti or corn on the cob. Break out of the tiny side dish mold.

No better brisket. With the Memphis sauce and some candied jalapenos, this cannot be beat.  There is a well-explained seating system, which, for anxious old me, takes the stress out of finding a seat in an always-crowded dining area. I have yet to find a bad item on the menu, and the people are always friendly. It can get a little crowded on Cubs gamedays, but I've never had trouble parking nearby. Line moves quickly so don't be intimidated by the line out the door. Go. Get your new favorite brisket.

The food is just alright... this place is definitely overhyped. I live a few blocks away so I've eaten here several times and each time I've gotten the brisket I've been disappointed because it's been dry.

Omg this place is delicious!!! Everyone must definitely give it a try. When I come here I usually get the St. Louis ribs along with BBQ beans. The ribs are tender and have a smoky taste to them. The staff is always willing to answer any questions. I normally take my ribs to go, because it's always packed with hungry people :)

So good! Had the bbq ribs coleslaw and fries. To die for! Never had vinegar bbq sauce and I fell in love! Highly recommended! The staff is very nice, and they even have a separate fryer for gluten free fries. Plus all the meats and bbq sauces are gluten free! I can't wait to go back

Solid BBQ, never disappointed.  We usually get, smoked chicken, brisket, ribs. One will always be awesome, one will be disappointing. Ya get some ya loose some.

Then again I'm a picky about my BBQ, so it could just be me.

Also, a major perk in my book, BYOB. So don't forget that bottle of Zin.
**All meat is GF**
My go to place for years, has gotten super packed at times but the food is still unbeatable

I had super high expectations coming in after seeing all the positive reviews. I shared a beef brisket with cole slaw and two other sides (chili and mac and cheese) and a pulled pork sandwich with the hubby. When the food came out, the portion sizes were much smaller than expected. Luckily, we weren't that hungry when we came for lunch. The pulled pork was just okay in my opinion...I preferred the beef brisket. The chili was unexciting--it was watery and had no meat in it. The mac and cheese was decent but I totally skipped out on the cole slaw (not a fan).

Didn't live up to the hype. Average at best. Brisket was very dry. Bbq beans were okay. Mac and Cheese was good. Texas sausage was very good. Peach cobbler had a bitter taste. Cole slaw was really bad. Basically cabbage with vinegar.  There's better BBQ in Chicago.
Ohh yeah!  These meats are delicious!  I think I've had at least one of everything at this point.  If only parking was easier!
Bbq here is good. Just not a fan of the heavy amount of vinegar that was in the baked beans and the communal seating.

I advised getting the rib dinner combo. With it, you can also add in brisket and pulled pork for a couple more dollars with the combo. It's really good for sharing since you get the most out of it. The baby back ribs here are fantastic! It's very moist, tender, and falls off the bone. When they cooked it, they soak it up in the bbq sauce and it instantly melts in your mouth. It's bomb! Droollllll... However, I find the St.Louis to be too dry for my liking. The meat was a bit rough. No bbq sauce on it. It's a dry rub. It wasn't as tender as the baby back ribs. Also, I tried their mac&cheese and cornbread for their sides and it was very tasty.

I went around dinner time 6:00pm on a weekday and was got my food 15 mins later. Fast service.

Highly recommended! (Everything but the St. Louis style ribs)

pics.caption: Rib combo (baby back + st.louis) with add on brisket and pulled pork

review.des:
So overrated.

I had: 3/4 lb brisket, 1/2 chicken, mac n cheese, brisket chilli, cole slaw.

Let me make this review short and sweet. I've lived in Alabama, Texas, and Kansas City, so I've had my fair share of really good BBQ. I don't know what Smoque is. It's not BBQ. It's trying really hard to be bbq, but the flavors, the texture, and the 'smoke' flavor are just not there. If you're from Chicago you might like it, but if you've ever had real bbq before, this will disappoint (especially cuz it's a bit pricey).

Best item: Mac n Cheese
Positive: Inside seating area very nice, no loud music, could actually hear my friends for a change
Need to improve: Quality of food, Carolina sauce was terrible
Better alternative: Zak's Pizza n Wings in Lombard still has best beef ribs (BBQ) in Chicago area.
The pulled pork and brisket were delicious. Nothing special about the cornbread and beans though.

Mac & cheese & ribs. Enough said. This place is A-1 all the way around. Be prepared for a wait and a tight atmosphere though, waiter way once you sit down, you'll be so busy licking your fingers, you won't even notice you're butting elbows with the table next to you.

Good BBQ and really great sides. We came on a weekend around 2 pm and we were seated as soon as we ordered. We got a full rack of ribs, cornbread, Mac n Cheese, and baked beans. The Mac n Cheese and baked beans were fantastic. Some of the best sides I've had in a long time. I do wish they had a wider range of BBQ sauces available in larger containers at each table rather than a small to-go style sauce container.

Friendly staff, super helpful and polite and really fast service. Decor and atmosphere is nice too. Food...is ok, it's tasty and flavoured well and sauces aren't bad but after eating at Green Street Smoked Meats it's a little bit on the bland side and portions seem smaller.
Dear god! Just eat the food and then lick the plate, your fingers, your friends of all the sweet and amazing bbq!

Haven't been in a few years and made the drive into the city as years ago this was a sure thing.  And, it didn't disappoint.  Sliced brisket platter, side of mac/cheese and baked beans is just what the doctor ordered.   Flavorful on all fronts.  Meet was tender and not dry.  Mac/cheese rocks and baked beans bring it all together.  

Of course is was busy as the line was out the door to order out or dine in.  I was on the go so next time I'll phone in the order and jump the line for what I'm sure is another great experience.

Four years ago we catered Smoque for a tailgate.  Everyone still talks about it.

Best part of my visit to Smoque was having the sliced beef brisket. The sides did not quite equal the meat but the latter is worth the stop alone... it is THAT GOOD, even without the sauces! If you like slow cooked beef brisket, you've gotta stop in here.

pics.caption: The logo above my head on the canopy marks the spot. Bring an appetite going in.
The lines build up yet move efficiently
This is what you see walking in the door

review.des: This place is amazing! Definitely my boyfriends and mine favorite bbq restaurant in the city hands down. We go here at least twice a month. The food is fantastic I have never not liked anything I've eaten here. I get the chopped brisket platter with fries and Mac and cheese. The mac and cheese is unbelievably delicious I could eat it every day! Definitely a place to try if you're in the city looking for some good food. Also the service is fantastic the people who work here are very friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend this place!

A surprising quantity and quality of food for the price! Loved this place! My friend and I split a platter and ordered a sausage and an extra side (we wanted to try as much as possible ) and it was too much! Absolutely delicious.

Went to Smoques and ordered takeout.  Haven't been there lately and should have known when I walked in and there was no line.  Quality has dropped off considerably.  Ordered the full slab and had to throw 1/2 away.  Ribs were dry and seemed to be standing around for hours.  Won't do that again.

So tasty! One thing I really appreciate about dinning in is that you order and someone sears you. This is really great to help avoid people sitting and holding a table before they even order. I think it times out right we waited standing inside and just before our food came out,we were able to eat at a table. Ribs and pulled pork were really awesome. I'd give the Mac and cheese an ok...too creamy and not enough cheesy for my taste. The serving size of the fries is crazy big. I wish we would have shared. They had pecan bread pudding tonight which we took to go. It was really awesome. I'm glad we didn't pass it up!

pics.caption: Huge bag of fries!

review.des: Just ok.  Beans tasted like they had been over smoked and ended up with a weird sour/bitter taste, slaw was just ok, Mac and cheese was boring - please use sharper cheddar.  Sausage was ok- quality was on par with aidels - but definitely store bought quality.  At 4.25 a link I was expecting better.  Brisket was good.. but missing a good spice flavor.  Maybe not my style?  Not sure, but definitely underwhelmed.   Most expensive BBQ spot I've been too, but mediocre quality.

Friendly staff, very patient and sure to answer all of our questions.
Had the baby back ribs which were fall-off-the-bone delicious with or without the sauce that accompanies them. The coleslaw and chili were fantastic as were the fries that come in a greasy bag (a great indication).

Finally I had Mac and cheese which was easily one of the best savory things I have graced my taste buds with. Small portion but so so worth it!!

Would definitely recommend.
Best brisket I have had north of the Mason-Dixie line. Order comes w two sauces on side. I took the Memphis spicy and Carolina. Tried both and both were good. Had no sides but they looked good too.

Smoque is the best BBQ in Chicago, hands down. The ribs are amazing, and the half chicken is probably the best chicken you'll ever put in your mouth. I don't want to overreact here, but their chicken might cure cancer. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

If you haven't been here, but enjoy BBQ, find some time to get here.  The place is small, so coming before or after high traffic periods will benefit you.

I had the Brisket Platter with mac n cheese and fries.  The brisket was cooked very well and had great taste and 'smoque'.  The flavors were not overwhelming, I'd even prefer a bit more pepper/rub, but it was balanced and cooked perfectly which outweighs about anything else for me.
Also had some pulled pork and it echo'd good pork.  It was also cooked well and pulled perfectly.  The flavor was a little more prevalent with the pork.  
The sides with the platters are a bit small, its worth it to buy the sides separately and get the larger portions.  
The fries... WOW, they were great. They were crispy and had a hint of something more than just salt on them.  I don't know what it was as I couldn't see it, but they were great.

The location was a bit of a hike from where I was coming from, but it was well worth it.  I'll add it to my rotation when I'm in the area!

pics.caption: Brisket platter mac n cheesw with fries

review.des: I had lunch here on 11-30-2016.  This was my first visit.  I ordered the smoked turkey breast on white bread with Memphis BBQ sauce and potato salad.  The smoked turkey breast was very good.  Moist, flavorful and plentiful.  The bread was very soft, like room temperature.  I loved it.  The potato salad was crunch.  It was more like a pasta salad than a potato salad.  It contained scallions, celery, potatoes with the peel still on them, but it didn't contain any eggs that I could tell.  I went based upon a coworker's recommendation.  It was good BBQ, which is what I will stick to ordering on my next visit.

Get the pecan bread pudding! I'm not usually a bread pudding type, but this specialty item (not always on the menu) was delish! And of course their BBQ was amazing as many have stated. Shared some sliced brisket and hot links with my man last night for din-din.

Still my favorite BBQ after so many years, there are so many others in Chicago and I tried most of them but at the end I still come back to Smoque.

Only negative to coming here is the long lines but it is all worth the wait.

Obviously I like Smoque. It's impossible not to like Smoque unless you lack tastebuds. However, I do not LOVE Smoque like so many others do. Yes, it's better than most BBQ places around here. Yes, it's probably the best BBQ place in Chicago. However, Chicago isn't necessarily a BBQ Mecca (see KC, Memphis, Carolina, Alabama, Austin) and a lot of other places in the city are nearly as good as Smoque.

That being said, there is tons to like about Smoque. Every single side dish is amazing - possibly the greatest BBQ sides in Chicago outside of Lillie's Q. Succulent mac 'n cheese, brisket chili is original and delicious, great beans, and a hell of a cornbread. The meat is the star of the show; especially the ribs. Great brisket (both chopped and sliced), amazing links, and an even better rib selection (baby back & St. Louis). Haven't tried pulled pork. Both sauces (Carolina & Memphis) are delightful. Price is decent - what you would expect. BYOB makes it amazing. Location is central for all of Chicago and easy to get to and find parking.

The only qualms I have with Smoque are associated with a fairly weak ambience. First off, it's a pain in the ass to find seating and get the order. Often times they are so crowded that I cannot hear my number and the food sits. The sauce serving size is meager and they should (like most other Chicago BBQ joints) absolutely put bottles of sauce on all tables! No reason this place should go cheapskate on the sauce given the juggernaut they are in Chicago. Serving size could be larger on the non-rib end, as well.

Obviously I'll be back to Smoque. Definitely get them to cater your party.

This place is absolutely one of the best in the city.  You will enjoy there many combinations with your taste buds exploding with joy. From date night with my children to family bbq day. It's always a fun place to be!!!!!!  With the line moving relatively fast to get your food.

Heaven on Earth.

Definitely worth the wait. Three of us got there around 5:45 and the line was to the door already. It moved fairly quickly and pretty soon we were waiting for an open table. They really have this process streamlined as best as they can. After you order your food, one of the employees confirms the number of people in your party and as other people leave, they seat you. At that point they start preparing your order.

About 15 minutes after we got our table, our food was ready. Everything was SO GOOD and you get SO MUCH food. Between the 3 of us we had:

1/2 and 1/2 sandwich order-- 1/2 pulled pork, 1/2 chopped brisket. I wanted to try both and this was the best way to do it. If you think ordering half portions means you'll get less food, you'd be wrong.
Sliced brisket--such good flavor: smoky and tender. Probably liked this version better than the chopped brisket in my sandwich.
Half chicken--This might as well feed 2 people because it was so large
1/4 slab of St Louis Ribs--you can get this as an add on so of course we did. Again, amazing flavor, so tender.

All of our sides came as part of the meals.
Mac and cheese--It looks like a small portion, but it's so rich you'll be glad to not have more because it's tasty so then you'd eat more and be even more full.
Fries--you get a brown paper bag full of them. Is this the "small" version when it comes with the meal? I don't know, but you get way more fries than I expected.
Cornbread--Pretty standard, but good
Coleslaw--More on the vinegary side than mayo, which I appreciated because it's my preference.

Oh and the sauces. I was a big fan of the thicker Memphis Style sauce, but the Carolina style was good if that's your thing.

We pretty much finished everything because we're gluttons and because it was so good it would have been a waste not to. And then they had to roll us out of there. But seriously, I was full until lunch the next day. Next time, I would probably not eat the rolls that come with the sandwiches. They are good enough, but they take up valuable space in your stomach.

Overall, pricing was quite fair, especially when you consider the portions. All of our food plus 2 fountain drinks (and free cup of water) came out to just under $60. We used an a la card so our total bill was even cheaper at $49. We easily found free street parking. The decor isn't anything to write home about, but that's not why you're there.

1/2 chicken, 1/4 slab STL ribs, slaw, mac & cheese, and cornbread

review.des: My cousin and I visited this place on memorial day weekend. Not sure why this place was so crowded. The cashier got our order wrong as she left some items out. The pulled pork lacked flavor, it seems to left something to be desired, so did the mac and cheese. I will say the brisket, fries and cole slaw was really good. The brisket really doesn't need any sauce as it is rich in flavor. I'm no bbq connoisseur  but i was taken back by the sauces, I was expecting there to be more variety, maybe a sweeter one? They were all tangy but still good. I know what to specifically get if I ever come back here.
Best spot in Chicago for Real BBQ, from a Texas fan, this is the real thing!! You have to try there pecan bread pudding.

Yum! This place is so tasty. Tried the ribs on my last visit so I wanted to give other things on the menu a chance. Finally got to try the brisket that everyone was raving about and its very tasty. You are given two bbq sauce to choose from so that's a plus. The customer service was awesome. They were friendly and very helpful. The mac and cheese and cornbread is the bomb dot com.

pics.caption: Brisket and pull pork platter

review.des: There's probably nothing more I can say that the other 4000 reviewers haven't. GO TRY IT. seriously worth it. We shared the 1/2 chicken platter, Mac n cheese, fries, coleslaw, cornbread, and bread pudding. The chicken was falling off the bone. Omg soooo good. Coleslaw was light and tangy unlike the crappy mayo colrslaw you get at most places. The mac n cheese and fries were more on the average side for us. And the bread pudding.... omg get it. You won't regret it.

Not really sure what the hype is about ... Must be because they were featured on Diners Drive Ins and Dives. I ordered the half slab of baby back ribs and my boyfriend got the brisket sandwich. Brisket was sparse, was half dry and had a chalky taste. My ribs were ok but the dry rub had no flavor. I've had better ribs at Popeyes in Lake Geneva! Won't be returning.

I take the El to Irving Park station.  I exit the train and realize I'm in the mIddle of an expressway.  This a long way from my centrally located Miracle Mile hotel, and it better be good.  And, after figuring out how to get off the major arterial road, lo and behold, I find this place.  It smells good.  I enter and annoy the hell out of the greeter, asking him way too many questions about what type of BBQ'd meats and sides I should order.  He graciously answers all of my questions, rather than giving in to his natural impulses to request that I leave and never ever return again.   I go up to counter, and order everything he advised.   The counter girl looks at me in admiration, unaware that I had mined all my knowledge from the greeter.  That admiration fades as I request every type of BBQ sauce available.  Her and the greeter exchange knowing glances, but continue to smile and pretend I am not annoying them greatly.  It's that impeccable midwestern charm.

The food arrives.  The ribs rock.  The chopped and pulled brisket are each good in their own way.  The side dishes, beans and mac n cheese are really tasty.  This is really good BBQ.  I begin deliberating with my guest about whether this is Texas BBQ or Southern BBQ or St Louis BBQ (is there such a thing?).  My eating companion doesn't care, and says that it is really good, and that nobody likes a pretentious foodie who tries to sub-classify food.  I am so jacked up on meat, that I brush aside the injurious criticism, and gently assure myself that it is not my fault I am dining with a BBQ rube.

I leave content that this would be a top 3 BBQ joint in my own dour burgh

Compared this place to lillies q and although the sides  are a bit small is just the perfect size for one person..
The prices are more convinient here.... the meats are cooked just RIGHT... The sanwiches and combination options here are beyond perfect.... will choose this place over any other...

Dear Smoque,

I think your food is good, but as a native Texan, my expectations for barbecue proper are unseasonably high. When graded on a curve, I have no choice but to ding you.

Smoque is hailed as the reigning champion of Chicago barbecue. I've yet to eat other contenders like Lillie's Q or Chicago Q, so my review of Smoque is strictly in silo with my Texan (re: better) and other BBQ experiences.

Smoque's brisket looks the part. Squint and it doesn't look unlike an offering from Austin's own world famous Franklin BBQ. The char looks legitimate, the smoke ring is present, and the meat looks fall-off-the-metaphoric-bone worthy. Wherein lies the rub? In the taste. Smoque's brisket is by no means dry; it just lacks the requisite flavor.

Smoque does take great care to make the best brisket they possible can make. Take a moment to read its BBQ manifesto, and it's clear that they are trying to emulate Hill Country 'cue with its brisket. Smoque even imports its sausage from a famous Texas family, the Mikeskas (I'd stop by the Columbus post all the time en route from Houston to Austin).

As for the more near and dear to Chicago style, the pulled pork and ribs, I had the great misfortune of stopping by the nothing-short-of-amazing Pappy's Smokehouse in St. Louis on my drive up from Texas to Chicago. Smoque's ribs and pulled pork are both good; Pappy's is better.

At this point, it's hurting me to give Smoque a three-star rating, since its BBQ is really tasty and I definitely plan to go back again. Smoque just needs an extra push to go from good to great, and I hope it makes it there.

review.des:
I really do enjoy this place. I think it a really good deal for some quick tasty barbecue. I must say that it is not my favorite BBQ spot but it is definitely close to it. Here's what I ordered last time I was there:

// St. Louis Full Rack - $20.95 - Theses ribs are so tasty. They have a pretty decent amount of meat on them. They are very soft and tender. It is REALLY hard for me to decide which one I prefer: St Louis or Baby back ribs. The baby back ribs are smaller and more curved. They are a bit sweeter. But the St Louis are more straight on the bone and have a little bit more meat. Not as sweet. I would recommend you get some with a friend and split the two.

// Added Sliced Brisket - $5 - This brisket was pretty good but it was a little bit dry. Then there was a time I went back to smoque and the brisket was delicious. So I think it depends on the day, so I would maybe steer you away from getting this due to its inconsistency. I mean if you are hungry, then get it! ha.

this is definitely a spot to hit up while you are in Chicago. And Also if you are up north, it helps.  :)

pics.caption: St Louis full slab. (There are stack on top of each other

review.des: Best BBQ around. We've had the ribs, the brisket, sausage, mac and cheese and fries. Everything was amazing. Probably beat brisket I've ever had. Bother their memphis and Carolina style BBQ sauces are great. We always go here when in Chicago.

I would call this a solid BBQ place. Not the best in Chicago area by any means. Try Steamboat BBQ in Wheaton area, similar quality, better prices. Don't get me wrong, it was a good meal. $35 for 2 adults to eat a BBQ dinner, no drinks, no dessert. MAC and cheese and ribs were not impressive, but good. Brisket was nicely done. Not worth the 20 minutes waiting in line but as first timers we had to wait in order to give it a try. It's byob which is cool. A bit grimey and sticky but I expect a bit of that in a BBQ place. To me this review is to convey a solid experience. But 4 stars would be saying they do it really well; we won't return because there are other places doing it just as well. Maybe 3.5 stars but a little pricey for BBQ.

There isn't much that I could say in my review that differs from the other 3,000 reviews haven't covered, but I am just going to reiterate the fact that the baby back ribs are f***ing amazing.  

A couple days prior to my visit at Smoque my fiance had found out that I never eaten any ribs...ever!  I know, okay, it's very strange that I've lived in one of the greatest cities for food (BBQ especially) and have never eaten ribs.  It's not like I had some outrageous grudge against them - they've just eluded me.  But no longer!  I went to Smoque with my fiance and we split a full slab of those baby back, baby back, baby back ribs and they could not have been any better!  If you haven't had the pleasure of trying ribs before then THIS is the one and only place that should be your introduction to the phenom that is a baby back rib.  Even if you have eaten ribs before then you still need to go to Smoque.  It was televised on the Food Network for a reason guys!  The ribs really are that good!  The meat is some of the most tender I've tasted in a long time and you can rip it off the bone so easily.  Indulge your inner carnivore!  Besides the tenderness of the meat, the ribs also have a smoky-sweet flavor that couldn't possibly get any tastier.  Sure, the ribs are somewhat expensive, especially if you order a full slab instead of a half slab, but don't use that as an excuse not to get any.  You're not going to be eating ribs every week so you can afford a splurge on some noteworthy ribs once in a while.  They are worth every dollar you spend on them, I guarantee that!

The ribs do come with two sides so we ordered the BBQ beans and the cornbread.  I will say that the sides are not the best I've had and in fact the cornbread seemed a little stale, but regardless of this the sides were not bad by any mean.  To put it simply, they just were not my favorite.  What the sides lacked, though, the meat made up for.  I'm serious - the ribs were glorious.  That is what you're going there for anyways.  

Just keep in mind that your stomach is going to have to rumble for about a half an hour to an hour because of the long line.  Yes, I know that long lines are quite annoying to deal with but take it as an indication of how good the meat is there.  Luckily for you, Smoque is a BYOB so you can bring a beer for that long wait you will surely have to endure.  

Also, a sidenote, just know what you want to order way before you get to the counter because it will make the process much quicker for you and for everyone else that also has to wait in line.  It's just a courtesy thing.  I'm sure that the employees will appreciate that more as well!  Keep in mind that they are extremely swamped for the entire time that they are working; despite this they are still extremely friendly!

Oh!  Oh!  One last tip - it says that Smoque closes at 9 pm, but they actually lock their doors around 8:45 pm so that they don't have a line out the door at 9 pm.  If you can get there earlier than that is better - you don't want to run the risk of not getting in!  They do close it a little earlier because it takes a while to actually cook the meat.  

Again, this is definitely the go-to place for all your rib first-timers like myself!  Who am I kidding though?  This is a go-to place for anyone that loves BBQ!

review.des:
Supposedly this place is consistently swarming with carnivores, so I came here on a Sunday around noon for lunch. There was practically no line and I placed my order right away. I really appreciated the laid back order-at-the-counter-and-wait-until-your-number-is-called arrangement, as well as the family style seating with all the tables close together in a row. This is what I envision when I come to a BBQ joint.

I ordered a full rack of Baby Back ribs and almost all of the savory sides; corn bread, mac and cheese, coleslaw, brisket chili, and french fries. The ribs were very good and just the right consistency--delicate enough to melt in your mouth as you pull away from the bone. They serve the meat dry and give you ample sauce on the side to wet them to your liking; However, I liked the seasoning they used on the bark so much that I didn't dare touch my sauce. I liked the sides in this order: French fries (quality AND quantity, these bad boys have their own special seasoning), mac and cheese (full of cheesy-flavor with bread crumbs sprinkled on top), corn bread (chunks of corn inside but too small a helping to have adequate softness/moisture retention), coleslaw (just okay, the oil & vinegar kind), brisket chili (too watery, bleh).

Overall, great food! I don't live nearby, and there are tons of closer BBQ places, but Smoque hit the spot and I'd gladly take the time to travel back here for some down home cooking. Bonus points for having pre-prepared to-go boxes lined with tin foil.

review.des: I can go on and run in detail why this place rocks but that's all you need to know this place rocks food is delicious service is great and BYOB y'all know me!

Based on the 4.5 star rating, I was expecting a little more...

- brisket: falls apart nicely, little dry, overall decent
- slaw: nice and tangy to offset the rest of the food, overall good
- mac and cheese: not hot (seems like it's just been sitting out, which is disappointing), not much flavor, overall average
- beans: don't get, too sweet for my taste, didn't even finish, overall no

review.des:
Despite the accolades heaped on this place, including its inclusion in the eater 38 Chicago, I can only give it between 2 and 3 stars at this time.

It had been a 5 for me, and i was a weekly regular, but then I started getting painfully dry St. Louis ribs. I course-corrected. I made it my Sunday brunch-of-choice, getting there when they opened the doors on Sunday mornings, and usually focusing on those St. Louis ribs, but sometimes on the sliced brisket. This worked for a while, but inconsistently.

Last night I ate there for dinner. The sliced brisket was a B+ for me, almost perfect. Just too dry and fat-free for me. The ribs, a D+, with a few bites here and there that satisfied, but most bites nearly cardboardy.

Also, I am majorly bummed that, quite a while a go, they made their peach cobbler, which had been a side you could order as one of your accompanying sides, into a stand-alone non-side. As much as I loved sides like the fries (but who isn't at least capable of great fries in Chicago?), I would often get peach cobblers as both my sides. Now, I never get the peach cobbler because I'm not going to pay extra for it, and get more food than I want or need just to do so.

This therefore is my goodbye note to Smoque. I loved, loved, loved you when you were great, which I donlt think you are anymore. Also, when there were far fewer options, for me it was Honey 1 or you, depending on what I craved. But now you just don't measure up.

This is the best BBQ I've been to in Chicago! I love BBQ and have been many places that are more about the location and atmosphere than here. This place is about amazing food in a casual environment. Definitely will be coming back regularly!

Carryout Review: Great BBQ for a good price, Smoque is some good classic eatin!

The good: Great tasting food all around. The variety was fantastic, a little bit of everything. Pulled pork and chili were the highlights for me personally, but everything tasted really good. There was even peach cobbler, which was fantastic. Great value. For catering, they packaged very well.

The bad: The baked beans tasted like plastic and were terrible. The meat was too dry for my taste.

Atmosphere: N/A
Service: N/A
Food: 8/10

Celiac friendly BBQ is hard to find.
I'm eating my way through Chicago as we are here for a family reunion. I'd heard of Smoque before, and after reading about their gluten free preferences, we gave it a go .
Got there around 8, and we scored a spot in their back lot, as someone was just leaving. Sweeeet!
Line was out the door. Sweet!
Have allergies? A sign there states to ask for a manager.
I was starting to fall in love.
Manager Al came out and explained the whole menu. No cornbread, no big deal. I told him to order for us as he's the specialist.
1/2 rack of ribs, fries from a non-sharex fryer, double slaw (I'm not a fan of super sweet beans), and several slices of the best damn brisket that puts my Jewish grandmothers to shame.
I'm a VERY sensitive celiac, and I don't just say that. I not only felt fine after eating here, I can't wait to do it again!

pics.caption: The owner Al is awesome!!! Celiacs, this man is making great things happen for us!
Gluten free goodness! Baby backs, sliced brisket, fries, double slaw AKA heaven on a tray!!!

review.des:
Mmmm delicious barbecue!

I came her mid day on a Saturday and it was pretty packed, I but was able to get a table right away. I ordered a sliced brisket sandwich with coleslaw and Mac and cheese. My Bf ordered the chicken, coleslaw and chili. With my entree i was given two little barbeque sauces with a description. One that was Carolina  style barbecue, thin and vinegary good for brisket. And Memphis style barbecue thick, and bold. I poured both on my sandwich and stuffed in some coleslaw and devoured it. Then I proceeded to eat my bfs food also, I am such a fat ass. The chili was light and packed with flavor. Everyone should definitely try this restaurant out! I would love to come back and try the rest of the menu.

pics.caption: Chicken, fried, coleslaw
Sliced brisket, Mac n cheese, coleslaw

review.des:
Brisket = excellent, very moist.  Mac n cheese = great, if a small portion.  Brisket chili = very good, liked it a lot, consistency more like soup than chili.  Sauces = really good but that's expected.

St Louis style ribs = disappointing, would not order again or recommend.  This is the -1 star.  Bread pudding not great either.

Slaw = not the star of the show but really good.  I don't do mayonnaise so I usually don't eat slaw.  This tasted like it was made with apple cider vinegar instead.  I liked it.

Also,  BYOB, so you can't beat that.

If only Yelp had half stars...I'd probably go 3.5. A couple years ago, this was a hands down 5 for me. And clearly about everyone in Chicago too. Upon revisiting this weekend and the expansion of other BBQ places in the Chicago burbs, I'm not as in love anymore. That said it's a solid BBQ joint and packed from open to close it seems so perhaps I'm the only one that feels this way.

The pulled pork is my go-to and it's very good. The sandwich is HUGE with lots of meat. I shared mine with my son and was stuffed between that and the sides. The french fries are quite amazing, and one order could probably feed three-four people. The slaw seemed less fresh and colorful than I remember, but it's basically free, so I'll give it a pass. Mac and cheese is rather bland, my kids didn't even like it. They've added a patio which helps with seating, but it's still a rather stressful experience even though they do good with crowd control, line and seating. There's inevitably someone who's new to the place, trying to jockey for a table and has to be scolded. And the soda machine is located way in the corner so you have to dance around people to get a refill. As will most BBQ it's not cheap, but competitive with other BBQ places.

Bottom line - I can get as good or better BBQ with less stress and less travel (since I"m in the burbs). If I lived close enough for takeout, sure, I'd probably be a solid four star.

Loved this place, stopped here before I had to fly out. Ordered the 1/2 slab of baby back ribs. My two sides were the brisket chili, fries, and it already comes with slaw. These ribs were the best I have ever had. I didn't even need bbq sauce. Just ate it dry, meat just fell right off the bones. Loved the way they smoked the ribs, flavor was bursting. Chili was excellent, and fries were great. Their slaw was good, but may take time to get used to it. Overall experience was more then expected. Would love to come back if I'm ever in town again!

This place had so much hype on here, so I was super excited to try it. I'm just going to preface by saying I've been to BBQ places in San Antonio, Houston, and Atlanta -- I know it's not easy to find good BBQ places in Chicago in general. This place is OK. I got the pulled pork, mac and cheese, and corn bread. My friend got the brisket and banana pudding. The brisket was a bit bland/tough and the cornbread wasn't sweet. I did like the pulled pork, it super tender and melted in my mouth. Try it with the sauces!! Overall I probably wouldn't come here again, but at least I can say I knocked it off my bucketlist.

pics.caption: Pulled pork, mac and cheese, and cornbread!

review.des:
The food is excellent. The employees are all helpful and courteous. A five star barbecue joint. I could give it an extra half star but I do not know how to give a half star. The problem is that they are not equipped to handle peak times. Which is when everyone wants to eat right? If you are dining in they sit you one on top of another. No elbow room at all. Too close for comfort. Better yet. If i get ribs , a salad, and some pork. And the guy with me orders some food because he is hungry. Our food does not even fit on the 4 square foot table we are sitting at. And if it is busy at a peak time. There is nowhere to sit.  Like, Hello? Where do I sit down with my food? Out side in the cold? Take it to go. And if you call in at a peak time to take it to go. They tell you they are too busy to do take outs or there is a two hour wait for take out..It does not affect me but these guys loose more money than they make. I go less often, and so do other  people I talk to. Jut because it is not worth all the extra trouble. You got that guys. No one wants to eat here on a Friday or Saturday night. Or even on a Wednesday at the peak lunch time. They have been here a while. Time for a newer bigger spot. And then it is a 5 star location. I will give them that....
The pork, the ribs,, the chicken. Hell even the salads. All are very, very good. But still for now. I can not go here unless it is on a Tuesday after 1pm and before 6...

I was raised in the South, so I know a little bit about good BBQ. Should I ever be on death row, my last meal would consist of pulled pork, baked beans, and slaw.

The meat here is high quality: slow-cooked, savory, succulent. They know what they're doing. The sauces pair well with the meats. The pulled pork and brisket are delicious, and the Louisiana dry rub ribs are as authentic as you can get.

So, why the three stars?

The sides are disappointing: Baked beans are watery, slaw is uninspired, cornbread is dry, mac-n-cheese is forgettable.

Overall it's fine, inoffensive, solid BBQ. If this is the best in Chicago, it would be run-of-the-mill if relocated 300 miles south.

This place was my jam back when I lived over on this side of town. The meat is delicious and melts in your mouth. The sides are enough to stand on their own if you are able to get a vegetarian here. I usually get the mac n' cheese, coleslaw and corn bread. Coke products to drink (so much better than Pepsi in my opinion) but I heard its BYOB?
One of the best barbecue places I have ever been toin the city of Chicago definitely recommend.

I got the pulled pork sandwich with a side of BBQ beans. Everything was out of this world. My girlfriend ordered the BBQ brisket sandwich and she also loved hers. They give you a HUGE cup of BBQ sauce on the side that is so good I could drink it. (LOL!) It's definitely a walk-up order and sit down place, but they're so busy that they actually have someone actively standing in the restaurant to clean the tables off and escort guests to their seats. Amazing place!

I kinda wish I could have sat outside and eat but I was in a rush. My friend and I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and cornbread with peppers based off the recommendation of a complete stranger.. Yes sometimes I let a stranger tell me what I should try but it doesn't mean that I will always do it..
However to our surprise the pull pork sandwich was really good and flavorful and they did not skimp on the meat. It was enough meat on that sandwich to make two. They gave two kind of sauces so I guess it's up to you to decide which one you want and just dig in. You will be in love from the first bite. The cornbread was not impressive at all. It came in an individual cup and the pepper came in a separate cup as well. I thought when they cornbread and peppers, that the peppers would be cooked into the cornbread but nope I was wrong. Instead they give you peppers that look like they belong on top of nachos in a movie theater. So I didn't care for that.
But don't let the sad cornbread stop you from visiting this place because the pull pork sandwich alone is worth the trip. I will be back to try the ribs .

pics.caption: Better not park here!!!! BBQ madness
Patio
Follow the rules bro

review.des:
I ordered takeout from here about a month or so ago with my then-boyfriend. We called in our order, and it was ready when we got there to pick it up.
We got baby back ribs, smoked brisket, coleslaw, baked beans, cornbread, Mac n cheese and peach cobbler. Let me tell you - we didn't have a thing that I didn't like!
The ribs were juicy. The brisket fell apart in your mouth. The peach cobbler had a crumble on top that was sweet and crunchy. The mac n cheese was rich and cheesy. The cornbread was buttery. The baked beans were smokey. The coleslaw was crunchy and fresh.
I don't have one negative thing to say about this place. Maybe the fact that I couldn't stop eating the food -- but I bet they'd see that one as a positive. Go here. Get takeout. Whatever. Just EAT THIS FOOD.
I just ate at fat Willys tonight and it was horrible. Smoque has the best ribs I've had in Chicago to date.

The smells tell you down the street that this is going to be good.  My husband is from the BBQ belt, and is a serious critic of all BBQ.  But even he was pleased.  Great flavor, great pink smoke rings, great sides.  It was not clear where the menu was when I walked in (it covers an entire wall, was I distracted by the meat?  Yes, Yes I was).  They want you to order first, and then they seat you.  And expect to share a table, European style.  The place also does a really brisk carry out business.  Their vinegar sauce I have to rave about, this is not usually a sauce that I like.  But theirs was the best I've ever had.  A special note to tourists and out-of-towners:  be sure to carefully read the parking signs in the neighborhood.  Our Chicago parking is quite interesting.  Great food, amazing food, but your whole experience will be tainted by a ticket.

pics.caption: The yellow of mustard
Sliced brisket, fries, beans, slaw

review.des:
wow... Honestly another great review for amazing BBQ! We were lucky to come with 6 of us and we are not shy so we shared tons of food and got a good sample of most of the menu.

I think the pulled pork sandwich was one of the best sandwiches I have had in my entire life. Soft roll, tons of pork and the perfect amount of sauce.

Everything was top of the line good food. The place is clean, kind staff that was very attentive and easy parking on the street.
Amazing bbq in Chicago.  The ribs are our favorite.  Don't miss the slaw, Mac and cheese or their fries.

My favorite BBQ around. The brisket is amazing, chopped or sliced. Get extra sauce. Also, ask for some spicy sauce if you like some heat. All the sides are amazing... Literally all of them but especially the mac. I don't normally eat Cole slaw except here. No mayo, just some vinegar, SOOO GOOD!!!!

pics.caption: Perfect

review.des:
FINALLY made it to Smoque BBQ!!! Why did it take me this long?! Don't question me!

Be sure to get here early if you want to skip the line. My friend and I arrived at 5:45pm on a Tuesday and there were plenty of empty tables to choose from. By 6:30pm, the line was extended to the door.

We ordered a platter with sliced brisket, cole slaw, barbecue beans, and corn bread. For more variety and better sharing, we also added a few tastes to our platter: pulled pork, Texas sausage, and quarter slab of St. Louis ribs. Everything on the platters were delicious even though I'm not generally a fan for cole slaw and beans.

With over 2,000 reviews for Smoque BBQ, I don't find it necessary to go into detail on why this place is so devilishly capturing. Just try it if you haven't yet or keep coming back for more. I will do my fair share of returns!

pics.caption: Sliced brisket, cole slaw, corn bread, and barbecued beans
Pulled pork, St. Louis ribs, Texas sausage

review.des:
I FINALLY MADE IT HERE!!

The line was out the door but our wait was only about 45 minutes from walking in until I was stuffing my face.
I was surprised that the setup involved ordering at the counter, getting your number called, but then being seated by the staff. No table service though, except to pick up your trash.
We got the sliced brisket, Texas sausage, pulled pork, side of mac & cheese, fries & cole slaw. The brisket was MELT IN YOUR MOUTH good! Great texture, visible smoke rings, impeccable flavor. The pulled pork was good too and came with a great BBQ sauce on it that wasn't too overpowering. I was a little bummed by the Texas sausage. It's based on Rudy's recipe so I had high expectations but the texture was a little tough for my liking. Honestly, Weber Grill's sausage links are much better.
All of the sides were good. Definitely too much food for two people but we just had to try it all! It's the best BBQ I've had in Illinois undoubtedly, and I've been to a LOT of BBQ joints...
VERY reasonably priced & it's BYOB!
PS: I wish they offered Carolina Mustard sauce...

pics.caption: Sliced brisket platter (comes with coleslaw) sides: mac & cheese and fries W/ a la carte Texas sausage

review.des: Hands down the best bbq in the city! There is honestly nothing even mediocre on the menu, its all delicious.  I usually spend $50 for just myself because i want everything.
Had baby back ribs and brisket. The ribs were great but the highlight was the brisket. Incredibly tender with a nice char. A side of baked beans was also delicious.

The only negative thing about this place is that its not open on Mondays. Everything and anything on the menu is great and I'm usually not a fan of bbq but this place is the exception!

The ribs are awesome and the beef biscuit meal is thinly sliced and a must! The beans, fries, mac & cheese & peach cobbler are delicious!

The service and staff is though rough and have never messed up my order. The decor is more rustic/industrial.

My friend and I decided to take a spontaneous trip to Smoque BBQ which has been on our list since we moved here. On a late Friday night around 9, we walked in to a busy, homey joint eager for barbecue. We scanned the menu and walked straight to the counter to order. I got 1/4 rack of St. Louis ribs with cole slaw and Mac n cheese (felt like the perfect portion to me) and she got a 1/3 rack of Baby Back ribs with fries and Mac n cheese (hers came with cole slaw).

As we settled down to the picnic like tables, we realized the cramped venue was BYOB. People brought in their own beer and even hard liquor and everyone looked very cheery and comfortable! Our food came shortly after and we of course had to take a first bite of the Mac n cheese - holy cheese gods! The flavors and creaminess of this BBQ side staple were absolutely heavenly and though the silver tin it came in was tiny, I was so excited to gobble down the whole thing. But, I have this thing where I like to save the best for last so I moved on to try the cole slaw. The cole slaw was a downer, not a lot of wetness and too peppery for me. Alas! But the crunchiness of the cabbage was a good complement to everything else. My friend's fries came in a huge portion. They were seasoned well, but felt too heavy for a bbq side in my opinion.

Next, the ribs! Man oh man, it's been so long since I've had ribs and they were phenomenal. I cleaned each rib to the bone. Each rib was so meaty and flavorful and the 1/4 rack was perfect! My friends 1/2 baby rack ribs were much smaller (not sure the appeal of baby back over St. Louis?). The ribs came with a small cup of the St. Louis sauce and I wasn't a fan of this sauce actually. It was more tangy than I would prefer. If I were to compare Q BBQ with Smoque, Q would definitely win the sauce category with their variety and unlimited quantities. Since I had brisket at Q, I can't compare the meats, but both had me blown away!

After some time, I was ready to finish up my macaroni. I was devastated to find that it got cold and the creaminess kind of curdled. TIP: eat yo mac n cheese right away

Because Smoque BBQ is rather far away, I see myself going to Q BBQ over Smoque. If it was closer, you better believe I'd be a regular for this top-notch Chicago barbecue!

pics.caption: My friends baby back ribs... So much smaller
Mama would be proud of how cleaned up these bones are ^_^
A perfect portion! 1/4 rack of St. Louis ribs and two sides. Next time pass on the cole slaw but never pass on the Mac n cheese!

review.des:
All good, cozy and wonderful.  Everything I had was good.  The sum of everything deserves the 5 stars.  Go with a platter not a sandwich.  No need to fill up on bread.

I can't wait to go back. Maybe even cater a party.  

Don't expect it to be cheap, it isn't.  But worth what you pay for.

Tried several BBQ places around town and I will say this is one of the best! We always bring our guests from out-of-town here because it will not disappoint!
We particularly love the sliced brisket, the pulled pork and the mac n cheese!

Love this place. 2nd time going figure i give a review

Parking: Street and lot. Place can get crowded so hopefully not too bad for ya. I never had a problem but luck goes a long way. Free btw

Scene:  can get crowded with lines looped through the establishment. Place can accommodate enough but its not the biggest place. Has a bbq line order feel with more lively vibe if that makes sense. Casual atmosphere overall.

Service: Nice enough for a place like this. Someone leads you to the order line, gives you a ticket, you order, once you are served they show you your seat to eat. Simple enough but could imagine witha large party this being mildly troubling oh well. Everyone one is nice. No issues

Food: I order the bean spicy chili, mac n cheese, and chicken BBQ. Portion size are a lil on the small side for the side dishes wish is a let down but the taste makes up for it. Everything is fresh, hot, and packs great taste. I'd recommend each dish I mentioned.

Overall: If you need a bbq fix can't go wrong with place. Small portions and long line but its worth it especially if youve never been. Cheers

pics.caption: Chili, Mac n Cheese, Chicken BBQ @ Smoque. Yum!

review.des: Delicious!! Not much to say that hasn't been said. But if you do go, order ahead and skip the line! There will be a line.
great BBQ smell, all the great reviews, whats all the big hoopla for? well you gotta find out for yourself. GREAT BBQ at a fair price. A Must Try!

One of the best BBQ places in Chicago, hands down.  

The sliced brisket rivals any of the BBQ places that I've eaten at, and I've spent time in both South Carolina and Kansas City.  The smoked chicken has great flavor as well, and begs to be eaten without sauce to experience the full flavor of the pit.  The portion sizes are large, as my wife and I usually get one sandwich and a platter so that we can split the sides. I enjoy the Memphis style BBQ sauce, and don't care much for the Carolina style that they serve with their dishes, but it ultimately comes down to personal preference there.

The staff is very friendly and quick to clear tables to keep people rotating through.  The lines are never too bad from my experiences, and it's also BYOB, so a meal like that can't be beat.

There's really not many ways to put this place into words.  You simply have to try it for yourself and let your tastebuds speak for themselves.

This place is barbeque heaven. I ordered the beef brisket sandwich. The brisket was juicy and absolutely perfect. I love that we were given a side of two different barbeque sauces (smoky and sweeter). It came with cole slaw and a side.  When it comes to the sides, we only tried the mac and cheese and fries...both were delicious.

The place got pretty crowded (it was early afternoon), so we snagged a table on the patio. Definitely sit outside if you can! It just adds to the barbecue experience.

I'm excited to go back to Smoque and try some of their pulled pork!

pics.caption: Brisket sandwich

review.des: When I was on a food rampage, I needed to stop on my commute home and try Smoque. I ordered a solid $30 worth of food for myself and nearly ate it alone in a sitting. The best ribs I've had in Chicago and everything else is a winning combo. I love BBQ and Smoque is top3 in Chicago.

As any fat guy does, I have a principled approach to BBQ.  My ingrained religious belief regarding this most American of food crafts is as follows.  You have 3 sorts of BBQ joints.  The first and most common is where the establishment focuses solely on the quality of the meat/sauces.  This is no doubt one of the most important qualities in what constitutes good BBQ, but it doesn't equate to a holistic approach to what makes this a 5 start restaurant.  The second type has amazing side options, think fires, corn bread, collard greens, etc; but their sauces are lack luster and their ribs are often boiled.  I appreciate the attention to the lesser details here, but you can't ignore the meats.  The final and rarest of the three is the BBQ joints that Smoque finds it self in.  They have solid ribs, a good variety of sauces, and sides so good you'll continue eating long after the meat sweats have set in.  Smoque has, in my husky opinion, mastered the trifecta tasty.  I don't like going to Smoque often only because I always eat to the point where I hate myself.  The portions are so healthy they will ensure you won't be.  The sides are so delectable; you'll find yourself sneaking some off your friend's tray.  But the meats, oh the meats, are all simply amazing.  My entire review is about why Smoque is so unique being in this 3rd tier of BBQ establishments.  

Let's be honest for a minute, you don't care what I ordered, and I won't waste your time by telling you.  Let me just say that everything, every rib, brisket, pulled pork/chicken, and side is worth your order.  Come early, come often, and come in relaxed fitting pants.  It's BYOB so you can even wash it all down with your favorite beer.  What more can you ask for in a neighborhood restaurant?  Maybe a fitness center next door?  I wouldn't go mind you, but the option would be nice.

Holy Moly- This stuff is delicious.  Guys, I am not from Texas or anything- just a local Chicagoan- but this stuff is legit.  The beef brisket is so soft and just basically melts in your mouth.  I've now been to the location on Pulaski as well as the location at Revival downtown.  It is one of my favorite places to grab a meal.  I highly recommend it.

The flavor of the sauces were incredible - especially the spicy sauce. The macaroni and cheese was perfect as well. I wish there would have been larger portions - the side was almost $5 and it was probably 10 bites. My only complaint is that the food wasn't very hot - I ordered a chopped brisket sandwich and the meat was cold, great flavor I just wish it would have been hot! Same with the fries - great flavor but they were cold!

Got a pulled pork platter with mac n' cheese and brisket chili, and was able to try a little bit of the brisket while I was there. First off....texture of the pulled pork was actually pretty amazing. Maybe I was lucky, but I got a bite with great crust, moist meat, and the perfect amount of savory fat to balance it all together. They drizzle a bit of their Memphis sauce on top of it but the pork stood on its own. The brisket also had a great smokey flavor, but I think from what I tried anyways their greater ratio of fat/lean meat in the pulled pork put it over texturally. Had a bit of trouble choosing which sides to grab, as with the coleslaw you get your choice of two between Baked beans, fries, mac n'cheese, and brisket chili. The Mac n' cheese was probably my favorite side; the fries were fries(still hot out of the fryer so you can't go wrong with them), and the brisket chili was alright but overall less flavorful than I thought it would be.

The Cole slaw too was actually really good, and if I didn't get it with the platter I would have ordered it on the side; It wasn't mayo-based but vinegar based so it tasted a little lighter than some other slaws, and added some freshness that provided a good balance with the smokey meats. As far as their sauces go, they provide two, a vinegar based Carolina sauce and a thicker Memphis Sauce. The sauces are good...but in all honestly didn't seem to distinguish themselves all too much from other bbq sauces I've had.

Verdict: Good but not mindblowing bbq, and given that it takes an hour for me to get there, not sure how often I would make the trip. Will probs go for their ribs next time, with slaw, mac n'cheese, and baked beans, to see how those hold up.

This is the best barbecue I've had in Chicago and it's absolutely worth the trek out. The cafeteria style makes it a really fun eating experience and the restaurant itself is simple and wood and nice looking.

I went with a friend and we pretty much gorged ourselves. I really loved the brisket and the pulled pork, particularly the former. The brisket slices were juicy, flavorful, and smoky. The fatty bit at the top is incredible and melts in your mouth like butter. The pulled pork was nice and also very juicy with a great smoky flavor. It was more chopped than pulled, but was still great. I disliked the St Louis ribs because they were too dry (I know they're dry by nature but they were not great and too spicy without there being enough good meaty flavor to interact with the spice).

The cornbread was unimpressive and also very dry; the Mac n cheese was watery and not super cheesy; the bbq beans were also very watery and sour/ vinegary. Beans are usually my favorite thing to get with bbq, but I didn't like these. It's OK though, I don't come for the sides -- I come for the meat and for the fun of eating a ton of meat here.

If you are going to get a side though, GET THE COLESLAW. I was shocked at how amazing it was. I don't typically expect coleslaw to be the star of a meal, but this came close. It's delicious and packed with sweet flavor without having that excess of mayonnaise that most slaws have. Another winner was the fries - hand cut, crispy, and greasy in the best way. I was also a big fan of the peach cobbler. It uses canned peaches, which is a little weird, but still very delicious. The crust is super crumbly, buttery, and sugary. I really enjoyed it.

Smoque is a treat in the summer or winter. The smell of the restaurant and the taste of the meats will bring you a joyful experience. I definitely recommend going.

Probably one of the best no-nonsense BBQ places in Chicago. I was recommended to go here by my roommate and wasn't disappointed. Although I haven't had much exposure to "fine" BBQ, I would have to say this place was amazing! I ordered the brisket, half rack of ribs, and a few pulled-pork sandwiches. Everything was delicious! The meat had that smokey, but not overly charcoal flavor, only thing was that I though the meat was a bit dry. However, I had my first bite after having the sandwiches sit in my luggage for about 2 hours, so I won't knock them on that. If I'm ever in the Chicago area again, I will definitely be coming back, and this time to get some sides as well! I've read in the comments that their sides are superb as well.
Consistently awesome food and service. You can't tip on credit cards though, which is kinda lame.
Hard to find parking. The sausage, ribs were delicious. The side dishes are ok. Nice patio! There's always a line but staff is efficient. No alcohol.

This is our go-to BBQ joint. There is no other.

Since it's BYOB, my husband and I stopped at a liquor store on the way. I ran in and picked up a 6 pack of beer and a nice Mexican guy came up to me and asked me if he could buy it for me...after this moral dilemma, we were on our way to Smoque. So excited. So very very hungry.

We got here on a weeknight a little after 6pm and were prepared to wait in line until we had experienced many emotions ranging from excitement, to indifference, to frustration, to near starvation, to murderous rage, satisfaction, forgiveness, and everything in between, but we only had to wait a whopping 5 minutes before placing our order. I love that the menu is written on a chalkboard so you can decide what you want while you wait in line. We both got the brisket platter with the BBQ beans, fries,  and mac n' cheese. Both of our meals came with a side of cole slaw.

Can I just talk about the mac n' cheese for a sec, because that mac n' cheese is so damn good I just want to roll around naked in it and now they offer a large size which makes me so happy deep down inside my soul.

We sat and proceeded to devour our meal like rabid hyenas. I couldn't finish my platter so my husband took over. He had a hard time finishing as well. The brisket was so tender, so juicy, so succulent, so sexy! We sat there drinking the last of our beer while he stood, raised his beer and declared Smoque, the best brisket in Chicago. I stood and concurred. Everyone cheered and clapped. In one swift movement, he swooped me up into his arms and  we exited and walked down Pulaski with BBQ sauce on our faces.

The wait time totally depends. Sometimes we've gone there and waited only 5 minutes. Sometimes we've waited 20 and it can feel like a mosh pit in there and everywhere you stand, you're always in someone else's way. They seem to have their own system down to make the line move as fast and smoothly as possible and it appears to be working well for them. They don't have the proper license so you can't BYOB and sit outside

Visiting Chicago for Cub's game.  Found this gem near Wrigley.  WOW great BBQ.  Had brisket and wife had ribs. Both were excellent. Good smoke flavor and good sauce. Sides were good, liked the corn bread and mac n' cheese. Place got crowded very quickly around dinner time. Looking forward to next Cub's game and killer BBQ

I wondered how this joint could sustain 4.5 stars after so many reviews.   Then I went. I like BBQ.  Now I will always compare BBQ to Smoque.  The smoky flavor permeates the ribs, chicken and brisket- bringing them  to a heavenly level. The sides were excellent as well.  If they are making pecan bread pudding, do yourself a favor and get it.     This is a definite return visit next time I'm in Chicago.

OMG so good St. Louis rib awesome...
Chilli is good,  pulled pork sandwich also good and bbq chicken sooo good.  Not a fan of cornbread though,  just beware it does get busy for lunch.

If you love bbq, you have to check this place out! You'll smell the delicious goodness just walking by. Be prepared for a long wait if you come at night, but on a Sunday afternoon, there was no wait. When you head in, you order at the register and then someone directs you to a table. The food comes out fairly quickly, and it's great. We ordered a full slab of ribs (22.95) and since we were indecisive about which type we wanted, baby back or St. Louis. Both were delicious, but I prefer the baby back ribs since the St. Louis is fattier. None fall off the bone since they are smoked. For our two sides, we chose the Mac and cheese, which I would recommend, and the chili, which I would not. It was a little too watery. We also ordered a platter of pulled pork a la carte (8.45). You should definitely get this- it's pretty much perfect.

Overall, this is my favorite BBQ place, and you should give it a try!

pics.caption: Pulled pork platter a la carte (8.45)
Full slab- half baby back and half st. Louis with 2 sides- brisket chili and mac& cheese (22.95)

review.des: I liked their baby back ribs - cooked right and tasty, but were not fall off the bone. The St Louis ribs were rather dry and tough. Their Memphis sauce is average. The brisket chili, mac n cheese and cornbread were all good. Their coleslaw is the best in town and not made with mayonnaise! It reminded me of red tangy coleslaw of my home state NC where BBQ is a religion.

I've been here before but only for take out and on Friday night we decided to not worry about the horrible traffic and make the trip to come eat here.  This is a BYOB place and we brought a 6 pack of beer with us.  I guess not everyone realized that this is a BYOB place because some people looked pretty jealous as we sipped on our booze and enjoyed our BBQ.  The place itself is very small but efficient because they seem to crank out a ton of customers a day.  People sit down, get their food quickly, eat and leave, so in essence the perfect BBQ spot.  We ordered a full rack of the St.Louis ribs. It came with slaw and two sides of our choice, beans and fries.  Everything was delicious and smokey, including the beans which were probably the best bakes beans I ever had.  My bf also ordered their gumbo and said it was awesome.  I definitely will be making a trip out to this place again, super casual, great food and good prices.

pics.caption: Gumbo

review.des: very nice local place for some great food. staff are very friendly. kids friendly as well. love the brisket and fries. baby back ribs is good.

Stopped in at the Revival Food Court location in the loop. Let your meat breathe but be sure to try the Luling sauce with canded jalapeños!! Limited warm side options but I was full. Several of the staff checked in on me as I ate...must try... Be a regular!

pics.caption: Chopped brisket

review.des: Fabulous food. Helpful staff. No reason to go elsewhere for great BBQ.

pics.caption: June 9, 2016

review.des: Until someone comes along and makes better BBQ then they are 5 stars. They do a great job and are always consistent. Never had a bad meal here. Keep it up!!
This is the best BBQ place i have ever been to. I strongly recommend it to everyone. Totally worth it to come here after the beach.
Best in Chicago. The ribs and beef brisket are my favorites. Decent fries and Mac and cheese. They always have a line so call ahead. Get some!

Super duper amazing food!
One of the best bbq joints
So much food and price is great
Recommended!

The place is packed every day.   If you're in the northside and have a hankering for smoky flavored BBQ then this is THE ONLY place.

Everything is good off the menu.  Order it all, stuff your face, then go back from whence you came!

You know how some places are hit or miss.  This place is like home run or double.  The food is either very good or amazing! I went on a Saturday a few months ago and the BBQ was good.  But I went for lunch the other day with a work associate from out of town and the food was on point!
