I always get the chopped brisket and it did not disappoint.  I Highly recommend if you're looking for a good BBQ joint.

When someone tells you to stop at this place when you are in the city of Chicago, you won't regret it. Believe them!. The Ribs & Brisket are unfound treasures to your mouth. And let's not forget about their chicken salad. For you health folks which we all try to be : )

Only down side to this place I can say is the prices, and the size portions of some of the sides you choose.

2 Meat Platter (Pulled Pork, Sliced Beef Brisket) w/ Slaw & 2 Sides (Macaroni & Cheese, Cornbread)

The 2 Meat Platter served w/ Slaw and 2 Sides

a la Carte - $8.95

w/ Slaw & 2 Sides - $12.45

Yes, it's another BBQ Joint; you're best not to get tired of BBQ here... If so, I feel bad for ya! Here at Smoque, you can expect an absolute line out the door, so be sure to get here no later than 11am if you want a seat.

The atmosphere is the a-typical BBQ joint. Small, not much for seating and the main focus being the fantastic Q! Which in my honest opinion is pretty rockin'. Keep the atmosphere, just give me good food!

As seen on Triple D's Real Deal BBQ, it is the Real Deal and Smoque lives up to it. So if you're in the Chicago area and you're looking for the "best of the best" BBQ, stop by Smoque and get it!

pics.caption: 2 Meat Platter (Pulled Pork, Sliced Beef Brisket) w/ Slaw & 2 Sides (Macaroni & Cheese, Cornbread)

review.des: This place is worth the hype.  I ordered the half slab of the St. Louis ribs with mac n cheese and beans. It comes with coleslaw. My husband and I shared the peach cobbler dessert.  We were stuffed--the food was awesome! The ribs were super tender, had a great outside, the sauce was delicious...I am looking forward to coming back already!  Service was fast and friendly.  Note, it's BYOB--there is a liquor store/bar about 2 blocks south of the restaurant if you want to pick something up.

Ehh. I don't know what all the fuss it about. I thought the food, flavor wise was mediocre.

here are the items I tried:

Ribs (I asked for saint louis, they served baby back. I found them to be under seasoned)
chicken (remarkably tender, but lacking in salt)
brisket chill (pretty good)
Spicy and regular bbq sauce (neither one of them were particularly good)
French Fries (DELICIOUS)
Mac & Cheese (ehh)
Corn Bread (I would put my money on this being a jazzed up off brand jiffy)
Peach Cobbler (topping good, peaches, however, were not good AT ALL)
Slaw (GOOD. the vinegar sauce was great to cut the fattiness of the ribs)

I won't go out of my way to go back, however if someone caters them for an event I wouldn't necessarily avoid.

There could be a wait sometimes but service is usually pretty fast. It is not really a place for you and your friends to chill and hang out as people are waiting to sit down and enjoy their food.

Foodwise - try everything by ordering side portions of ribs, brisket, sausage, and pulled pork. Split it with a friend. Totally worth it!

Nobody gets a five. Smoque came close though. A busy Sunday afternoon. We lined up for maybe 10 mins...were given a seat and not too long after we has some of the best ribs we have ever tasted. Of course I wish they had a parking lot, of course I wish I lived closer

Mighty fine ribs guys!

Had the Beef brisket platter, and St Louis style baby back ribs, with fresh cut potatoe fries, mac & cheese, Cole slaw, corn bread. All excellent. The meats at Smoque was the best I've BBQ, I've had in all my 50 years.

There is no better BBQ in Chicago, this place serves some of the best food I can imagine in the Country as far as smoked meats, once you get there despite of them staying very busy there is never an issue with quality, love it and have been going there since they opened up the door years back. Pricing is acceptable, BOYB is a big plus.
Best BBQ in the city. Promise. If not... we'll go to that place then. I'm generally a pull pork fan but the brisket is great as well. Definitely go w/ the Mac N Cheese as your side.

Tasty, but it was really just OK, I wasn't like blown out of my socks, sorry. I love BBQ, and can recall Smalls first then Dino BBQ as being some of the best in recent memory, but this was not as good I thought. But just like a fraction of a percent off from Dino. Real good BBQ to me is Memphis or Texas.

However, when you rank this place against other BBQ places in Chi? Its for sure top 5. Which is a small pool to draw from, but man, I thought Smalls topped this place, followed by Dino's just on selection. Never mind the unnecessarily intimidating ordering process. Which is like, what? It made me feel awkward, I don't know why. Also the layout of the restaurant is pretty bad. I also was with 2 children, but it just was overall just OK to me.

3000+ reviews and almost 5 stars. I doubt my review will be your tipping point.
Amazing BBQ! It was a great experience overall and the prices were very reasonable! We have the combo rack and pulled pork. We took half of it home cause it was so much! We will definitely be back!

Amazing fall off the bone BBQ!!!
In Chicago for the weekend and heard about this place from the locals and it truly lived up to the hype.  Love that it is a local mom and pop neighborhood restaurant with great service and food.  I had the 1/2 baby back 1/2 st Luis rib combo and it was great!  Highly recommend!

pics.caption: Ordering and dining area
Rick combo have St. Louis have to be back

review.des:
Great good! The taste was fantastic. Serving sizes were appropriate, even for a larger gent. The place was packed. You are personally seated, but you must order and pay up front first as well as gather your order when it's called.  Staff and environment were nice. Thoough, it's worth mentioning the menu is specialized and small.

Would recommend a nice out door table when the weather allows.

Girlfriend and I drove up the highway for smoked meat on Sunday, from one of Chicago's most popular restaurants. I dropped off the dry cleaning and navigated the Kennedy while she placed the order by phone. When we arrived at Smoque, I parked outside. It was about 5PM and there was a line way out the door. I asked the busser how to deal with the line- he directed me right in to the register. Minutes later we were on the Irving Park road to Portage Park for some BBQ in the grass.

The trees were greened out in buds and baby leaves. The grass was lush and the ground was dry. We got two slabs of St. Louis style ribs with creamy crusty edged mac and cheese, not-sweet cornbread, well seasoned fries and peach cobbler, which we got to later. Actually there was cole slaw too, but haven't got to that yet either. The ribs were unbelievable, pink smoke ring, so much smoky flavor that my hands still smell like a campfire. They need no sauce. I ate half the slab and was so full I meat-tripped the rest of the afternoon well into the evening.

Boss and I made a bet- she said the leaves would be in full bloom next week and I said this week.

pics.caption: ribs in portage park

review.des:
My first time.  
I had takeout.  It was good but not what I expected.  Had St Louis full slab.  Good rub and very good bbq sauce, tangy and spicy.  I felt that ribs were a bit over cooked.  I will give it another shot since I believe that it could have been a bad batch.

We moved to Chicago in May this year and have had plenty of BBQ, from the "ew!" To the "it was okay"; but this is our first Chicago BBQ WOW!
My wife said that the pulled pork and chopped brisket were supreme, I had the sliced brisket, what a flavour...and so well cooked. We tried the sauces (Memphis and Carolina) just because they gave them to us, but mostly we ate the meat plain. It is so well smoked and so well cooked that adding something to it seemed redundant.
The sides too...they are not just an after thought...obviously attention to detail is paid them also. The coleslaw was great, no mayo in sight; the cornbread, mac & cheese fantastic; and the BBQ Gumbo was phenomenal!!
The service was excellent and the dining room clean, we will most assuredly return!!

Absolutely divine St. Louis ribs and brisket - probably some of the best I've ever had. Portions are large and scrumptious, staff is friendly, though the place does get insanely busy sometimes. Love the lightly vinegary slaw and fresh hand cut fries. Each dish comes with two types of BBQ sauce: a tangier one and a sweeter thick one.

Best bbq joint in Chicago. Have been coming to this place since they opened. They've figured out some of the kinks over the years. Taking your order to go? Call it in. Even if it's on your way to pick it up. Should save you some wait time. Nothing we haven't liked from here. The peach cobbler definitely a yes for dessert! The ribs, you've got 2 choices. I never rem2mber which to get so get both every time. I end up likely the leaner ones,whichever those are.

I went here a couple years ago before my most recent visit here tonight and i have to say that this time around my experience was much better! Some notable options are getting the cornbread, pecan bread pudding over the peach cobbler, and bbq beans were ok and avoid the coleslaw! Furthermore, I really like the 1/2 pulled pork and 1/2 brisket sandwiches over the baby back ribs because they were moist, had more flavor and were more tender. The ribs were not fall off the bone-some parts wasn't as soft as id like it to be and reminds me of dry-rubbed ribs i can get elsewhere which might be the reason they lack more flavor because you have to apply either the side of Memphis style sauce or Carolina style BBQ sauces they give ya...Happy to have made it here just before 7pm so there was a short line. It dont know when they started having you order even before they allow you to sit down but i kinda like the line management and the bus boy clearing off tables right away to allow additional seating. Service was quick considering the turn out and woman at register was very nice!

pics.caption: Peach cobbler and Pecan bread pudding with salted bourbon caramel sauce
1/2 Pulled pork and 1/2 Sliced brisket sandwich with side of Memphis style or Carolina style BBQ sauce

review.des: Smoque has to be the best bbq in the city.  I go here specifically for their brisket. It's smoky, juicy,  tender,  and their bbq sauce is a wonderful finishing touch,  though not needed.  It can get busy,  so try to come before peak hours so you're not cramped

I seriously can't understand how an employee can close a to-go container WITHOUT putting any BBQ sauce in the container w/the meat?!?!?!?!

First day in a long while eating anything more than broccoli for lunch (I'm an avid healthy eater) and you ruined my lunch.  Thanks.

P.S.  This is the SECOND time this has happened.  How difficult is it to train your employees to understand that most people, when they order meat from a BBQ restaurant, WANT BBQ SAUCE!!!!!!

Arguably the best bbq in town, on par with Green St but at a much lower price. The brisket was juicy and the staff friendly. I wish this was closer to downtown but then it wouldn't be such good value! Definitely worth a trip.
Good food, lots of choices. Corn bread was delicious - it has pieces of corn in it. Beans contain pieces of the meat. The chicken is my favorite.

Just try to pass up this place when you drive by in the nice weather with your windows down. Everything we've had here has been delicious. I usually will get the pulled pork and my husband will get the brisket. The sides are standard but really let the meat shine
Great place, had the pulled pork sandwich and brisket chili.  Tasty and good value.  Parking is a challenge, but overall a great place to eat.
Outstanding BBQ. I'm a native Texan and Smoque is the most authentic BBQ that I've had outside of Texas. Get there early and try everything.

The food was great! The atmosphere was awesome and the service is great. I will definitely be back again. Plus it is BYOB. Try the Brisket and sausage, hell try everything! The fries were on point as well. Thanks Smoque!

This barbecue is arguably the best barbecue I have had anywhere in the United States. I have been eating here since the first day they open the door and the quality has never changed. They are still serving the same perfect food that they were at the very beginning.  Sample food darn good. That and great customer service is the key to a successful restaurant.  #fine-casualdining

Smoque is great, though my local preference is for Smalls.
They do a few great things here, namely the pulled pork and ribs. Brisket is sometimes great, sometimes overly fatty, sometimes dry. It's variable.

Best bet is to call ahead and pick-up, unless you like waiting in a long line. Service is always helpful and friendly. The place is always packed with a crowd, and it gets loud, so we'll either go early or get carry-out. Solid BBQ joint.

Good place.  Baby backs were too dry but the St. Louis were moist.  The mac and cheese was dry and Unseasoned and the beans were puckery vinagary.

Suggest the brisket as it looked awesome.

Service is fine. People were friendly enough. But having had Phils BBQ in San Diego. This place cannot even compare. Corn bread---Marie Calendar's is better. Mac and cheese---okay. Coleslaw---mediocre.

Ordered full slab of St Louis and babyback ribs. Babyback was a little dry. Had an order of the brisket which is very tender and well-cooked but lacking flavor.

I wouldn't come back.

Took my parents and middle son here for the best BBQ chicago has to offer and it didn't disappoint at all!  Once again, had the spicy ass BBQ Gumbo - yes, I said BBQ gumbo - which is incredible!  The beans are incredible, the meat excellent, and the Carolina sauce insatiable!  Want BBQ in Chicago?  Kill yourself if you go elsewhere!  Lol

SOOOOO since my first visit, this place has gotten WAAYY better. I don't understand how delicious this place is. I even waited 20 minutes outside in a line to sit and eat... Mah Gawd!
This place is special

Total garbage! Take this crap over to the South Side or West Side, and this wouldnt even pass as roadkill. Dry bbq with mediocre sides and a hefty price tag, that's a formula for a 1 star review.  Smoque, you definitely earned it.

I don't think I need to actually make a review here but here I go:

AMAZING BBQ! Great main dishes awesome sides. Great all around. There is a reason they have won awards and are often rated best in Chicago.

I guess the only down sides are it does get busy (because it's good), sometimes it's hard to get a seat (because it"s good and small) and its a bit pricy (you know, because it's good).

I've only had Smoque catering, so I can't speak for the service or ambiance, but the food - wowwee! I had a pulled pork sandwich, BBQ chicken, corn bread, coleslaw, mac and cheese, and bourbon-pecan bread pudding.

THE GOOD:
- The pulled pork was tender and juicy, and tasted phenomenal on the sandwich. There were several sauce options, so naturally, I poured all of them on my sandwich.
- The coleslaw wasn't too mayo-y, and added a really nice and refreshing component to the meal
- The mac and cheese was truly out of this world. Smooth and creamy, not too salty, jam-packed with flavor
-  THE BREAD PUDDING OH MY GOD OH  MY GOD. I wouldn't say that this is a traditional bread pudding - because it's not - and so it cannot be directly compared with those fresh from the South, but that's what makes this so amazing. It tastes like a pecan pie with a bourbon kick, with the soft and smooth texture of a bread pudding on the inside, with a pie-like textured crust. Different, but in a great way!

MEH:
- The chicken was fine. Nothing special. Kind of plain - the flavor didn't seep into the middle.
- The corn bread was not sweet or spicy enough. It was very bland and a waste of calories. The only positive was the little pieces of corn in the mix - they were delightful.

pics.caption: Pulled pork sandwich, cornbread, mac and cheese, coleslaw remnants, BREAD PUDDING (my mouth is watering as I type!)

review.des:
Not that this place needs another review with it's 2000+ reviews but what the heck. Here's my two cents anyways.
After reading several reviews, I was prepared for a long line and wait. And while I didn't relish the idea of waiting outside on the street in Chicago in January, for good BBQ it's a sacrifice I'm willing to make. Turned out I had nothing to worry about. We walked in placed our order and than were sat almost immediately. About 15 minutes later, a line formed but even then people didn't seem to have an issue waiting a few minutes for a spot.
Food wise, I ordered the chopped brisket platter with the Mac and cheese and baked beans for my sides. Mac and cheese, amazing! Loved the toasted bread crumbs on top and it was the perfect balance of creamy cheese with noodles. From reviews I knew their baked beans were cooked in the smoker and I enjoyed the smokey flavor the beans had. The slaw was good. I usually prefer a creamy slaw but the vinegar based slaw was a perfect compliment to the meal. The chopped brisket was great. I'm a fan of the Tennessee BBQ sauce and once I put some of that on the brisket, I was in heaven.
I'm sure I'll have to wait for a spot the next time I come here but I know it's worth the wait.

pics.caption: So much food but so good!

review.des: I was taken to this place the mothers day weekend. my nephew treated my friend and I . when we parked the smell of bbq was in the air. As we entered and saw the line we all looked at each other.  I DONT HAVE PATIENCE. But not to worry line moved fast because they have alot workers behind the counter. Took no more then. 10 minutes to order., you sit yourself down . When your name is called foods ready and on trays. We all order the 1/2 slab baby back ribs for$15.95. with/slaw and 2 sides. The cole slaw was okay. Loved the mac and cheese but portion was small. But order of fries was huge. one word of warning DO NOT wear light top cause you will end up with sauce all over it. The ribs were very tender fall of the bone. They have plenty of chairs inside and outside. There are a couple of young man standing in front with a rag and spray bottle. As soon as someone finishes they will take your tray and wipe table. There are people coming in to pick up orders. This place is like an assembly line, everything is moving as it should be. would I go back ? For sure. or i will phone in order.

Great spot for quality BBQ! Although it's typically packed, the employees create a dynamic atmosphere that's enjoyable. Seeing the cooks at work adds to the experience of the food. As for recommendations, everything is good!

I love this BBQ! We actually had them cater our wedding last year and it was PERFECT. We had brisket and pulled pork, macaroni and cheese, baked beans, salad and their amazing corn bread. Some people thought BBQ didn't go with our beautiful reception venue, but once they tasted how good Smoque tasted, they completely understood our choice.

We've also eaten at the restaurant and ordered larger quantities of food for pick up. In fact, we recently picked up their food for a party we were hosting and we tried the brisket chili for the first time. Also delicious. I guess at this point I should not be surprised by that!

I definitely recommend this spot!

Based on the reviews, I really thought this place would be better! We got the baby back ribs, pulled pork, baked beans, cornbread, mac n cheese, coleslaw, and pecan bread pudding. It was all good! But just good. The BBQ is better at Q's. The beans are better at Smoke Daddy. I guess this place has the best coleslaw? That sounds like a dig, but actually I mean it, the coleslaw here is REALLY GOOD.

The table next to us got brisket sandwiches though, and they looked AMAAZZING. Poofy, squishy looking bread, piles and piles of brisket.. I'd come back just to try that. Food envy is such a burden.

Anyway, if you're a BBQ fan, you should go just to check it off your list.

Often when I have driven by Smoque, there is always a long line out the door. Could the barbeque be "that" good? Are people really that anxious to get barbeque at Smoque as opposed to anywhere else? The answer to both questions is yes.

Pulled pork barbeque sandwich. Homemade macaroni and cheese. Baked beans. Peach cobbler.

The sandwich was worthy. Must admit the sauce was thin, although flavourful. The macaroni and cheese was more creamy than stringy, but that was fine. The baked beans had me won over from the first spoonful. As to the peach cobbler, it needed a scoop of ice cream.

You have to be patient to get into Smoque. Food comes fast once you're in, though. It's worth it. I even allowed pork in my diet this one time for the sake of experiencing Smoque.

pics.caption: Pulled pork barbeque sandwich. Homemade macaroni and cheese. Barbeque beans. Peach cobbler.

review.des:
I'm a SE Louisiana hunting bbq chick and anytime I'm visiting a city I've never been to, I always check my Diner's, Drive-In's & Dive's app to see where Guy Fieri has been to and I got super excited when I saw that he'd been to a bbq place. My bf and I decided that we'd check out Smoque BBQ before I headed back home to New Orleans from my New Year's visit.

I'm a sucker for brisket (fatty, please) so I got the plate with mac & cheese and cornbread and my bf got the pulled pork plate with baked beans and cornbread (bty, it automatically comes with coleslaw). Now, I've had my fair share of brisket and I had a local New Orleans favorite that unfortunately closed due to a family illness but Smoque BBQ ranks right up there with my local favorite. I will say this, being a southern chick, I know good mac & cheese and cornbread when I taste it, and theirs is pretty darn good. We each were given 2 different sauces with our plate and we both preferred the tomato based sauce over the vinegar based sauce.

I, of course, didn't finish my plate and amazingly, neither did my bf (what?), which was surprising so I took a few slices of brisket, some pulled pork, 1/2 of my mac & cheese and cornbread on the plane trip back home. My flight was delayed so I'm at Midway sitting at gate 10, concourse B when my stomach growls. I pull out my take out box, open it and pinch off a piece of brisket and as I'm getting ready to put it in my mouth, the guy sitting next to me says "that smells amazing, did you get that here in the airport and I'm like, no, my bf & I visited Smoque BBQ on N. Pulaski Road earlier today and these are the leftovers that are going home with me". Needless to say, he looked disappointed that he wasn't going to be able to go get some and I certainly wasn't sharing mine with him.

In my opinion, good bbq should heat up well in the microwave and the taste shouldn't alter at all and Smoque BBQ, you passed the test the following day after I arrived back home in New Orleans.

(I'm addressing the new location in the old CPS building in the loop, on Adams across the street from the post office) Actually, nothing to "complain" about here... just not worth a "rave" of any sort.  I had the (sliced) brisket sandwich and the jalapeno sausage.  The brisket was tender enough (a bit dry) but had just the BAREST hint of smoke - my guess is they are wrapping it too soon, and it's just not getting enough "smoke time". The sausage had a good bit of heat (a nice surprise, since they usually back off a bit so as not to offend!) but was so INCREDIBLY greasy that it seemed to be trying to slide down my throat before I'd really chewed it.  Potato salad was good, but middle of the road, and an extra 0.50 for pickled jalapenos seemed a bit of a stretch (like I was being asked to pony up extra for the ketchup on a hotdog, or a pickle on my cheeseburger).

I smoke food often (brisket, ribs, turkey, cheese, you name it!), and mine is simply (not to put TOO fine a point on it) better, and I do NOT say that about every single place I try... The Meat House, in Tinley Park, for example, turns out what I HOPE to make some day.  

I think the long lines at this new downtown location can be attributed to the novelty of having a BBQ place handy, and the fact that it DOES smell good (they must be pumping the smoke out into the restaurant, because very little actually gets into the meat).  But it IS overpriced ($8+ for less meat than you'd get in a decent burger) and my guess is that those lines will taper off pretty soon, once folks twig to that.  I'd gladly pay more for better BBQ, and while this isn't (exactly) a rip-off, it's definitely a case of getting LESS than you paid for....

So so good! There is a wait during peak meal times but it's certainly worth the wait and they get people in and out pretty quickly. The chopped brisket is the best I've ever had. All the sides are really great too. I've also tried their ribs and pulled pork. Brisket was my favorite. My husband loves their gumbo too when they have it.

It's BYOB and counter service. They give you a table after you order.

Get the brisket you won't be disappointed!
So so good. Crazy busy and i can see why. The atmosphere rocked and the brisket was so tender.  With the two different bbq sauces a texas link and some sides. I couldn't have had better. On point.

So pleasantly surprised to find such a good BBQ establishment in my neighborhood. Came on a Thursday evening and the line was pretty much out the door. The wait for the table was decent but just watching the food come out and people feasting made it seem longer than normal.

I ordered some plate combo thingy, I chose a half slicked brisket sandwich with the St. Louis style ribs, mac n cheese and cole slaw. Not too long after we were seated, our food came out and boy did it look tasty.

Went of the sandwich first. Brisket was tasty and juicy, nice smokey flavor with a good spice rub. The sauce was tangy and delicious. Scarfed it all down and moved onto the ribs. The ribs fell apart as I touched them, came right off the bone. You could see a good smoke ring and the spices formed a really nice crust on the outside. Juicy, tender and flavorful. Mac n cheese wasn't very special. Good but not life changing. Cole slaw was really good though. Seemed to have less mayo than normal and more of a vinegary tang.

Very lively and energetic atmosphere. The next time I come I'll probably stick to some slicked brisket and a full rack of St. Louis ribs. YUM can't wait for my next visit.
Holy moly. BEST BBQ we've ever had! I've had a number of BBQ in Texas too and this place by far beats them all. The rib and sausage... amazing!

I have been here three times, all during dinner hours.

Smoque is one of the most popular barbecue restaurants in the city.  They don't take reservations, they seat and move people in and out.  If you are going during dinner plan on standing in a line all the way out the door and weather will not scare people away.  They will ask you how many are in your party if you are dining in and you will have a chance to order before being seated.  

Usually by the time you order a table is made available for you.  You will be given a number so it is important that you keep your ears open as it can become quite loud in this restaurant.  The staff is very professional and they know how to keep people moving.  

I've had the pulled pork sandwich and the sliced brisket sandwich with all of the different sides.  Everything on this menu is exceptional.  Even the slaw is good for someone who doesn't really care for coleslaw.  The meat is savory and tender with just the right amount of sauce.  They offer you a cup of additional sauce if you want to add more.  All the food is served on a metal cafeteria like plate with a sheet up cooking paper.  A nice touch to the scrappy eat with your hands kind of meal.  

Smoque can be kind of expensive but at least you are getting what you pay for.  For $10-15 you will not be disappointed as this is by far the best BBQ in the city.

pics.caption: Sliced brisket sandwich with brisket chili and slaw

review.des: DELICIOUS BBQ in Chicago. I've had the pulled pork sandwich, brisket, mac and cheese, and cornbread. It's all really good. The place is a little small so I recommend either taking it to go or going at an off time. Otherwise it's great food, filling, and really satisfying.

I was bitchin' & moanin when friends suggested we check this out. But it turned out to be great! We had the St. Louis ribs, pulled pork & of course the famous sliced brisket. Everything was so tender and flavorful and moist! No wonder it has thousands of stellar reviews. Well-deserved!

pics.caption: Sliced brisket & side of ribs

review.des:
I know this is supposed to be the best place for BBQ.
But just doesn't do it for me.. Sometimes the meat is dry or the cornbread is dry....taste is alright but it misses the mark.
The service, cleanliness is amazing! Really great. This place runs like a well oiled machine. But I just am not impressed with the food.

I do like the slaw they serve. Always a fan of vinegar slaw than the kind that's really heavy mayo!
Smoque is far and away the best BBQ I've ever had.  Actually, everything on the menu is great.  I'd be 500 lbs if I lived closer to Smoque.

This place easily deserves all the praise it gets. I would 100% recommend Smoque, and of all the BBQ places that exist in the Midwest Smoque holds its own ground even compared to much of the BBQ I've had in the South. You have to prepare to wait through the line to order for dine-in, and numerous people called in to take their orders to go, which might be the right choice given the small confines of the restaurant. I came with 3 friends, and we waited for about 30 minutes, which wasn't as painful as it sounds as we were inundated with the smell of the delicious food to come. By the time we ordered, we didn't even have to wait at all to score a 4 person table, a big plus as I was afraid we wouldn't have a place in time for our meal.

I ordered the Brisket Platter, and when I asked the cashier if she recommended it chopped or sliced, she told me "sliced is best if you want it juicier and chopped is best if you like more of the smoky, taste of the more cooked parts of the meat". She even offered for me to have 1/2 sliced and 1/2 chopped, so I of course chose the variety. The brisket was some of the most delicious I have ever had, and I would definitely recommend both. The two made in house BBQ sauces were fantastic as well (one was served with my friend's chicken and one was a special brisket sauce). I tried a bite of the chicken, and it was extremely flavorful and balanced with its perfect smokey taste.

The Mac 'n Cheese was amazing, and the cornbread was beyond words - the best I have ever had. I feel silly saying that, but I mean it. The best I've ever had.

You cannot go wrong here. Go for the platter over the sandwich my other friend told me, as he didn't love the bread and for ~$1 you get more of the centerpiece here: the meat.

The best BBQ in Chicago. Brisket was amazing. Thick cut, super tender and just dissolves in your mouth as it should. Smoques is up there on the best BBQ's I've ever had. Small place for such great BBQ.

Baby BACK ribs!! O...M.....G!
Amazing!! Great flavor.... Everything.

I recommend this place.
Staff is also great.
I came here and saw the line almost outside of the door, that's. Good sign, and even more that it moved rapidly. Even if it didn't it's worth the wait.

It's tasty.

I only get it to go and bypass the ever present line.

The bread pudding and Coleslaw are sleepers on the menu.

Having had the whole menu I think everything is a safe choice but feel the chicken is the weakest link.

Full slab of St Louis style ribs, a chili,  with 2 extra coleslaw is my standard order.
Best BBQ in Chicago, hands down.  Owners are amazing people as well.

I have not had any better pulled pork in Northern IL, so worth the hype and yelp rating. A pure BBQ joint with all the traditional favorites.  The Mac and Cheese was awesome and pulled pork sandwich with slaw was perfect. I have had BBQ all over the country and really enjoyed this place. The sliced brisket was also extremely tender---Wow it was good! Easy street parking in front.

First time here.  Plenty of menu choices and the prices are decent. I had the pulled pork and sampled some ribs. Absolutely fantastic flavor. The ribs were Smokey and tender. It came with Memphis and Carolina style sauce, both were perfect. There is some seating outside if the weather is nice. Its right off highway 90, easy to get to.

Went here for lunch with a friend.
I had the 1/2 and 1/2 pulled pork and bbq brisket.
Yum and Yum.
I paired it with coleslaw which was very good.
I tried my friends baked beans - great
Fantastic BBQ and I can't wait to go back.
Outdoor seating.

Oh Jesus Christ I cannot even write this without salivating. The brisket is beyond amazing the pulled pork is perfection the fries super crunchy oh and the corn bread is simply delicious. They are closed on Mondays which I keep forgetting -_- the weekends get crazy packed the longest I've waited was over an hour and 45 min. If you're going to wait that long no worries about trying to find a table they're smart and slow down service so by the time your food is ready there will be a table available. Note: they will seat you don't just sit down wherever you please. To go is a recommend. Oh and it's BYOB. Can't beat that. The bbq is the best I really don't have a negative thing to say about this place.

With all of the wonderful food choices in Chicago we're severely lacking in barbeque, so Smoque was a wonderful surprise.

Tender, flavorful ribs and brisket to die for. (I prefer sliced over chopped.) The pulled pork is delicious as well, even without sauce. They have good sides and sandwiches too. My family likes this place a lot. It's on the north side of the city and definitely worth it.

I had to see what all the hype was about and to be honest.. it's just another bbq place. So what happens is... you get there.. wait in line.. order and pay for your food.. and if you want to sit... see the employee in line and he'll seat you as soon as a seat becomes available. I had the bbq brisk and it was good... standard.. it did indeed taste smokey! I also had the cornbread and bbq baked beans... ehh.. I could have done without the cornbread. Their coleslaw is actually quite tasty!! And their infamous peach cobbler was really nothing I would write home about. Overall... good if you're hankering for some meat.. but be sure to stop by during the weekday when it's not too crowded!

PS. It's BYOB! So plan ahead!
If anyone is dissatisfied with this restaurant, they have absolutely no clue what is going on and should seriously reevaluate the decisions they have made up to this point.
I'm from New York here on vacation with my family , being here  before on my own came here again with my family. Smoque bbq still the best bbq in Chicago period.....

pics.caption: My wife brisket platter
Full rack of St. Louis ribs

review.des:
I am a BBQ person.  I'm always looking to find places outside of TX that are doing it right.  I heard Smoque was one of those places.

Tried the 3 meat sampler.  While at the counter I was distracted when I was told I was given some extra meat for free and didn't catch one of the gals who sauced my plate.  I couldn't be mad though, I mean free meat and all...

Brisket - great bark and flavor, fat was rendered perfect.  It's rare to find brisket like this out of TX, nice job.

Ribs- it's hard for me to judge them with the sauce.  They weren't sliced to that made it a little messier but overall they were good.  Not overdone either.  Great flavor.

Pulled pork - I have to admit I was pretty full by the time I got here.  It was good but nothing stood out for me.

Would definitely go back.  4.5 rounded up.

pics.caption: meat trifecta!

review.des: I absolutely love this place!!! Very nice atmosphere and darn good food!!! Mac and cheese is the business =)
We came by for a carryout of sliced brisket and ribs.  They now also have some outdoor patio seating (not sure when this came about, but at this point, it hasn't started snowing yet).

pics.caption: Storefront, now with some outdoor patio seating
Menu board, circa Oct 2014

review.des:
A really hole in the wall kinda place, it is infamous for its BBQ there is always a line but it's a Byob, so brings a glass of your favourite wine/spirit along and wait your turn

The staff is friendly and alert, we ordered the ribs they were tasty but slightly dry would have liked them juicer. Our friend got the brisket which was super tender an tasty.
The Cole slow is made with vinegar and pepper which is light and delicious

You get a table to still within a short wait, must try!!

pics.caption: Ribs
Yum town..!!

review.des:
* SMOQUE BBQ *

An excellent BBQ spot that I first saw on Diners,Drive-In's & Dives.

Everything is made from scratch, quality ingredients.

I had cornbread, Mac-n-cheese,BBQ brisket beans,brisket chili & BRISKET( a deep and rich smoke flavored brisket that is moist and tender )
You can order it in a platter or as a sandwich.

My friends ordered the RIBS & Turkey ( stole a bite of each )

OUTSTANDING!!!

pics.caption: RIBS,beans & slaw
BBQ Brisket!

review.des:
Nothing says promising quite like a large framed picture of Guy Fieri on the wall (....sike).

Luckily what Smoque does get right is their meats. The brisket is phenomenal, maybe even the best sliced brisket I've ever had. It was incredibly tender, almost feeling unnaturally soft as I poked my fork into it. The ribs probably appeal most to those that don't eat their barbecue with a preference. I'm no barbecue connoisseur, but cooking the meat with a dry rub seems to make the meat a little tougher than what I'm used to down in Southern California. It still packs in a lot of flavor, but I prefer my ribs a little more tender.

The sides are honestly mediocre to "pretty good" at best. The mac and cheese/the fries that I stole from a buddy were probably the top contenders. The brisket chili and coleslaw were kind of a letdown; the coleslaw being almost bland and the brisket chili not bringing anything new to the table.

This place gets packed in waves, so hopefully you don't get swept in with the crowd. Definitely add on the brisket for an extra $5, you'll be glad you did.

This bbq joint is way overrated. Yes the food taste is pretty good, but the portions are so SMALL, my 10 yr old can finish it and still be hungry. Hey guys, where's the BEEF. The sauces are very average tasting, and the parking in that area is very difficult. Great job on the Smoque, but terrible job on the portions! Will not return!

This place deserves every bit of their 5 stars...

FAST COUNTER SERVICE... Minimum wait for food maybe is 10 minutes, maybe.

Food is always hot and taste fresh, even if in warmer for an extended period of time.

Service : Always top notch, great staff, period, attentive and nice... You can always county on seeing one of the partners standing around in his usual eye glasses and Bluetooth in his ear overseeing everything, always willing to lend a helping hand or smile.

Crowds - This place gets crowded sometime and you may have to stand outside, this place isn't big... Go during a non-peak hour.

Food - Ribs, Brisket, Baked Beans, Macaroni and Cheese, Peach Cobbler are all TOP NOTCH! Perfect smoke flavor and visible pink smoke rings... Hell, the fries are even good, I can eat the fries all day and they give you a bag of them.

BREAD PUDDING - PLEASE MAKE THIS A REGULAR... VERY DECADENT and DELICIOUS!! Official menu item! Make sure you get it if they are still serving it.

Negative - It's way up north (irving park area) so it's not convenient unless you live near there. It's worth the trip but I mean, I'm looking forward to the time they relocate out south for us south siders. BBQ is getting big in Chicago, but only some meet the cut. Many newcomers are food truck ppl and novices, these people are killing the game right now. Don't be fooled by Q in the Goldcoast, Husky Hog in Bridgeport, or some of these uppity and expensive downtown and west loop places like Green Street Smoked Meats... This place has the QUALITY and FLAVOR at a great value, if not less than the competitors, the consistency of the food is always there.

If these guys moved to the Beverly area of Chicago, or even the up and coming Bronzeville or Hyde Park area, business would boom as there is a lack of good BBQ places, just hood bbq places that are take out (which are ok, especially Uncle John's on Cottage Grove) but not the most ideal....

Hey Smoque Owners, if you're reading this, check out the recently departed and vacant Panera bread space on 95th and Claremont in Beverly or the vacant used-to-be starbucks across the street or the vacant spots on 99th, 103rd, or 107th and Longwood off these metra stations, plenty of parking.

The best BBQ in Chicago, hands down. I have to honestly say, I never had anything bad tasting from here.  I've tried the ribs, pulled pork, brisket, beans, French fries, corn bread, coleslaw, mac and cheese and peach cobbler all have been outstanding!  Only think I'd change is to make the sitting place bigger by expanding.

Great little BBQ place in a cool neighborhood not far from downtown Chicago. Their ribs have a nice bark, and I love their half pulled pork / half brisket samdwich and their brisket chili. Great place to eat and walk off dinner and look at the great local architecture when the weather is nice.

One of the best chickens I had
Good service
The place is always but always busy make sure to order in advance for take out

I'm sad because I really wanted to like this place after hearing so many people recommend it.

Let's start with the problems. The baby back ribs were burnt or "charcoal" as my friend would say. Nice way of saying the meat was tough, dry, and crispy. Not a fan. The mac and cheese wasn't good & the corn bread was dry.

Pros: Staff were helpful clearing dishes.

Wouldn't recommend, but I'm hoping I just went on an off day.

Been trying to get here for a while and gladly finally made it the week after Christmas. These guys serve some powerful good hog and I lived in the south so I know my Q.  Will try the brisket next time but I judge my q joints on pig.  Nice bark on the ribs; tried the St Louis style.  Tried my daughter's pulled pork and it was also great. Sides are another key measure of a Q joint: great slaw, corn bread top notch with kernels of corn, mac and cheese nice crust on top and house cut fries also real good.  Wish they had a sweeter option on the sauce.  That said, these ribs were good enough to eat without sauce.  Will be back on my next visit.

There's not much more that can be said about this place that the last 1400+ people haven't already probably covered.  I had been here for the first time maybe about a year ago, but wasn't really blown away by the food.  I came back recently with a group of 7 and this time I got to try more of the different offerings and it was much better than I remembered.

I got a 1/2 & 1/2 platter (it's not on the menu) that consists of your choice of 2 meats (Pulled Pork, Brisket, or Texas Sausage), 2 sides, and the cole slaw.  I thought it was a great deal since the portions were not that much smaller than the full order.  I ordered the pulled pork & brisket which were both perfectly cooked and not dry at all.   The cole slaw is really light, it's not the stuff that's drenched in mayo, and goes really well with the BBQ.  The brisket chili & mac & cheese were also good.  The chili was a little lacking in the actual brisket but the flavor was there!

I have to dedicate a paragraph to the incredible service here.  You usually don't think about service too much from a place that doesn't have waiters but the guys & gals who work here are awesome.  They're quick to answer any questions you have and super friendly.  I was here on a packed Friday night with a group of 7, and usually at a place like this I'd expect to be separated with that many people, but thankfully they've devised a great system where there's someone to take down the number of people in your party and let you know where to sit once a table is ready.  The service even extended after I left the restaurant!  We were outside and one of the staff who was taking out the garbage helped out with a question he overheard us talking about, even going so far as to go in and ask one of the owners.

Overall great food & great service, definitely looking forward to coming back again!

pics.caption: 1/2 & 1/2 platter  - Pulled pork, sliced brisket, mac & cheese, and chili

review.des: This place has the tastiest, juiciest, most delicious ribs I've ever had. I had the 1/2 rack ribs Memphis style. The  ribs do look burnt but that's just the rub they put on it. You can tell time and love goes into making these ribs! Glad I stopped here on my winter Chicago vacation! It was worth the 30 minute metro ride from downtown!

pics.caption: Stamp of approval
1/2 rack of Memphis Ribs with Mac n Cheese, cornbread, coleslaw and baked beans
Menu

review.des:
I was finally able to visit Smoque after hearing about how great it is for years.
I give it 4 out of 5 stars mostly because it's more like eating in a high school cafeteria than a BBQ restaurant and the wait was pretty long as well.
Everyone was friendly and the food was very good. I tried both styles of ribs and liked them both but the baby back are more tender so I liked them better. The Cole slaw was not very appealing but it was decent. I like a decadent Cole slaw that's rich and creamy.
I look forward to going back to try more of their meats but I'll probably just get takeout next time.

The sliced brisket was really tender with a good amount of fat on them (but I enjoy a bit of fat on my meat). They actually put a lot of brisket in my sandwich which was great. The sauces are both pretty tangy because it's vinegar based sauce but they are tasty. One of them was spicier than the other which I preferred. The fries are seasoned really well. The chicken definitely has a good char and smoke on it and the meat inside is really juicy.

The prices are high but it's comparable to other bbq places in Chicago. I would try the ribs next time. My friends and I were able to get a table for 5 but when we were leaving, the line was out the door and people were standing around waiting for an empty table. It's not that big of a place so you might have to take it home to eat if you can refrain from devouring it in your car before getting home.

I am officially obsessed with this place. It's crowded on weekends, but not on weekdays! Weekday afternoons are definitely the best time to go if you want no lines and no waiting. I also must say that the lines during the busy times look long, but the wait time is never really that bad (and the food is DEFINITELY worth the wait!). Helpful hosts/bussers clear you a table while you wait in line to order, and once you've placed your order you'll have a place to sit (usually, depending on how busy it is).

All of the food is amazing but the Mac and cheese is amazing x 100000. It's just so great there are no words that can accurately describe its greatness. Also, I know it sounds basic, but the french fries are also awesome and perfect.

There is free parking in the back after 5:30. It's cool that they give you sauces from different types of bbq (Memphis, Carolina, etc.). If you haven't been here, you really HAVE to go, they definitely have the best bbq in Chicago hands down.

pics.caption: Mac & cheese, fries, chicken, slaw, and a chopped brisket sandwich.

review.des: Amazing food worth the wait. Definitely recommend stopping in when that BBQ craving sets in.

Well, this place is clearly not a secret. At 5:30 pm on a Saturday night there was a line to the door waiting to order. That gives you time to peruse the big menu board: all the usual suspects, essentially.

We were patient and finally made it to the front; meanwhile, an alert young man (the host, basically) was darting around determining the number of people in everyone's party and figuring out where they'd fit based on table availability. That's one game of Tetris I wouldn't care to play, and I'm sure at some point it involves a bit of "eat and get out" prodding.

Actually it didn't take us long to eat because you want to scarf down these goodies. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with one side (mac and cheese) and a "taste" of Texas sausage, plus the complimentary cole slaw. The juicy, succulent pork arrived atop a forgettable soft roll, with a choice of Memphis (sweet) or Carolina (vinegar) sauces in small cups.

The mac and cheese was tasty but lost warmth very quickly, clotting into an unattractive clump (the warming trays where everything is arranged must not be keeping up). The side of cole slaw was an unexpected delight: a sprightly but not overly punchy vinaigrette bathed the strands of cabbage and onions.

The one disappointment was the sausage: a thick, tough casing held a disappointingly mild meat with a really bland texture. This "taste" was a waste of $4, unfortunately.

This is not particularly cheap BBQ, but it is decent-sized portions. My friend got the platter (two sides, one meat -- in her case, brisket, beans and fries) and it was definitely plenty for two meals, unless you are a very hearty eater.

Lots of street parking up the block with no meters! That's something nice in Chicago...

Overall, this was an enjoyable meal, and now I'm apparently part of "those in the know" ;) So if you're looking for some BBQ, get in line and soak in the Smoque.

Had some Smoque today.  Have to say I was pleasantly surprised. I think I am almost ready for a let down when eating brisket outside of Texas. This time that let down wasn't that big, almost none existent.

Let's start with the brisket. Taste really good.  Bark pretty good.  Smoke ring really couldn't tell the was much of one.  Texture of the meat wad lacking a little bit as well as the color.  Perusal this was really good tasting brisket.  Some of the best I have had outside of Texas.  That is saying a lot coming from a bbq snob like myself.

Next up ribs.  St. Louis style. Good taste,  good smoke ring.  Just a little tough to get from the bone.  Might have came off the smoke to early.  

Sausage was good but it's shipped from Texas not made in house.

Sides,  liked the brisket chili and the bbq beans.  The beans were a little different from the usual but we're good.  The slaw I will pass as i didn't enjoy.

Lastly the sauce.  They have two both were good.  I actaully enjoyed the vinegar based sauce. Which is not the norm for me. But this que doesn't really need the sauce.  Which in my opinion is the best compliment you can give a pitmaster.  

This is a definite recommended stop if you love bbq. And if I am correct might even fit in to the bottom end of my top ten.

pics.caption: Brisket Chili, yes baked beans different but yes, slaw not so much
St.  Louis style  ribs,  good but did not  pull from the bone well
Really good brisket,  just missing out on being great

review.des: I saw Smoque on 190 North a few years ago and decided to give it a try. WOW!!!So glad I did. The food is amazing! A definite must have!
BBQ is really good! The portions are not great but they are filling enough. The space is small and crowded but overall worth it. Not a great eat in place but worth it if you get it to go.

Their brisket.....gawd. The best I've had.

I'm not a BBQ snob and didn't grow up with it. That said, I've had brisket at a bunch of spots in the city and this spot does it right. Go NOW!
Food is generally very good and fairly fast service. Had a few instances of tepid food especially the brisket. They do a huge takeout business as well. Overall it is good bbq and a friendly place

Small place. It can get tight as so many people love this place.
The brisket is to die for. My family had driven from Indiana through rush hour traffic just for the brisket that melts in your mouth and your hands. lucious!
Great place, amazing ribs!  Brisket was okay. Staff was very friendly. We will be back!

I wish I could put down more than 5 stars for this place. The meat that they make is SO tender. I've had a full rack of their spare ribs each time, and the meat falls apart perfectly.

Even the sides (the fries, the cornbread, the mac n cheese) blew me away. You can't go wrong with their soda selections too, since they have Lenin-ade and bourbon-flavored cream soda.

Overall, this is probably one the best BBQ places you could go to in the entire country. Its definitely a place you should take the trip to go eat at if you live in/are visiting Chicago.

First time coming here... totally loved the bbq ribs amazing ribs went here tonight while on the city.. went with a friend and we order the ribs and side dishes which were macaroni and cheese and coleslaw. Amazing food.. Will totally be coming back

I was very UNIMPRESSED with Smoque. I love Texas brisket BBQ, and this is no where close. The bark on the brisket was excellent, but beyond that, it was a total let down. I lived in central Texas; that's where I learned to love great BBQ. Now I'm in the Midwest, so whenever I travel, I'm always looking for the above average BBQ. Smoque is not above average, despite the soaring reviews. The first tip off should have been the smell - or lack thereof. Doesn't smell like smoke or wood outside the restaurant or even inside it. I got a pound of sliced brisket and a large mac-n-cheese. Beware, a "large" mac-n-cheese is 2 very small little containers. The sweet tea is pre-made syrup; they can't even brew sweet tea. I give 2 stars because of the good bark and because Chicago is so lacking in great Texas-style brisket that this is ok. I will never go back to Smoque.

pics.caption: The sauces are pretty good.
Looks way better than it tastes. I won't be going back to Smoque.

review.des:
Didn't quite live up to the hype.  

Pro's - it's BYOB which everyone loves.  Mac and Cheese was pretty tasty and I'm not a huge fan of baked mac & cheese with crumb topping. BBQ beans weren't bad either.  I enjoyed them the most of all the things I had.  I had the sliced brisket platter with two sides and I wasn't able to finish my last couple of slices of brisket and I was starving when I arrived.  

Cons - my biggest con was the the brisket was over cooked.  It was just falling apart if you touched it.  Also it had zero smoke ring on it and there was hardly any bark on my slices.  Also, not a fan of the cole slaw.  But then again that's totally cause I prefer mayo based coleslaw instead of a vinegar based one.  

Bbq sauces were okay as well.  Both the carolina and memphis still.  Neither stood out.

Three of us stopped here early last evening before a concert at Wriggly Field.  Parking was a little difficult, but we kept circling a couple blocks until we found a place.  The smell in the air told us we shouldn't give up on parking.  Inside the place is clean and basic.  The term BBQ Joint really fits. The type of place you can pick up your ribs and eat with your fingers.  This is a meat lovers restaurant, I think there was 1 salad on the menu.  You place your order at the counter and they call you up when it is ready.  Service was friendly and pretty quick considering they were very busy with dine in and carry out orders.  I had a chopped brisket platter with coleslaw, macaroni and cheese and corn bread.  They served it with a side of Memphis BBQ sauce and Carolina BBQ sauce.  Both sauces were excellent, with just the right amount of zing.    The brisket was exceptional, the coleslaw was delicious and the mac and corn bread were good.  Portions were large, and I was stuffed when I was finished.  One of my party had a brisket sandwich which she also rated as exceptional and coleslaw and fries which she rated as very good.  Our final person had a full rack of ribs which were so large he couldn't finish them.  He loved that they were very meaty with very little fat.  He had a side of chili, which was also meaty and he rated as excellent.  This was a great place to stop if you are traveling in to Wriggly for an event.  It's far enough away that you are not in all the chaos near the park, but close enough that you can get their quickly after your meal.  I highly recommend this place.

It's hard to find a good bbq place in Chicago, and this one it just that. Their brisket is some of the best I've had yet. I don't like ribs so I've never had it, but my boyfriend always gets it and loves it. The place can get pretty packed, so don't plan on going during peak hours. Parking is decent, we've always parked behind the place.

So I'm not exactly sure what all the hype is about. In Texas these types of places are all over the place and I suppose its a novelty to have on in Chicago. With that out of the way the food is not all that incredible. Is it good BBQ? Absolutely, but I can find at least 5 comparable sliced brisket places in Chicago. I was not blown out of the water.

The pros are the a la cart style with always included coleslaw, the quick prep, the control of tables so you have a shot at a seat (like Edzo's), and decent portions.

The cons: the neighborhood clearly hates having this place there as evidenced by the "no smoque parking" signs and disgruntled looking neighbors. The beans were not worth beans, and the cornbread was really crappy.

So the experience was overall pleasant but I would never make the trip to this place if I werent in the neighborhood.

This was my first time experiencing Smoque Bbq and had high expectations. I must say, this place gets pretty packed really quick. Came as a group of 4 and ordered sliced brisket platter, pulled pork platter, 1/2 chicken, gumbo, and peach cobbler.

My favorite was probably their pulled pork, however comparing Smoque BBQ to Green St Smoked Meats, I would rather go to Green St Smoked Meats. The sliced brisket was good, but seem to be dry. Their chicken was well cooked, and the gumbo was delicious! If you want some kind of dessert get the peach cobbler, you won't be disappointed.

Definitely SMOQUED to perfection, too smoked for my liking.. Actually, more like blackened.

I was hoping that the meat was going to fall off its bone the moment I bit into it while drenched in sauce.. Darn my imagination. We ordered the Rib Combo, and it was unanimous that the St Louis slab tasted better. However, Phil's BBQ in San Diego, CA is def 65828139271x better!

The cornbread was good tho.. lol

pics.caption: VERY smoqued ribs..

review.des:
Quite nice! Get the St. Louis spareribs for more meatier ribs - I couldn't tell the taste apart from the baby back which cost more and have less meat.

If you're looking for "healthy choices" you can stop now. It's fries or no potatoes at all. Not sure what's up with the salad... the menu description is nice but for $8 I hope it's one big salad. Sorry, don't know. Yet, I will gladly go there and hand over my $20something for their ribs. They do smokin right!

Man-oh-man the stuff over here is amazing it's like a well-oiled machine wherever the manager is there the better give him the God damn pay raise because he's got that thing working like clockwork and I've been supporting them for the last seven and a half years since they've opened since day one so make sure you guys stay there and keep the portions as big as they are because guess what I'm a hungry little Polak and I'm cheap nothing seriously it's not about the cheese I was just trying to be a smart-ass the great job great food and great customer service and please over Gozer tip the goddamn staff they're not your slaves or indentured servants they work especially for the ones that work the bussing area they do such a great job compliment them guys

Food is so amazing!  Been there twice and both times it's so good.  I'm gluten free and they are super allergy friendly.  One the chefs told me that he used clean knives, cleaned the area and my food was prepared with caution.  So for dinner my wife and shared, pulled pork (so tender and delicious), chopped brisket (super good), fries (which is the only thing they fry so I can eat), beans (delicious) and coleslaw.  We were absolutely stuffed with food leftover.

They are only a few miles from our house and we will absolutely be returning soon

Meat lovers unite! The brisket is so tender and juicy, it will not disappoint. You can get a smaller portion of brisket on a roll (which is super soft by the way), or you have can a bigger portion without the bread on a platter. So what did I get? The platter, of course! Then you can eat it with mac and cheese, coleslaw, cornbread, and candied jalapeños - and the meal is instantly off the chain. They give you different sauces, like Memphis style or Carolina style, but it doesn't really need it.

pics.caption: Brisket platter with mac and cheese, coleslaw, and cornbread.

review.des: My whole family loves Smoque. We've ordered takeout so many times, we know the menu by heart. You should know that this place never disappoints and that they do everything right!

Came with a group of 7 and we order family style.

We ordered:
1 rack of ribs
1 rack of baby back ribs
Gumbo
Mac and cheese
Coleslaw
Fries
Brisket
Peach cobbler
Pecan bread pudding

Definitely recommend the brisket, Gumbo and for some reason I really liked the coleslaw as well. Also make sure you get the candied jalapeños! Don't really recommend the Mac and cheese.

There was a wait and the restaurant isn't that big so if you're able to I'd recommend ordering to go. I can see why the locals like this place. It had a mom&pop charm to it and if I lived here in Chicago, I'd come back to satisfy my BBQ cravings!
The brisket was tender and juicy. The sides complimented the brisket really well. Can't wait to try out what else they have on the menu

pics.caption: Awesome briskett and slaw

review.des:
100% Hype and Complete Letdown

Quick preface:  Little Miss BBQ in Phoenix, AZ (yelp.com/biz/little-miss…) is hands down the best Texas style BBQ outside of Texas and when I moved from Phoenix to Chicago I was deeply missing all the smoky tender meats from that fine establishment.  So you can imagine my excitement when I read in this article (thrillist.com/eat/nation…) that Smoque had made the list along with Little Miss BBQ as one of the top 5 best Texas style BBQ outside of Texas.  I went in with some pretty high expectations but unfortunately they were not even close to being met.

That being said, let's get down to the review:

Memphis style bold BBQ Sauce (2/5)
Tasted of generic store brand BBQ sauce and was a bit on the salty side

Carolina style vinegar BBQ Sauce (4/5)
I'm usually not a fan of vinegar based sauces but this was surprisingly good.  The vinegar wasn't overpowering and it was a very well balanced sauce.  This went really with the pulled pork.

Brisket (2/5)
Dry, no smoke ring, and lacking in flavor.  How can you serve smoked brisket without a smoke ring?! Without the fatty parts this brisket would be inedible as the texture and dryness of the meat was comparable to that of canned tuna.  Did I also mention that this was completely lacking in flavor?  Easily the biggest disappointment of all the meats.

Pulled Pork (3/5)
Decently tender and juicy but once again lacking in flavor.  As I mentioned before this went really well with the Carolina style vinegar based sauce.  This was the best of the meats I had there but it was slightly above average pulled pork at best

St Louis Style Ribs (2/5)
Really good flavor and meat came clean off the bone but despite this, the meat wasn't tender at all.  The crust on the meat was was delicious and smoky but since the quality of the meat wasn't that great I would have to say this was still a bit of a letdown.

Mac and Cheese (1/5)
I originally ordered a small but was convinced by the cashier to get the large as this side "stood up above the rest".  Boy did I make the mistake by listening to her.  In my opinion the properties of quality mac and cheese must include 'ooey and gooey'.  This mac and cheese was goopy and the cheese/sauce had the consistency of creme brulee . Yes, creme brulee.  I love creme brulee but describing mac and cheese as having the consistency of creme brulee is absolutely something you do not want in mac and cheese.  Aside from the baked crust, I could barely taste the cheese flavor and as harsh as this may sound, this was probably some of the worst mac and cheese I've had.

Perhaps I just got a bad batch of food or something but I honestly have no idea how Smoque has a 4.5 star rating with over 3000 reviews.  Needless to say, it is pretty unlikely that I ever return.

We arrived at Smoque shortly before the dinner rush, which, trust me, get there before 5.30-6 or pay for it with smelling the BBQ and having to wait.

Lets start with the ordering process, which is a bit new and was confusing for some. You look at the chalk board when you walk in, and once you have your mind made up, hit the counter up and order things. You take up residence inside at a table or on the patio and wait for your number.

Waited for about 10 minutes for our order... half a slab of baby back, chopped brisket sammy, baked beans, mac-n-cheese, corn muffin, slaw and bread pudding.

Hearing your number called... Its like winning the lottery. Tears fill your eyes as you hit the pick up window and as you hit your seat, your tears of joy turn to tears for the dead pig you're about to destroy.

The ribs are good without sauce, but with their house bbq... dear, sweet baby jesus... they could cure world peace issues. Lets just put it that way. They have amazing chew, are lean, and pull from the bone perfectly. It's not melt away pull from the bone, but it gives you that gnaw needed to strip the bone and that's amazing.

Brisket... oh brisket... more. Need more brisket. Damn sitting not at Smoque and thinking of the brisket. The PERFECT brisket. It melts into the bun, and melts in your mouth. Such amazing flavor all around from the bit of flour baked goodness of the bun to the salty/sweet/briskety flavor of the meat and smoke. I almost cried when the sandwich was gone.

Sides... corn bread was amazing. Mac-N-Cheese is killer, slaw was not bad (I've had better), beans were killer - and even better when you put some of that BBQ in with them.

And.... the bread pudding. Order this, it may be the best bread pudding you EVER have. No joking that you'd get it here, it's absolutely fantastic.

I will forever be in debted to Smoque for this amazing experience of BBQ.

pics.caption: Ribs, corn bread muffin, mac-n-cheese and slaw. Then chopped brisket, bread pudding, slaw and beans

review.des:
Solid BBQ.  The brisket was so tender, and the sauces were great.  The ribs were a little underwhelming, though good, hence the 4 stars.  The sides are great.  Smoke sausage was delicious as well.  

Definitely will come back, great food!

Not bad at all. We had the brisket & pulled pork. The brisket was super tender & juicy. The pork had a bit of crispy skin mixed in, which I love. You get both a Carolina sauce (thin & vinegar based) and a Memphis sauce (thick & bold) with your order. Memphis for the win, hands down. Our orders came with two sides. I had the mac & cheese and the brisket chili. The Mac & cheese was the star of the meal. Pass on the chili. Overall, it's worth the trip.

pics.caption: Brisket with Mac & cheese and cornbread.
Pulled pork with Mac & cheese and chili. I should have gotten 2 Mac & cheese orders instead.

review.des:
This place is a little farther than my usual 5-mile-radius rule for dining out but definitely worth the trip! The pulled pork and beef brisket are to die for!
I know, just like what everybody else says, this place is always packed! Lines are ridiculously long and the wait is longer than normal. But the fact that people don't mind the wait and the line says a lot about the food!
Absolutely love the sweet BBQ sauce! The Ribs and Brisket are cooked to perfection. Also an absolute must is the peach cobbler it's the best I have ever had. Only drawback is the parking in the area.

I only have one gripe but this place.   I wish they had greens. The whole part about Smoque is that is BYOB. The BBQ here is pretty good.  The prices are incredibly reasonable and you can escape only paying about $15/person.  We ended up trying a little bit of everything with my visit here.

-The pulled pork was just but average. Nothing spectacular or work complaining about.
-The ribs were tasty. Tender but not facing apart. A nice bite. Excellent dry rub and you don't even need the sauce.
-The brisket was melt in your mouth tender and probably one of the best things we had there.
-The Mac and cheese was good but slightly to creamy for my taste.
-The baked beans were slightly sweet and had a meaty taste throughout.
-The chili was one of my favorite sides but could have been a little spicier.

Overall it was a pretty good experience and I would go back.
Brisket was great!!! But ribs were a bit burnt. Big portions. And they have a drive thru!!!!

After reading that Smoque was the best brisket outside of Texas, my expectations were a bit higher than they should have been. In reality, it was good, but not mind blowing. It was a bit dry, more crumbly than tender. The sauce was solid. Cornbread was dry, macaroni and cheese was standard.

The star of the meal was the bourbon pecan bread pudding, which was fantastic.

Service and seating were great, especially given how busy it was.

My search for good BBQ in the north continues...
Awesome bbq. Among our group sliced brisket was the best!  Cornbread was great, I subbed it for the coleslaw. Good fries. Peach cobbler was fun to try.

We arrived and there wasn't a line at all. We ordered and had our food super fast. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, French fries, corn bread and peach cobbler. The food was awesome! Loved it. I'd come back for sure. Would recommend this place to friends and family.

pics.caption: Pulled pork sandwich  French fries  Corn bread  Peach cobbler  All AWESOME!!

review.des:
Always amazing. Every. Single. Time.

I usually get the pulled pork with cornbread and the beans are to die for. The mac and cheese is real, you're not going to find that boxed crap here.
Yes, it gets crowded. Yes, there is usually a line but it moves fast enough and staff is always nearby to help with any questions.

I've never really cared to dine in but everything looks very clean. The food travels well and still tastes amazing twenty minutes later, though the drive is torturous from the beautiful smell of bbq and I have to resist the urge to pull over and just scarf it down.

Also, bread pudding. That is all.

Wow! What a surprise to have this down the street from us. We have only been once, but it is the best BBQ I've had in years!!! And us Texans eat a lot of BBQ! I have it 4 stars for the small portions. Otherwise, it was quick, clean, and tasty!

I first saw this restaurant on Diners, Drive Inns and Dives and had to check it out. Im a huge fan of BBQ so I need to try this place. I had a full slab of the St. Louis, the slaw, cornbread, beans and peach cobbler.

The ribs were delicious. A dry rub and the meat is so tender. The sauce was on the side and was also delicious.

The slaw was vinegar based, I was a huge fan of it. But if you prefer cream based, maybe not for you.

Beans were amazing and had bits of brisket in them.

Cobbler and corn bread tasted very fresh.

I paid $25 for it all, but it was very worth it. I took what I didn't finish home and was still good.

I have traveled to many BBQ cities and I've had great BBQ but never in my own city. I mentioned this to my wife and she surprised me with a visit here.

When we walked in we were greeted by Carlos aka Omar, who asked if it was our first time. I love it when a restaurant recognizes new customers and lends a helping hand. He was very helpful and recommended we try the beef brisket. He told us it was his favorite. I also thought his story about his nickname was cute. They call him Omar because there are too many other Carlos working there. It was funny how he delivered it.

So of course we ordered pulled pork...sorry Carlos/Omar. We also got coleslaw, Mac and Cheese and peach cobbler. Carlos then came over and he offered us two more sauces to dip in. I really loved the spicy BBQ sauce. It was really yummy. He even hooked us up with sweet jalapeño peppers. They were so good...I started eating them with my pulled pork.

The pulled pork was amazing. It was one of the best I've had in a long time. Carlos noticed we only got the pulled pork. I think he was sad we didn't take his advice. So he brought us over a sample of the beef brisket. Oh boy was it good. I am completely torn between two meats. I know next time I will get both.

The Mac and cheese was so good. The small side left me wanting more. I love the little individual foil dishes. Every container had the perfect amount of bread crumbs toasted on top. The peach cobbler was also fantastic. The crust was one of the best ever. I only wish I had a scoop of vanilla ice cream to put on top. Maybe management will add this for a summer treat. The Cole slaw was also very fresh tasting. I loved that it was not drenched in mayo but seemed to be vinegar based.

While we were eating my wife told me to look over my left shoulder. And there was guy hanging on the wall starring at me. Really? Why is he everywhere in Chicago? This is starting to get a little ridiculous. He should just move here and open a restaurant.

As we were leaving at 11:50am, a huge line started to form. We had beaten the lunch crowd. I also got to see Carlos in action. He not only welcomes guests and cleans tables but he is the enforcer too. Some guy was trying to save a table even though his party was at the back of the line. He very diplomatically informed the guy that he had to get others seated who were in front. I love that!!! Good for you Smoque for defending the rights of the hungry people needing a spot to eat. You have got this down to a science.

Some side notes...the neighbors do not like you and your cars. They have giant professional signs in the street informing you to not park in front of there houses. I found it kind of funny but understood. It only told me that the food was so good that people will risk there car for an amazing meal.

I loved Smoque BBQ...it was one of the better BBQ's I've had. I can hardly wait to come back for some more of this fantastic food.

pics.caption: Brisket Cemitas...special event sandwich between Cermitas Puebla and SmoqueBBQ
It's a special night tonight
Food lined and ready to roll!

review.des:
Best BBQ Brisket in town! Get it sliced! Come early or else you'll be stuck in the line. Get the platter with two side. Peach Cobbler And corn bread are really good! Take a bottle of their sweet and spicy BBQ sauces home!

You must come here!!!!

Overrated as hell...ordered a brisquett here once, it was moderate at best..i dont see what the hype of this joint is, there are waay better bbq places in the Chicago area like Smoke daddys and even Earls bbq.

Pork Ribs are the thing to get here. They have Baby Back and St Louis Style and both are executed well with good smoke, moisture and a unique rub.

St Louis Ribs - Good
Baby Back Ribs - Good
Sliced Brisket (burnt) - Ok
Mac & Cheese - Ok
Baked Beans - Good
Peach Cobbler - GOOD

Folks here like their sauce and like to dunk their meat into it.

They have a daily dessert special but the Peach Cobbler is pretty solid. It would be tough to pass that up.

Hubs and I made it here an hour before closing time last Thursday.  It still was pretty busy.  Everyone was super friendly which eminded me of some BBQ joints back home in NC.  Someone near the front will seat you after you order.  Of note, if you want to eat outside, you have to finish up right at closing time, but if you eat inside, you can stay longer if you want.

I tried the sliced brisket platter.  The brisket was good, but I've had juicier.  The vinegar-based BBQ sauce was pretty good.  Hubby's 1/2 slab Baby Backs a la carte were so tender, juicy, and delicious.  They took an extra 10 minutes to make, but they were worth it.  Since the platter already came with the slaw and 2 sides, we just split those and an order of cornbread, which was more than enough for 2 people.  The coleslaw was a delicious vinegar based slaw that had either celery seed or dill seed, which gave it a great flavor kick.  The mac & cheese was also very tasty.  The fries were the best side - freshly made, not to thick or too thin, just right with the salt, and dusted with pepper.  They taste just like my favorite Kettle Brand Krinkle Cut Salt & Freshly Ground Pepper Chips  Cornbread was extra - it's the kind with actual corn pieces.  Big plus that they have both types of ice tea - YAY!

Excuse me while I lick my fingers reminiscing before I finish typing up this review.

pics.caption: Brisket Platter with Coleslaw, French Fries, Mac & Cheese, and Cornbread (Baby Back Ribs 1/2 Slab in the background)

review.des: This place is the closest to Texas style brisket I've encountered in the city. Great to eat in or carry out!
A+ bbq! We ordered brisket, st louis ribs, baby back, and pulled pork (yeah, we ordered everything!). Oh, and fries too. Everything was great! St. Louis ribs are a must try!

My friends and I decided to come here for my birthday since I've heard so many good things about it. How can a Texan refuse bbq? Smoque honestly lives up to the hype. I've heard about it so many times from so many people that I honestly expected to be disappointed but I was not. Absolutely love this place and I'm so glad they have a location in Revival Hall now so I get easier access to amazing bbq. The four of us ordered 1/2 rack of baby back ribs, 1/2 rack of st louis ribs, 1 pound of brisket and 1 pound of pulled pork along with some sides. Didn't eat anything before or after this meal but it was so worth it. In fact, I might make this my birthday tradition from here on out. Just be wary of the wait times; we went around 1 or 2 in the afternoon and there was still a short wait (I can only imagine what it's like during peak hours). Still well worth the wait!

We have eaten at quite a few bbq places. This is certainly in the top few that we enjoy. When ever we are in the city, we typically stop here.  For any of you city folks in the NW  Burbs check out big eds. Eat their ribs and burnt ends and be very very happy!

As I am back at home in LA, I crave Smoque BBQ... It was one of the best things I tried in Chicago. When I went in for lunch, there was hardly a line and it moved very quickly. They take the party number in order to guarantee a spot before your food comes out.

The prices at Smoque BBQ are extremely reasonable and the quantity of a full rack of ribs is perfect for two to share. We ordered an extra side of brisket with our ribs, and I completely recommend this! It is the softest most delicious brisket I have ever tasted.

They have a variety of barbecue sauces so make sure you try them all! Eat the meat with the jalapeños, because that is what makes it delicious. It brings that crunch to BBQ.

The sides are much smaller than anticipated but the portion of the meat was big enough to cover our appetite. The mac and cheese is much too cheesy, the corn bread is amazing, the fries are perfect, and the cole slaw is fresh and delicious!

A must try place!

Smoque BBQ is my new favorite BBQ place.  My dad, who often complains that everything is "far," said that Smoque was "well worth the [50 min] drive."
